review: Honestly, it's pretty good. Probably a little overhyped, but that doesn't make this burrito mediocre! Got the cabeza regular burrito w/avocado "Dorado" style. Dorado style REALLY makes a difference, it's sooooo good. I'm particularly impressed by how quickly our order was received and delivered! Only waited probably a half hour to order and get our delicious burritos. Satisfied :)

This place totally deserves 5 stars! Great ambiance. The ability to choose music from a music app was awesome. Met some great people being that I am from LA and the servers bartenders and owner were all so friendly. Even bought us shots! Kept checking to make sure we were having a good time. Felt like we were old friends! We had carnitas quesadilla and omg to die for! •_The sauce served w it made it that much more amazing! I will be back on my future visits to SF!

We have been going for decades, not just years. •_It is our favorite Chinese Seafood Restaurant in CA. •_There Salted Backed Crab is a total winner, with a touch of class, a finger bowl to clean up with when your done.There pea green sprouts are the perfect compliment. •_Likewise, there clams and their lobster.It may be charmingly funky, but consistently good and considering how overpriced many of the restaurants are around Union Square, this is a port in the storm for business travelers. •_It has impressed our colleagues from Italy to Greece, with the great seafood. •_It's not flashy, but the food is fabulous!

Worthy of the hype!I ordered the original dry fried chicken wings ($12.50 for 12 wings) and came away very impressed. •_The wings are a good size, so don't get scared off by the price tag. •_The wings are coated in a delicious sauce but somehow retain a fair bit of crunch. •_I also ordered the chicken fried rice ($8.25) which was also excellent. •_It came in a huge portion and can easily be shared with 2-3 people. •_Also, if you only have 2 people in your party, try going San Tung #2 next door first. •_They have more tables that can only fit 2 people, so you may be able to avoid a massive wait time.

Very rude people. Was really in the mood for chinese food and I let my friend talk me into trying Emmy's once again. We got there and noticed that our total was still higher than expected (after doing math, and after we were rushed off the phone before getting total) They had the nerve to act like they never knew we wanted one of the items ordered over the phone to be part of our "free item for orders over $20 coupon". Told my friend that he "should have said so over the phone" - NO B#$%!, YOU SHOULD LEARN HOW TO LISTEN TO SOMEONE OVER THE PHONE. My friends' voice is the SAME as it was on the phone, which means they never really wanted to honor coupon anyway. The old jerk reluctantly changed the price/took off the item from the tab, which should have been done in THE FIRST PLACE. It's too bad they are so much of a local place so they can practically get away with such bad service, because our food experiences have been good, especially the Fried Rice and Honey Walnut prawns.Like I said before, if you're not gonna be happy about honoring coupons (or rush people off the phone once they ask about them) DON'T advertise them you pathetic unprofessional unethical jack-ass. Hopefully new owners take over soon once these guys finally have to take action from Yelp reviews.

I can only comment on the following:Atmosphere: bright, friendly, warm insideService: fairly fast, friendlyFood: did not purchase food, but my friend did and it looked like a big sandwich for the cost; I had a pomegranate ginger drink and it was good but that isn't special to Lou's Cafe.Bathroom: b/c we should always judge restaurants by their bathroom; clean, well-lit, easily accessibleWait time: there was always a line but it was a steady flow and not as long as purple kow's(!)

I *heart* cheese. And they use a lot of it.I also *heart* spicy salsa. And hark, for tis spicy. Unfortunately I do not *heart* tiny margaritas filled with ice and not much else for six dollars. Alas, for other than the above, it was your standard American-Mexican place, that seems to be created for the Fi-Di taste buds.Sighs...so close, yet so far away...
talian Restaurant|

Typical Chinese dim sum place. The wait is ridiculous and the tables are crowded but the food is worth it. They are quick and efficient when it comes to ordering and serving food. The prices are a bit high but the dimsum options are really good.

I've been here a couple times now, especially since it's walking distance from the stadium and I wanted to avoid overpriced hot dogs and beer (someone tell me what that's about!) at the Giants game. •_Honestly, if you're a big Mexican food eater like me, the flavor just isn't there. I ordered the steak tacos. •_For the most part it tasted like cooked beef and the texture was a bit tough. •_Some of my buddies love the beer, which I also thought was okay. If you've been to places like La Taquerria or San Bruno Taqueria (no affiliation, just like them), you won't find it very comparable. •_Prices are good though. •_Be warned seating is limited.
Finding a good place to eat in Chinatown is pretty hard but after living in Nob Hill for 3 years I found this late night treat to be one of the best.
Absolutely over rated!Ordered 2 house chicken noodles. Very salty, greasy, too much MSG. Rude owner. Will never come back.

Parking: Metered and street parking all around. Meters end at 6pm.Pork XLB: lots of soup. Very soft center.Seared chasu bao: a basic bbq pork bun was some sear. Id passBeijing noodles: this is a safe food. Id pass. Waste of stomach space.Shrimp toast: a chinese donut (the one you get at porridge) with shrimp paste inside. Its good but literally a shrimp paste chinese donut.Seafood gyoza: a very generous meaty shrimo dumpling. Amazing. Must get. Dip it in the white sauce. Dip it.

Food was consistent. •_The faux paux general tsao tofu-chicken was a bit flourly..it tasted like flour, literally. •_Otherwise the eggplant, friend rice, and hong kong styled noodles were delicious. •_Also the dim sum was fresh and pretty darn good for delivery. We will •_be back again, delivery was 20 minutes, can't beat that!Veggie egg rolls were very good too.

Ok if I had gotten better service i would have possible given them at least 3 or 4 stars, however the service was horrendous! We asked for a table outside on a Saturday afternoon, and luckily we didn't have to wait to long!!! After they seated us outside it took almost 30 minutes for our waiter to come out to see if we'd like something to drink. •_We ordered a glass of wine and water with ice. •_10 mins later the waiter comes back to take our order without the wine and without the water. •_Again I asked for some water with ice and she said she'd bring out right away. •_She took our order which included a salad. •_We ordered the meatballs, the steak skewers and a pizza. •_I wasn't feeling what was included with the steak skewers and the waiter offered to add some grilled brussels sprouts instead. •_About 15 mins later the meatballs came out and still no wine or water WITH ICE. •_Then about 10 mins later my steak skewers came out. •_I asked the server to please bring me some pepper, and he said he would, and I asked for some water WITH ICE. •_Finally about an hour after we sat down the wine came out, and she brought a bottle of tap water with glasses and NO ICE! I asked again for ice and our waiter said she'd bring it out. •_Another 10 mins go by and the pizza comes out and the brussels sprouts but still no ice or my pepper. •_By this time my steak is now cold, so I stood up and went over to the kitchen and grabbed some pepper myself. •_We were sitting outside and right inside the window next to us was the bartender so I got his attention and asked him for a glass of ice which he happily gave me. •_15 mins later the waiter comes by because we waived her down the first chance we could get, to asked what happened to the salad which we told her we were expecting first before our meals, and she responded, "In Italy they eat their salad last" WTH? We aren't in Italy!! We are in the US and we like our salads before our entrees. •_So she finally brings the salad out. •_ When the bill finally arrived, I was shocked to see she charged us for the brussels sprouts which she would give me instead, and for the salad which clearly she forgot. •_The food was pretty good but it was overshadowed by the terrible service we received.

A little bit of a wait but let me tell u.. they serve the best wings ever. I had the wet version of the wings which are coated in the sticky sauce yet the wings manage to stay crunchy. It tasted like a mixture of fish sauce and a caramel sauce. We also got an eggplant dish which was just as good, a sweet and sour soup, and the black bean noodles. I wasn't really a fan of the noodles. It was raved upon yelp but I've had better black bean noodles. I would come back here just for the wings! They offer a dry version too which I would like to try.
Gave this place another try. It's bomb. I definitely caught them on a bad night and am happy to amend my old review. As good as any pizza place in the city...outside of Tonys that is

Wow! The SO surprised me by making reservations here the other night and wouldn't tell me where we were going while on the drive into the city. Finally arrived here and was lucky to find parking! Located along Columbus is The Stinking Rose, a restaurant that boasts that they season their garlic with food. Nice! The SO had heard about it on FB from one of his friends who said it was one of her favorite places to eat. Little did I know, the SO had planned to take me there for my birthday! So sweet *heart eyes emoji*We were seated quickly thanks to the reservation and were set to order since he's been Yelping a ton and knew what he wanted. We ordered: Bagna calda aka garlic soaking in a hot tub of olive oilBraised short rib for himSpicy shrimp fettuccine for meOmg the garlic cloves in the tub were so melt-in-your-mouth. We ate the whole thing and immediately feared any close social interaction we would have for the next week. My entree was aight, I wish I had gotten something garlicky-er? His dish was awesome tho, short ribs were tender and pulled apart so easily. Service was also very nice. All the guys who helped serve us during our meal was attentive, kind, courteous, etc. The best part of the meal was when we ordered a thing of garlic ice cream. Lo and behold another surprise from SO as one of the guys puts down a slice of cake in front of me with "25" candles he was probably carrying in his pocket all day, and says to me, "Happy stinkin' birthday!" *heart eyes emoji intensifies*The cake and the ice cream were delicious. The ice cream came in a huge bowl and the scoop was as big as both my fists. Some patrons next to us even saw what we ordered and got themselves one too! In the end, I had a great experience at the Stinking Rose and hope to be able to come here again! Well, maybe when my garlic farts subside..

Great neighborhood Italian bistro with excellent food, cozy ambiance and attentive service - will definitely return.Burrata with prosciutto and arugula - 5 stars: creamy, fresh, simply outstandingSpinach salad - 3 stars: pretty standardSeabass ravioli with lobster reduction - 5 stars: innovative pairing and cooked perfectly al dente with little chunks of lobster in a light and flavorful sauceSeafood mixed grill - 4 stars: generous portions of grilled swordfish, salmon, prawns, veggies; very good

Fantastic, and this is coming from a person from Philly, which has some of the best Italian in the country. Gnocchi was great, setting was good, desserts were awesome. And they don't rush you. Great spot!
Portions were huge and food was really tasty. •_Only thing that was somewhat disappointing was the guacamole.

Americano aka Americougar This is usually our 2nd stop for our progressive happy hour. Americano doesn't have any happy hour specials, so we visit Palomino's for the drinks and food. After we're full and buzzed, the boys like to stroll down to Americano to go cougar-hunting. They have a nice patio, but its usually super packed if the weather is nice. Everyone's dressed to impress, but so far, I haven't seen anything that impressed me. Too bad their drinks are super expensive. Now, I've never actually purchased a drink here, but from what I've been told, they start off around $12 for a Hangar

This is definitely the 5 star of Chinese food take out. •_The food isn't overly greasy or salty and the health score is 94 out of 100 (huge for chinese restaurant).The egg rolls and hot and sour soup are good, standard fair. •_The pot stickers and crab rangoons are very tasty. •_A few people commented about the thick skin on the pot sticker. •_Yes, it's on the thicker side but I thought it was good for soaking up the sauces and enjoyed the doughy texture. •_Guess it's a matter of preference.I had the mongolian beef, 5 taste chicken, beef chow fun, all were excellent and I highly recommend. •_The mongolian beef was tender, nicely seasoned, and not greasy. •_The 5 taste chicken was so tasty. •_The chicken is perfectly crispy from a very lightly flour
I've been here 3 times in 3 years, and I've never been disappointed by either the food or the service. •_ Yesterday my son and I a light lunch - Prawn
terrible service, hair in my food, overpriced and food has no flavor. don't waste your time, take my word for this one.

Words cannot truly express how horrid the meal was...Mongolian Beef, how can you mess it up? Hmm make a cornstarch based sauce, add bell peppers and carrots and too much sugar... Don't add any green onion, or flash fried dry rice noodles, not nearly the right ratio of yellow onion or garlic. It was a hot mess and it sent it right back. My daughter's combination wonton soup came out first and she was practically done before I get t my meal... There was no order to when things came out, several people were waiting...and waiting...I should have followed my instincts and walked out. I ate a cold soggy appetizer that was supposed to be the house specialty... Guess what, the Mongolian beef was listed as the house specialty too...
Good place for California cuisine at lunch time for financial district area. •_Good serving portion and prices.

I was pleased with my take out order from here. I was looking for "Americanized" Chinese food. If you are looking for "authentic" you should stop reading and look somewhere else.We ordered pork potstickers, sesame chicken, lo mein, and crab rangoons. All were good except the crab rangoons (does anyone have a good crab rangoon place by the way? I still can't find ones I really like!) Anyways, I loved loved loved the sesame chicken. I always order general tso's and it was nice to try something different and have it be just as satisfying.I thought price and delivery time were reasonable and it was easy to place the order through Yelp/Eat24.Would order takeout from here again.

Yummy yummy is one of my favorite pho places in SF. I would have to say that the pho at this place is almost identical to my Mom's homemade pho. Even when I brought my mom here to try their food she even said the same thing. Which is now one of her favorite places to come to in SF when she is looking for something soupy. Another reason why I love coming here is that it a small pho place run by a family. The staff here is very consistent and every time I come get fast and friendly service. The owner here is super extra friendly and welcoming. He loves to interact with his customers which is a plus because where would you every get something like that. The only con about this place would be that it is very hard to find parking when it is crowded so be prepared for that. Overall if your ever in town and your craving something warm and soupy you should head over to yummy yummy!!!

Lady who does our facials recommended this place which was nearby. It was a warm day and my sister wanted Chinese style cold noodles. Restaurant supposed to be authentic Beijing style and Yao Ming known to frequent. Everything was pretty good. We ordered Beijing Cold Noodles, fresh hand-pulled noodles with just the right amount of chew to it served with julienned cucumbers in a sauce of chili oil, sweet soy, ground sesame sauce, and chopped fresh garlic. This dish was clean and simple. Many other places will add bits of meat or gunk into the sauce which takes away from the refreshing nature of cold noodles. This is the best cold noodle I have had. We also ordered the General's Chicken Wings which were lightly battered, crispy wings in a sweet and spicy sauce. Yum! We also had the beef pancake which was pretty good. To start, we had the spicy tripe and Hot and Sour Cucumbers. The spicy tripe looked bathed in chili oil, but the taste was off because it tasted like black peppercorns. The cucumbers were really good and were marinated in soy, vinegar, and chili oil. This vinaigrette went well with the tripe and as a dipping sauce for the beef pancake. We definitely will be back, but because of its location on Alemany just off of Mission, we won't be back until the next facial. If you are in the area and looking for Northern Style Chinese food like noodles or dumplings, you have to try this place. They also have a variety of other meat and veggies entrees.

5 Stars because I cant think of anything bad about this place. Other than they dont serve alcohol (but I dont really drink so thats okay with me).Great frescas -I got the watermelon one (so refreshing!)Fresh and tasty salsa - we added green chile sauce for a nice kick Tasty appetizers - we got the platter assortmentYummy flavorful entrees - I got the prawns. Came with rice, sautê©ed veggies and black beans. So much food!!Great dinner at a new hidden gem discovered.I'll be back!

I guess if you view it as a sport bar, it serves its purpose. But if you judge it based on the fact that it's a mexican restaurant then I would say it's ok - I've had better. However, in comparison to the other mexican restuarants that have recently sprung up in this area, I would say its one of the better ones to go to. So if you are in the SOMA area and wanted mexican food I would recommend this place next to (res agaves tacos - otherwise there are other better reatuarants in the area.

I've been to Mama's only twice. •_If you're going to brave the line, you better be in a brunch and waiting mood. •_My husband and I moseyed on over at 10 am and waited for 2 hours, which is pretty standard for Mama's. •_So do not go on a fully empty stomach because you will regret it, give up, and feel hangry. •_But if you do survive the 2 hours of looking inside wistfully like the little match girl, you will feel quite accomplished just to place an order and settle down.The French toast sampler and crab benedict were pretty good. •_I highly recommend the peach bellini. •_Not knowing when we'd be back (the stars have to align: mood for brunch and willingness to wait 2 hours), we took a slice of carrot cake to go. •_The guy in charge of the line grinned very warmly, as if he approved: "You will not regret it, my friends." •_And we did not. •_Surprisingly, the carrot cake was the best part the second time we went to Mamas. •_You know they made it from scratch that morning. •_The frosting was unreal -- even though the butter was real. •_The sugar was real. •_I'm sitting back right now, just thinking of that slice of cake...
talian Restaurant|

And our eating tour of San Francisco concludes with some of the best pizza around. Tiny spot in North Beach, sort of a metal vibe and shit for seating, but nice folks and killer pie. Try the Clam and Garlic, and anything with sausage and pepperoni! Great squares, they get focaccia dough right. Solid beer selection too.

Came here for dinner to celebrate the first day of the new year.Based on reviews, I knew this place will look nothing at all from the outside. •_Tucked between a liquor store and a gas station, it's easy to miss. •_But lucky me, we even got parking right in front of it. •_Place is small but has very nice setting, good relaxed ambiance, soft lighting, perfect for dates. •_Maybe if they added music similar to what they are playing at their website, it will add more to the romantic vibe they seem to be going for. Nonetheless, the quiet atmosphere was okay and this place is great for groups and families.We got a glass of wine each. •_I was excited there for a minute because they had Opus One. •_ But only by the bottle so I got a cab instead. •_We started off with the Spinacina. •_Although not a bad choice for a starter, there really was nothing exciting about this dish. •_I got the the stewed rabbit with polenta. •_Wow! •_As in, this won high marks with me. •_Tender meat, great heavy sauce, good balance with the side of vegetables and the polenta. •_My friend got the salmon fillet in saffron sauce and it was enjoyed plenty.My dish was a really good portion, I was so full, but I refuse to not have dessert. •_It's the best part of the meal after all. •_So to finish off the meal I got the puff pastry topped with whipped cream and chocolate sauce. •_I would have preferred this warmer but it still made me excited, just watch me take spoonfuls of it. •_5 stars for customer service. •_From my phone call to make reservations to the entire dining experience.The meal for two totaled $100 with tip. •_I will definitely recommend this place.

Had to try the cioppino - wonderful. •_Two of us (two hungry adult males!) split the dish - plenty for both of us. •_Nice glass of wine, very tasty bread and great service (fast and friendly). We went for early lunch - a few locals were there - by the time we left, mostly tourist crowd.
best shumai in town. Super meaty and juicy.If your just to-going some dim sum or stoppin by for a quick bite then this is the place.Add a vitasoy to complete your meal

There is simply nothing to report about Tia Margarita that hasn't been said in any previous review.As someone else mentioned, the food isn't terrible, it's just not worth traveling across town for.Special note for the kitchen: Back off the salt!
Yummy food.. I had the vegetarian potato dish with mushroom •_and tomato sauce ... Literally ate the whole dish and wanted seconds.. Worth it

This place is about 8 minutes walking distance from my work, hence the frequent visits!They HAVE Huge portions! My favorite is the the quesadilla ( both steak and chicken). It is super flavorful, flour tortilla was super crispy, and they put the sour cream, guacamole, and tomatoes on the side which is EXCELLENT. Prices are really affordable for such great quality.I love how they provide you free chips and they have a variety of sauces for you. I love the most upper left sauce because it taste like watermelon:p.

I used to order house meat pizza and spaghetti with meat sauce.Recently I discovered their turkey sandwich with avocado and cheese, so yummy, the French roll is crispy outside and perfectly soft inside. I can't live a whole week without one now.Fettuccine with baby clams are also good. •_Sautê©ed mushrooms are the same mushrooms in their grilled burger but only 5 dollars for a medium large bowl of them.Fast delivery too.

I love this place and I have been going here for years. Super hot salsa, well seasoned carne asada, chips are crispy and their drinks are strong. Excellent selection of beer too. I LOVE the decor! Very lively and down to earth atmosphere. It's well worth the wait. El Toreador has a soul and character that stretches back for generations. To the good folks at El Toreador, if you are reading this, don't change a thing and keep up the good work!

Got here on saturday noon after our routine weekend workout. Tables were filled but some were still available. The waitstaff who took our order and delivered the food were nice and smile to us. Food were awesome. We tried no 27 thin egg noodle with shredded chicken, no 4 thin egg noodle with braised duck leg and fried fish cake. The fish cake were just good, not great. I love the noodle since it reminded me a lot with the indonesian noodle back home. Very tasty. Put some more pepper, chili oil and soy sauce to make it bolder in taste. When our drinks arrived, the server just put it on our table and left without any smile or word. Surprisingly, the sour plum juice that we ordered was smashed chunks of sour plum with sparkling water. Well, i'm not expecting a sparkling water to be juice. Note that there's no explanation on the drink section. But it wasn't bad, so i don't bother to give a complaint. Too bad the server who gave us our drink and check (the same person), just put our check without saying anything, not even seeing us. She was so friendly communicating with the next table guest. I guess we need to be able to speak vietnamese or chinese to get her attention. Will give them 5 star if not because of the sour plum 'juice' and her.
Love this place. Great for dinner. Lively, warm, and attentive atmosphere. Authentic Italian.

I pass by Flour + Water on my walks home, always thinking to myself "I should eat dinner here." I finally cracked down and made a reservation for three, a few weeks in advance. They were kind enough to wait to seat us, even though I arrived 15 minutes late, due to SOMA traffic.I don't know any Italian--not even food Italian--and I think the waitress picked up on it, because she offered to explain everything on the menu. She even obliged my lactose intolerance (one wonders what I was doing coming to an Italian restaurant in the first place, if I can't eat dairy), and suggested that I tried the rabbit. It was delicious.My friends both ordered pasta, and from the few bites I tried, it was great. Very robust and fresh tasting. It's great that their menu changes every day, but I guess that's an expectation for a place where the size and cost of dish are inversely proportional. Overall, a lovely evening.Strange bonus: the bathroom is really pretty.

Had a craving for a porchetta sandwich so called in a couple sandwich boxes to go from their takeout menu. Ready in 10, you can save time by going strait to the bar to pickup and pay instead of their hostess. Basically, if you do not know about Porchetta, you don't know shit. •_For $11 the porchetta came with a warm arugula/fennel side salad and some pickled vegetables (celery, cucumber, etc). The flavor on the pickled items was intense like biting into a lemon type of way. The porchetta was pretty good, I'm a fan - 4 stars. Thick slices of tender and savory roasted pork wrapped in a foccacia like roll. I would have liked a little more texture and bite to the roll's crust since it was soft all around. The sweetness from the peach and red onion offset the arugula. I found myself missing the crunch from the pork skin and herb flavor from Roli Roti's version though. (yelp.com/biz_photos/Wd5h_Ü_)Barbacco's better sandwich imo is their roasted lamb - 4.5 stars. Tender lamb shoulder with garlic confit, mustard greens and fennel. The lamb had intense lamb flavor without being excessively gamey. My coworker who isn't a real fan of lamb liked it. Everything worked to create a sandwich I'd come back for. (yelp.com/biz_photos/Wd5h_Ü_)The ipad menu and cool industrial decor would make this spot cool for a date night. 4.5 stars.
Almost an entire year ago, the girlfriend
ar|

I was ecstatic at the prospect of dim sum without the hour-long Sunday brunch wait-- but after digging into my $5.99 takeout box, I was less than thrilled. Every single food item was COLD! I got about 8 items in my box. The siu mai and char siu bao were the best items on the menu (good but not the best I've ever had). Definitely cheap and quick so if you're in the area and need a fast meal this is the place. No seating except a tiny table in the back for 4. It's definitely no fancy ambience like Yank Sing, just a small hole in the wall. If the food were hot I'd definitely bump up my review.

this joint gets a high rating just for the salt and pepper squid. •_i honestly don't remember what anything else tastes like nor do i care cuz i'll go back here again, again and again just for that. •_hooray!

I'm always down for a bowl of fishball noodles - this place does a really good job of it and the coffee shop ambience reminded me of local coffee shops back home in Singapore. Tip: order your noodles dry (it comes with a side of soup) and squirt some of the tomato sauce in and mix them up!
Excellent and courteous waiter that was the bartender that substituted as the waiter last night. Did the Sf Restaurant Week special, apps, tacos,
No seating for 2 people at the Tables yet everyone else had 2 people at a Table. Had to sit at Counter in a supposed upscale restaurant
Good quality food for a good price. •_This restaurant does an incredible take out business. •_The food is fresh and the restaurant is clean. •_It's a great place to eat

Food here is very subpar. I had high expectations coming here and it did not satisfy me at all. Seafood cioppino-not too great. I felt like the broth has a lot missing. Maybe more spicy? Not sure what it was but it wasn't too tasty as the one from FOG HARBOR. And for $40 I expected more from the dish. the broth tasted like it was from a can almost. Fried Oysters-pretty good. Presentation was nice but could be a little more juicy. The lemon aioli was super delicious though Clam Chowder -probably the best dish here, it was very creamy and delicious filled with lots of clams. So it's a must order Not sure if I will be coming back here but I had to give it a try.
ar|

We used to order delivery from this place all the time, but they've since stopped offering it. Sad emoticon. Their squid ink pasta had lots of good seafood in it. Their salmon pasta was surprisingly rich and my favorite version. I hope they will open their doors to delivery again!

54 Mint is my favorite Italian place in the city right now. We live next door so I'm embarrassed to say that we've only gotten takeout - always throws them for a loop because they don't really do takeout, but are super friendly about accommodating. The owner is a sweetheart.I used to work at an Italian restaurant and I think the food is pretty fantastic. So much flavor and technique here:The gnocchi w/the meaty sauce and the carbonara are excellent. My absolute favorite thing on the menu is the black kale salad, which they adapt seasonally. The octopus carpaccio is like nothing I've had before - so tender, fresh and light. The clams appetizer is a favorite - delicious sauce w/a bite that prove you don't need loads of salt to create great flavor. I even really enjoyed the perfectly cooked, tender skirt steak, which came with flavorful broccolini and potatoes...and I'm not a red meat person.I'm dying to try the seafood stew and unfortunately they can't do it as as a takeout item...so looks like I'll need to actually sit down here soon and update my review based on the service and experience.

My sister and I only had the first course meals: Ravioli con Pomodoro and Linguini Alle Vongole. •_The food may come off almost as bland to us Americans, as it did at first to me. •_However, I gradually found my linguini to be flavorful, actually, and very light. •_My sister appreciated her ravioli for its authenticity, as it reminded her of some of the meals she's had in Italy. •_Neither of the meals were not too greasy or "Americanized," and unlike many other restuarant foods that leave me thirsty and tired, I actually came out feeling healthy and happy. •_Our waiter, who probably was the owner or the manager, was very kind and let us dine before the restaurant opened. •_His thick Italian accent and mannerisms matched the decor of the place. •_The place was nicely decorated without giving off a snooty vibe. This restaurant definitely had what I would imagine to be the ambience and the flavors of Italy. •_It is not the cheapest restaurant out there, though, so I would reserve it for a date or a get-together with friends/co-workers. •_I plan on going back and trying a full 4 course meal someday.

This place is awesome. Their food is delicious, they are beyond friendly and their flat bread is amazing. It's cheap and quick, not a fancy place but exactly what I was looking for. Matilda is so friendly and shows all her guests a huge smile. Matilda and her co-workers contributed to our amazing experience. Only downside is they don't serve alcohol. If your looking for amazing food in a no frills restaurant, stop on by!

I've been wanting to try this neighborhood place for a while. •_Really cute place. •_Small. Has an up stairs, but downstairs is so nice with the Huge windows. •_You can watch the cable cars! •_It's a cozy restaurant
Great place for authentic hotpot. Chatted with the owner Allen. He has spend a lot of time working on the soup recipe. The soup of the hotpot is made from slow cooking a lot of bones

Great pizza but getting tired of 1-2 hour wait. Told it was 45 mins then got the text in an hour but still faced a 45 min wait until the dudes at our table sipped full beers. Don't text a table is ready if it's not. Kids were miserable after an hour and went next door. Only for the young and childless!

It's a little far from where we stayed in union square, but we are so glad we found this hidden gem thanks to a google search!! I can't believe this place isn't packed right now! The atmosphere is awesome- the hodgepodge of furniture gives the feel of being at home and the staff is super friendly! We came two nights in a row after other dinner plans fell through! Food is amazing and seriously try a "Mexican Mule" cocktail!

As a lover of thin crust pizza, I must say I was almost converted after eating deep dish at Little Star! Ambiance: typical for most SF restaurants, this place was pretty small and the entryway definitely felt cramped while my group was waiting for a table. That being said, the actual dining area was spaced out well and I never felt cramped! Service: Very friendly staff! LOVE that you can order your deep dish ahead of time while waiting for a table. By the time our first appetizer had come out our deep dish was already on the table! Food: We ordered two appetizers to start- •_the chicken wings and the garlic cheesy bread. Both were pretty standard, nothing too special. The pizza though was delicious! We were able to do half-half and ended up ordering the "White" and "Little Star". The pizza was well balanced, but the star was the crust - provided great texture in contrast to the cheese! We also ordered the warm brownie to share for dessert, but it was only so-so and I probably wouldn't get it again. Overall, my pizza craving was definitely satisfied and this is a great go-to place if you are a deep dish lover! Would love to come back and try their thin crust!

Great good! Fast service and awesome salsa bar at lunch time! They offer free chips and whether you eat here or order to go during lunch! The servers are always friendly ad they are quick to clean up a table to make room for new guests! Try the juices: they have fresh watermelon juice and hibiscus. Both •_are light and refreshing without being too sugary! They also have horchata!You've got to try the orange salsa! It's the best one!
discriminatory establishmenthas restrictions on service animals! do not follow laws accordingly. disabled persons beware.

Since my introduction to El Farolito, I come here a lot. And I do mean a lot. Because I live nearby, it's no problem for me to drive by when the hunger pangs call and I feel like eating something really really bad for me at 12-am. I've noticed that since coming here these past few years the quality has gone down a little and I no longer want to finish the other half of my Super Carne Asada Burrito. Instead, I've been getting the Super Carne Asada Tacos instead. Just the right proportions for me and a little lighter than the super burrito. Their salsa bar is awesome, especially the pico di gallo. It has the perfect amount of heat. I love that I can get as much as I want because I use so much it's like I drink the stuff. Speaking of drinks, the Strawberry Aqua Fresca is sooo good. It's the real stuff, cause when you get to the bottom, you get all the seeds and everything.

I went to Yank Sing on a Sunday around 10am with a friend to celebrate a belated Chinese New Year for the both of us. The restaurant was relatively filled for an early 10am dim sum. We ordered off the carts and got around 11 dishes between the two of us. Everything was perfectly authentic and I was pleasantly surprised that they did individual servings of Peking Duck with buns and Chicken Lettuce Wraps. I have never been to a dim sum place that does this and it really solidified my enjoyment of this restaurant. I think there was also a special set menu for Chinese New Year because one of the ladies pushing the dessert cart told me that the Milk Tea Pudding was part of the set menu. Upon seeing how sad I was about that, she still let me order a serving of it. The pudding was very creamy and the milk tea taste was strong and authentic. It was really nice of her to allow me to order it and I enjoyed it immensely. This restaurant is definitely more on the pricey side though; for two people, it came out to be around $100! We each paid around $60, including tip. I've definitely had cheaper dim sum that is around the same quality, but I think the individual servings and the dessert really pushed this restaurant to 5 stars for me. I would probably come back with a bigger group so we could order more and try different dishes.
Went from a loyal "House of Dim Sum" fan to Deliclous Dim Sum. •_No misspellings there, that is what their banner says. •_No microwave, just plain, old steam.Five stars all the way.

The ensalada jimacan was ok but not special. The pork belly tacos were nice. Two of us already got their food while our friend was waiting for another 15 minutes. Funny enough that the waitress came by asking if everything were ok which should that she did not really pay attention.

I ordered delivery via their website, which is a bit more simplistic than their beautifully-designed menu. It was hard for me to find "steamed rice" on there at first, but once I did, everything went smoothly: reasonable prices all-around, good coupon offers, and a good variety of dishes.It's too bad they didn't take advantage of the web as a way to give more detail about the dishes, because had I known their version of Cashew Nut Chicken came with bell peppers, I would have asked for them to be removed--one of the people I was eating with was allergic and couldn't eat the dish at all! It's nice to be able to specify any special comments/requests about the dishes when you order, but only if dishes are prepared the way you expect, and ours weren't.The other dish, Sweet and Sour Chicken, was good, but it was mainly chicken and onions. There were a few bell peppers in there, but no other vegetables, and no pineapples that I could find, which is often my favorite part of this dish!The steamed rice was good--not too dry or too moist, and we got plenty to go around for three people at only 75 cents a serving.Delivery was prompt and polite.

I go there for years and used to be a fan. The portion in the past was quite generous and the food taste good. Recently, I don't go there too often because the portion has been reduced, price has raised which I don't feel surprised. However, I do mind my food not hot enough. It seems that the dumplings are just been taken out from freezer and stuck in the microwave. The filling is still cold while the wrappign is just warm.Moreover, they are a bit under-staff. Usually, I have to ask several times to get glasses of water, spare bowls or napkins. Sometimes, I just go to grab it by myself from the racks next to the cashier.I do like the iced red bean drink with milk. Watch out for the MSG though.

Staying in Chinatown, naturally I had a hankering for Chinese. The Hilton recommended this place to me, and boy am I glad they did! The pan fried dumplings were fantastic! I really liked the way they served the wonton soup in a single large serving bowl; enough for my friend and I to split. Finally, the Kung Pao chicken was terrific. The decor is a little dated, but don't let that stop you from coming in.

The food was great and the servers were cute -- not a bad start.Not really sure why my meal needed to come out on a plate the size of a large pizza -- it quite literally encompassed the entire table. Also, as other reviewers have mentioned, the salsa is pretty spicy for a restaurant -- usually you gotta know somebody in the kitchen in order to get salsa this spicy. My concern with the salsa is that it comes out in a mini carafe which was a nice thought at first. How nice, I thought to myself, I won't have to ask for more salsa if I need it! But then I realized that this means either a) they re-use the salsa from table to table or b) they throw away a LOT of salsa. Either way, I'm thinking something needs to change.

Things I love about Pedro's:-The space is awesome. Exposed brick, flat screens everywhere you look, tons of places to sit, including a huge balcony.-Our server, Stephanie, was very sweet and smoking hot. And let's face it, that can go a long way when attracting your neanderthal sports fan (eg. Phil H.)-Food, for the most part, was pretty decent. Definitely a good option for a pre-game bite....we really enjoyed the nachos grande with chorizo.-Food prices seem to be in line with typical, pre-game dining options: think $10 for a big plate of nachos, $3 for 'street tacos', etc.-Location! Location! Location! Right across the street from the ballpark, you really can't get any closer than Pedro's.Things I hated about Pedro's:-Serving food on paper plates, with plastic utensils, and drinks in plastic cups. C'mon, we are paying restaurant prices, treat us like adults and give us really plates and glasses.-My 'Cadilliac Margarita" was WAY too sweet. And at $10, just not worth it.-$18 for a pitcher of Bud Light. Wow.-No happy hour on game days - we're sneaking out of work early to start drinking before the game, would it kill you to knock a buck off before say 6pm?The good out weighs the bad so three solid stars. With such a large space if you get there on the early side you should have no problem grabbing seats either at the bar or at one of the many tables available. But based on our one pre-game experience I think Pedro's definitely needs to step things up if they want to attract crowds when the Giants aren't playing across the street.

This is a great spot! I met a friend here after work and generally shy away from FiDi spots b/c they aren't my style. This place definitely has more of a FiDi feel and is a bit pricy but I felt like the value was there for the money. Really nice wine and the portions were generous for SF. We got a salami plate, cheese plate the brussel sprouts and cauliflower. All were excellent.I did knock off a star because my friend needed to get out and catch a flight. We didn't want to be too demanding so we ordered virtually no-cook food and asked they not wait to bring anything out. This worked well and the food came fast. That said it was much too difficult to get anyones attention when we needed the bill. We asked for it a good 15 min before we needed it and it took every second of that and more to finally get it from someone.

Standard dim sum at cheap prices. I opted for this place because waiting for Dim Sum restaurants like Koi Palance on weekend mornings suck! If you're looking for a sit down restaurant with the normal full service carts and tea THIS IS NOT THE PLACE.Sitting space is very limited and •_you have to order beforehand (cash only!) and when it's your turn to order you better know what you want. The people working were all women and very rude.Anyways, I overlooked their loud rudeness since Asian places tend to be like that •_despite them yelling at me for being unsure of what I wanted and wasting time -_-BOTTOM LINE: if you're mad cravin dim sum and don't want to wait and just want to get in and out, then this is the place.
talian Restaurant|

This review is specifically for their AYCE hotpot - first of all, the selection of ingredients is a lot less than other places. •_Second, they're stingy with the condiments, after the first two bowls of chopped green onions (we were sharing amongst 7 people), they stopped chopping and gave •_us the long stems - that we had to tear apart to fit into bowls. •_The restaurant was half to 2/3 full, and it took so many requests and so long to get meat that a member in our party had to complain very vigorously before we finally got what we'd asked for, but by then the meal was basically ruined. •_It's unfortunate, because their dim sum is pretty good. •_I had a better experience at Boiling Hot Pot on Geary.

Wow, where do you even begin. The options here are amazing. I usually do a BYO with the sliced sourdough. It tends to not be as huge as the sourdough roll. •_You have to get the Lou's Special Sauce. So yummy! All of their ingredients are so fresh. While you wait for your order you can usually see the boxes of fresh veggies arrive. Love all of the chip and drink options! They have three different brands of chips and with each of those they have multiple flavors.The dining area is small and there can be a line to order. However, you can call ahead and if you wait it out you can usually find seating for two. Can't wait to go back again and again.

3.5 stars.I've been wanting to eat here ever since a coworker and I passed by during a lunch-hour walk. I love the look and openness of Mint Plaza, it makes you feel like you're somewhere other than SF. Last week my gnocci-loving bf and I had lunch here. It was hot and balmy, and there was live music in the plaza, which made outdoor dining even better. He ordered the pre-fixe lunch with lentil soup and gnocci, while I had the carbonara.I found my carbonara a bit too salty (probably from the generous amounts of cheese and guanciale) but the pasta was al dente and perfect. My bf's gnocci was tender and the ragu was tangy. The lentil soup was also very good, with the lentils cooked just so and not mushy.Service was good, but a bit slow. I'd return, but would try something other than the carbonara!

f yea. this place never disappoints. amazing HUGE sandwiches, for a really affordable price (or I just don't spend that much time in the richmond anymore). •_Definitely make a point to stop here when I'm in the neighborhood, just make sure you check the hours since it closes kinda early.Do: get the special sauce. get the dutch crunch bread. get this everyday if you can.

All tacos should be made Nick's way. A solid Nob Hill neighborhood spot with great tacos. Cash only or LevelUp (payment app). They had $5 strawberry margs on Cinco de Mayo which is an easy way to my heart.UPDATE: I was just informed $5 strawberry margs are a thing EVERY Monday-Friday during happy hour...thanks Nick's!

I'm from LA where Mexican food is abundant and authentic. So when I was up in the Bay, I was feigning for a burrito and asked about a good place where I can get one. Friend said Papalote because it has won awards. A mexican joint winning awards for their burritos?!? OK, I'm game...I was gonna get the carne asada, but friend told me to get the SOY RIZO. A vegan burrito??? I put a 'super' order on it and this burrito BEATS all the late night taco trucks in LA - HANDS DOWN! I love me some Sunset

My boyfriend and I arrived 10 minutes early to our reservation and chose to stand at the bar with some cocktails while we waited. We agreed their Bloody Mary was the best one we've had (and we are real Bloody Mary fanatics!) Everything we ordered - the handmade ricotta gnocchi, tempura'd vegetables, tuna bocadillos, spaghetti with fresh vegetables, oysters - was insanely fresh and skillfully prepared. The integrity of the individual ingredient shines through in Zuni dishes. They were also nice enough to split the gnocchi into two plates for us when we asked. Our waitress was very attentive the entire meal.Pricey? Yes. Small portions? Oh yeah. But I feel this place is worth it for the occasional splurge. And they've got a dry pear cider that I'm crazy about.

I noticed this place just by walking by. •_It was close to our hotel so I figured we should try it out. •_My gf and I are from LA, so we have had plenty of good mexi food. •_When we walked into this place there was a wait of 45 minutes so we opted for the bar seating. •_The bar had a few openings so we sat right down.I ordered the Chicken Mole which was beyond good. •_Normally I don't even eat Mole but I heard I probably have had the wrong ones. •_So, I figured I'd live on the edge. •_This one was really good. •_Not too sweat either. My gf ordered the quesadillas which aren't on the menu, they were really good. •_The cheese and tortillas were very juicy. •_We also ordered the house margheritas which were real margis. •_These were no wanna be margis. •_They had real lime in these. •_I wasn't expecting real ones. •_They were phenomenal. The bartender was very personable and warming.Instead of chips and salsa they give you tortillas and salsa. •_I felt the salsa could be a little hotter but that's my preference. •_I also like chips instead of the tortillas. •_Therefore we ordered the quac/chips. •_The quac was really creamy and good.

Mmmmm I quite enjoyed the al pastor nachos from here. It was a massive plate of chips, tomatoes, avocados, and savory al pastor pieces blended in with cheesy goodness. Oh my this is probably the perfect drunchie you will find if you are bar hopping around the mission area. There was a constant line of hungry customers even while we were eating and everyone seemed to really enjoy their food. I thought this was comparable to the Mexican food I've had in San Diego although I didn't try their tacos or burritos.

This is my first visit to the mission location. I've been going to Taqueria Cancun for about 13 years. I usually go to the one on Market and 6th and didn't know there was another location until my last visit to the city. First and foremost, Taqueria Cancun is my favorite restaurant in San Fransisco. Not many people equate the Bay Area with amazing Mexican food, but they are so mistaken. Taqueria Cancun makes some of the most legit Mexican food ever. It rivals anything from Southern California. My go to meal is 2 Super Tacos with Carne Asada. They are essentially amped up versions of street tacos. They come with usual fixings, onion and cilantro, but they take it to the next level with cheese, sour cream, and avocado. The carne asada is tender and flavored to perfection. Top of your meal with a coke or a beer and you are set to go!
talian Restaurant|
Date
Great ambience, awesome drink menu, good chips

Best pizza in san francisco. Took friends here from souther California and they loved it. Crust is made of corn meal and the Matt Cain pizza is to die for. Traditionally you would eat pizza with your hands but a fork and knife were needed as i savored every bite of deliciousness. Service was fantastic and if you have kids they sometimes play movies on a projected screen. Dont expect fast food as you will normally wait 45 mins at time of order. But their time and effort on your food definetly shows how much they care with each bite

We ordered food via delivery and were very pleased. We'd been looking for tasty Chinese that would fulfill our mainstream cravings (potstickers, Mongolian beef, lemon chicken) and this place totally hit the spot. Based on previous reviews, I wondered how good it would be, but we were really happy with the food, service, etc. •_We'll be ordering again soon I'm sure!

Definitely order to-go here. Their house noodles are on point and prices are cheap!If you do have the unfortunate displeasure of dining here, be prepared to be rushed out the door. Seriously, nothing would make them happier than for you to eat it and quit it. Sit as far away from the stove as possible to avoid getting splattered with cooking oil. If you get chewed the eff out by the ladies behind the counter, your Yamo experience is complete.
Cafe|

Get here early (730am) because the secret has been out about this great little restaurant. Had he California omelette, and old fashioned crumb cake , my wife had the buttermilk pancakes and with fresh berries. Make this your go to breakfast in the Bay Area. You can walk of the meal to nearby coit tower and Lombard street afterwards.

SO is so-so.The portions are huge and the food is spicy! •_I'd wish our server would have told us how big the portions are for 2 people. •_Instead, he just took our orders like a robot and that was it. •_There were only 2 servers during dinner time and the service was slowwww.Chicken wings were so-so. •_I would say I had better wings from my friends BBQ and at the local dive bars. •_Fortunately we did not have to wait in line for a table and found parking right in the front.
Top-notch, inventive Mexican food in the Mission. The small plates are a perfect size, and the quality of the food is great!

I could go the easy way here and give it a solid 4-star review. •_I mean, I've given several places that are nothing to be excited about a 4-star review. •_And, this IS a place where you probably should at some level be excited about. •_I feel obligated to grade this place in the context of what you are seeing and hearing about it. •_This place is not all that. •_It's good, and based on the quality of the food coupled with the experience, and with a hint of the expectations, I'll say that A-Ok is a fine review. •_3-stars is fair, particularly if you really grade it in context.Hey, this place doesn't shy from the mantle of "Best Burrito in the Country". •_That is pretty high praise. •_If I were them, I'd be like... Nah... •_We just do our thing and try and stay humble. •_They don't take that approach at La Taqueria. •_They eat up the accolades. •_Fine. •_Perfectly fair. •_But, if you want to play that game, I am holding you to that standard. •_And, by that standard, La Taqueria is incredibly disappointing. •_The food is far from spectacular. •_The waiting is long and is not done well. •_There is even a limited means to sit and eat, because the whole thing is just silly. •_It's like they have the greatest thing ever from a ownership standpoint - people will wait forever, pay a ton, wait even longer, and you don't even have to host them. •_Then, they thank you for the pleasure. •_Because: •_"They ate at the place that has the 'Best Burrito in America'". •_It's not. •_It's not even close. •_It's good, I won't say it isn't. •_It is not the best burrito in America. •_Here's the deal. •_They don't add rice, you get lots of meat (which is good) and pretty solid pinto beans and pico. •_Not bad. •_Add another $2.50 for Cheese, Sour Cream and (bad) Guac. •_Pretty rich. •_Of course, it isn't cheap. •_You are at about $12 for a dressed burrito, and more if you go no beans. •_The tacos are plenty spendy, especially if you get them Super-style. •_Super-style is a great thing for the owner. •_I'd prefer a better base. •_ Beans in tacos? •_Ehh... •_You really think this is the "Best in America"? •_ I also had one of the most mediocre Chicken Quesadilla's of my life for $5. •_I think this place is altight, but it's damn expensive. •_It should be very good. •_Plus, you already came to The Mission, and you are in the freakin' Mission in SF, and you better be getting good Mexican food. •_I can definitely name at least four places you should hit in The Mission alone that are better. •_And, cheaper. •_AND, don't require a 15-20 minute wait once you've already waited 10-15 minutes. •_I can probably expanding that list by trying the next 10-12 places at least once. •_Let's go back to the experience for a moment. •_They must have a low opinion of their audience here. •_What a poor experience. •_You wait in line for ages. •_It's just packed. •_Many people are not regulars so they have no idea what is happening. •_Then you order, and you wait in another line to pay. •_Then you wait forever for like 10-20 minutes. •_They don't move fast. •_They don't have a good system - which, hey, would make sense. •_Then you finally get your food, and are no longer in the mood and wish you would have just went, well, anywhere. •_There isn't a seat. •_By then time you figure out where to carve out a niche, your Mexican food is cold and Mexican food is better warm. •_If this place truly had a good product, they could take a lot of other approaches. •_Here is an absolute kicker for how they could be better - Their one really good burrito is much better when it is grilled, which is called Dorado-style. •_You wouldn't know it on the menu, because it is "secret". •_I knew how to get it, and that added even more to the wait. •_I had one without the extra grilling they other day and it was half as good.I think they are willing to play the game. •_They at best deserve a 3-star. •_If I didn't know that someone else called it the Best in America, I don't know if I would ever go back. •_I doubt I'll be back soon. •_I'd be very careful when you are approaching popular places that have celebrity. •_Sometimes famous and good are not the same thing.

I don't even know where to begin. Sotto mare was my first love in SF because of the oh so delicious food here. I'm especially referring to the ciopinno. It picks you up when you're down. It gives you wings when you're celebrating. Really delicious food is such a rare find and this place does it for a reasonable price.However - service here, let's be real, leaves much to be desired. I think because this place is now so popular they don't need regulars, they no longer try to establish that rapport with their patrons. We're just bodies coming and going and eating and paying - certainly not individuals and maybe not even human, but does it matter when there's thousands of us crowding to just put our name on the 3 hour long waitlist?That being said, for the time being, I'm still coming back for the food, which still tastes good after whatever terrible experience I'll have with the hostess. And aside sitting by the bar I get a glimpse of the hard working and truly kind individuals preparing the food, sawing the bread, washing the cups ... so it'll be a 5 star until all that goes away.

Huh? How does this place have four stars?! This is why I have trust issues when it comes to yelp.Mahbe it's because we're spoiled with really good Chinese food in OC and San Gabriel that this place paled in comparison. Or maybe we ordered the wrong dishes.Chinqchong chicken - I really wanted to like it because that's what everyone recommended. It was mediocre.Chow fun - I would skip this. Not good at all.

for delivery and damn that was good! so I haven't eating chicken in a decade or more... but the meatless sweet and sour chicken really takes me back! I love it!! ok, I can't stop ordering it... I know its not the healthiest thing, but please give a grad student a break! Prices here are pretty reasonable... delivery is timely and reliable, employees friendly, the brown rice is great, I was told the hot and sour soup was vegetarian.... the green beans with tofu, the garlic pea sprouts, and onion pancakes were also pretty good (3 stars). Entrees are Large portions, enough to share if your willing.

For $27.95 All You Can Eat this place is a a great deal. It's like being at the Disneyland of non-stop eating without having to wait in long lines! Not sure why it was so empty on a Wednesday night but my greedy hungry self quickly got distracted by the fact that we could get personal hot pots. Wait, let me rephrase that...we could get personal half hot pot half grills!!! Mind. Blown.Insert PRO-TIP: come with a group of 4 people max to get personal cooking devices! If you have more people, you'll have to get seated at a table where you share pots/grills.So quality of food aside (I mean this is an all you can eat Asian joint so my expectations were tampered), I loved it! SOUP: I got the miso and enjoyed it thoroughly.SAUCES: There's a self-serve sauce station here! I loved the sweet soy sauce and the Chinese BBQ sauce for dipping hotpot-boiled meats. The Korean BBQ sauce was bomb for grilled meats.Meats: Can't go wrong with the lamb and the beef for hotpot! The pork belly was delicious on the grill with Korean BBQ sauce!Fish Balls: There's such a huge variety of them here! We tried them all! My favorites were fish ball with cheese (although everyone else hated it), fried shrimp balls, and fish balls with pork inside.Dim sum: nice to have as fillers but nothing stood out except for the fried bun with condensed milk. Omg I could eat 5 of those!!!I'm totally coming back with another group of friends soon!!! Everyone who saw my food photos FOMOed hard.
ar|
Awesome prawn burrito (which is also extra huugge!) and shrimp cocktail but the cantaloupe drink is to die for (a must get drink!!)

We waited much longer than estimated for a table. •_That may not be the fault of the restaurant, but it is definitely their fault that once seated, we were ignored. •_No water, no bread, no one took our order or came to our table for more than ten minutes. •_That was a long time to be sitting and waiting after waiting outside for a long time. •_The gnocchi is $17.00, not $14.75 as listed here on yelp. •_Dinner for two people was $70, including tax and tip. •_We had one pasta entree each. •_I drank tap water. •_My friend had one glass of wine. •_(No salad, appetizer, or dessert.) •_The food was OK, but it was not worth the wait or the price.They don't take reservations and they are the only restaurant in the immediate area, so if you get there and they are busy you can't just go next door or across the street.
Sad to say what was once mediocre food has taken a turn for the worse. 4 stars for friendly waiters and still best margaritas, unfortunately everything else could use a refresh.

I met the owner Kathy, and also her father, Peter, the latter of which started House of Nan King. Great people. I asked for the famous Fried Onion cakes (could describe it as a Chinese version of a quesadilla, but instead of cheese it's scallions and yummy sauces...) and then for a recommendation-filled menu. Told her what we didn't like, and got noodles, fish, chicken, shrimp, short ribs--no bones, don't worry--plate after plate, and then sesame balls for dessert...and we were all (4 adults) satisfied, with drinks, at $140. I should have asked for a soup too! Get reservations, and do the Fang thing. Congrats to Kathy, I'm a huge fan!

I miss Cyrus. •_Tried to recreate the last really great two-Michelin-star experience we had a couple years ago there before it closed, but this didn't quite fit the bill, considering the amount written on said bill. •_Wine pours were stingy (we eventually had to say something) and we actually left hungry! •_Nothing really jumped out from the wine pairings until we got to dessert. •_That said, nothing takes away from the fact that you are headed for a very special evening with amazing, eye-opening flavors and creativity. •_We also thought the wine glasses and serving dishes were of an extraordinary variety and beauty--we just wanted more food on them.

Another place recommended by a friend that I had never heard of but was dumbfounded when I learned that it was across from El Farolito's. (The one down the street from Balboa High, don't get it confused with my favorite spot on 24th and Mission) Smh. They have adequate seating, pretty spacious with a generous salsa bar. The cashier was polite. I can say it definitely gives you a faint "Plaza" vibe as if you were actually in Mexico somewhere due to the panaromic design along the wall. As for the food, I've had better. Don't get me wrong, the carne asada burrito I ate was a good sized portion and I appreciate the free chips but the quality of the food was so-so. What stood out and kind of turned my taste buds off was SALT, SALT ,SALT. The burrito, chips, and salsa all were just overly salted. Maybe I'm kind of unjust for critiquing this place a little too early but I firmly believe that first impressions are always the most credible.

Tried this new place the first week it opened while in San Fran on a biz trip and so glad we did. They definitely need to fix some kinks (servers tried to deliver about 8 dishes before and after ours that were not ours- one we asked "what is this?" And the reply: "I have no idea"). Buy the food itself was delicious. We had the eggplant appetizer - fresh, light and fantastic flavors. Then the Kung pao chicken and the scallops with macadamia nuts. Both were fresh, flavorful, delicious!

4 1/2 stars for this modest store with amazing pizza. •_Thank you fellow yelpers for recommending this place. •_My dining companion had not been to the Bay Area for 15 or so years and he was hankering for thin crust pizza. •_Baonecci did not disappoint. •_We were torn between the prosciutto pizza and the truffle salami special of the day. •_The waiter kindly offered to let us do as 1/2

As much as I liked Kasa I'm so happy that it's been replaced by Tacko. •_It's the perfect post-bar meal and the self-serve water and salsa are fantastic. •_It is a bit hard to find seating at times but the carnitas tacos are worth the stress. •_(About $5/taco.)

The service was exceptional. No more than a 10 minute wait. Our group included 5 people. 2 kids, 3 adults. The waitresses and waiters and very kind. When I received my food, •_it was DELICIOUS. I was in love with the cornbread crust of the deep dish pizza. No complaints. Very Good!!
Decor is nice but food and service is subpar and very expensive. I'd skip this place and go somewhere else for dim sum!
I wouldn't say it's my top place for quick dim sum, but it suffices for something close to the house.
Stopped in for dinner. Was looking for a table for 1. It was about 8:45pm. The host came to the door with menus in hand, and upon learning that I was only 1, looked me up

NIck's was nearby so tried their tacos. yelp check-in gets u free chips and salsa. passed. counting calories.ordered/paid at counter. food came minutes after.eats: pescado taco (5.75)-single piece of fried fish, nothing wrong, just tasteless. surrounded by mayo, rojo salsa, lime, cilantro, cabbage, onions.service friendly, quick, informative...lots of flatscreens around.
Great place! Food is high quality, everything is as Sardinian as possibile! Owners are great. Strongly suggested!

Burritos, San Francisco's got them. Tacos, the Bay Area's got you covered. But fish tacos? You gotta go to SoCal for those.It is only because Mijita offers decent fish tacos that I give them two stars. In a city full of cheap, delicious Mexican food, there is no reason to visit this place. It's so overpriced. Holy crap, you will have to sell some plasma if you don't come flush with cash.Oh, and I was starving when I went here. Ordered chips and salsa ($3+) in hopes of chowing down on them while my fish fried. No dice. Even though I asked the girl behind the counter for them first, she wouldn't give them up. And the salsa suckkkkkkks.
I had the pork belly, coca cola braised pork, and the spicy chicken steamed baos. The pork belly was my favorite! I really like how all of the pickled veggies paired with the meats.

I have been coming here for years. It used to be that when you went to Elizas, you got mediocre to bad service, pretty good food, good portion sizes and a decent price (though always a little high. •_They have taken the portion sizes to pathetic, the prices are higher and the quality has dropped. •_The service is as bad as ever. •_If you ask where your waiter is, you get lectured. Don't expect to have your water filled more than once. •_They served fried rice tonight in a dish the size of a small soup bowl and the shrimp dish for 12 dollars had 7 shrimp, and it tasted bland and boring. •_I know the location makes for a guaranteed clientele but this restaurant needs a serious wake-up call. •_There are lots of good Chinese places that appreciate your business, try one of them.

I ate here with a friend a couple of years ago and remember loving it. •_It's a true hole in the wall, bordering on a dump. The food prep area is clean but don't look too closely at the walls and ceiling. •_This is an OLD space and looks it. •_I ate here again today and it was dreadful. I had the chicken curry with rice. •_Grand total $6.25 cash including tax. •_The "curry" did not taste at all of curry. •_The rice was perfectly cooked (but then again, what Asian restaurant can't cook rice?). •_The curry was very salty, not spicy, and the pieces of potato (yes, potato), onion, bell peppers and chicken were floating in grease. •_Bright orange grease.If the starch is rice why am I eating big chunks of mushy boiled potatoes with the rice? •_Is that a thing in Burma? •_I don't know, but I didn't like it.I left most of the sauce on the plate. •_I felt a bit ill after my meal. •_Not food poisoning ill, just heavy greasy meal ill.I do love dives (though this is more of a dump than a dive) and I love cheap good food. •_I'm sorry my experience was so different than the first time. •_I won't be back.

They screwed up the order, then charged me extra for the enchilada that they should've brought in the first place. Food also came out cold. Cold meat, cold beans, cold sauce. Carne Asada was also over cooked and dry. Terrible experience.

$11.12 for a regular chicken burrito?..oh my...I'd hate to think what a super would cost....I felt like a complete idiot leaving here and completely ripped off....I will not be retuRning...DISGRACEFUL

It's tricky for me to find pizza that holds it's own when I frequently make pizza at home, but I'm glad I went to Gialina's.With a group of 4 we got 2 pizzas, 2 appetizers, and a carafe of wine. I wasn't exactly fat'n'happy at the end, but it was still sufficient. The main thing to point out is that the pizza is really thin (think rice paper thin.) For the "Pesto" however, that wasn't a problem. The pizza was still crispy and miraculously able to support itself. The other pizza, the Atomica, was less appealing (though still good.) The sauce made the thin crust too soggy. The wine went very well with both pizzas (can't remember what we got, but it was dry.) If you do appetizers, I would say I preferred the dates to the polenta.

Mmmmm sesame meat paste noodles and spicy Szechuan noodles and yummyish dim sum. •_I've eaten at Taiwan for over 10 years and for a real cheap satisfying meal of noodles this is it. •_I also like the pan fried string beans.

Los Jarritos is great. I wholeheartedly recommend ordering Kiko's Combination. For a mere $6.95 you can combine two of the following items (except burrito): taco, tostada, burrito, enchilada, chile relleno, flauta, or sopas omar. Two items plus it's served with rice, beans, and tortillas. What a steal! The Sopas Omar are like open faced pupusas. Delicious.Kiko's combination is not the only reason to go to Los Jarritos. The huevos have delightful names. Try Huevos Con Amor, Huevos Divorciados, or Huevos Queridos. There's a little something for everyone at Los Jarritos. I recently had the Machaca breakfast and it really hit the spot. Plus, they serve coffee in mixed matched mug, just like home. And sure the coffee isn't great, but Los Jarritos isn't a cafe it's a nice little Mexican place on a shady little street.
YES! best tacos in the city and monstrous. Love this place and the salsas.
Decent Italian. I was expecting better gnocchi after a recommendation from a friend. I probably wouldn't come here if you are looking for something more from the north of Italy.

AH-MAY-ZING.I was on the hunt for a spot that served eggs on pizza after I had dined at Tom Douglas's Serious Pie restaurant in Seattle. There HAD to be a spot in SF that did that, right?? Yes, there are plenty- but do they all deliver the same great taste? No! I am so lucky I found Gialina on Yelp.We had to wait about 30 minutes- they took our phone number down. If you don't want to wait outside in the cold, I recommend killing time at the dive bar next door, just bring cash. Our dinner was worth the wait! We had a bottle of chardonnay, an arugula salad with pistachios, atomica pizza and four cheese pizza. Trust me, if you do anything in this life time, order your pizza with an egg. The richness of the yolk just adds an extra special something to every bite. I think next time I will add two eggs to my pizza. :)Service is really nice and on point, food is fresh and delicious, and the restaurant is really nice. I will definitely be back!
This place has a good outside space for happy hour.

Thank you pork on pork brunch goodness. I got the pork saltimbocca so literally a pork paradise! It was the first meal of the day so why the hell not! It was pretty packed for brunch on a Saturday morning but we opted for bar seating. The bartender was friendly and attentive. We got our drinks and food quickly, perks of the bar. I loved my spritz!!!!!! The cocchi based one was awesome! I loved that it was as bitter as the aperol based one. Definitely check that one out! The food was delicious. It's a brunch win.
Lounge|

This place is my favorite restaurant in SF. I have never had a bad meal here. In fact, I never anything I didn't love here. La Ciccia is a Mom and Pop place that makes you feel like your in their home, and they are the most hospitable people on the planet. The wine list is amazing and huge. All you need to do is tell them what characteristics you like, price range, and they will bring you something you probably have never had that goes perfectly with your meal. Quit waiting around and go here now!

Delicious. Their ducks are definitely bigger and contains slight more fat then other restaurants I've tasted. We had roasted duck porridge (it's just duck on porridge, but Cantonese is also good at making good and fine porridge, it was very tasty! The juice and oil of the duck mixed into the bowl... yum), and 3 mix rice (duck, script skin BBQ pork, and duck liver) this was delicious too! The rice was well cooked and the meat were put on top, so the juice will go into the rice! Also this dish will have a little bit of veggie to go with. I wish I could have taken one whole duck togo. It was that good!

A definite 5 stars for this amazing restaurant! The food is delicious and very pleasing. I started with the Spinaci Salad; it was sublime with real pancetta and perfectly and lightly dressed. The portion size was perfect, not overwhelming, just the right size with really fresh spinach, very crunchy pancetta and pine nuts. The evening's pasta specialty was linguini with seafood a white wine sauce. I had a half portion and it truly was well balanced with the flavors of wine, lemon and garlic. It was a pleasure to eat. I also eat a dessert, a chocolate tartufo, it was spectacular! Prices were pretty reasonable considering the competition in the neighborhood. I will be coming back.

Very kind staff here and one of the best combo delivery deals around. For $10 you get soup, eggroll, an entree and rice. It's called, fittingly, "I Don't Want To Cook".There is something about the housemade fake meat here. I was briefly addicted to it. I'm not even a Veganarian, but I found myself with the oddest cravings for their meatless Kung Pao. Then one day, poof, I was immune, nothing. It got under my skin though, quite inexplicably, so I'd be remiss not to bring this up..But I'm still giving this place the Trinity. Fast to your door Mission. There are far worse Chinese comestibles en El Barrio. That and Clinton ate here twice. He also ordered to go, and because he was Bill MFing Clinton Jasmine Tea House cooked him up some vittles even even though they'd closed the kitchen. So while I don't order from JTH anymore (Wild Pepper, you had me at the free Chow Mein) when I did, it made eating chinese take-out on my couch with sporks seem somehow...Clintonian.

A-okay.They were able to get us in on no notice on a Sunday morning around 1130, which is saying a lot. Love the location and the ambiance.The menu looked delicious, and we opted for the veggie omelet (with tomatoes instead of potatoes on the side) and the huevos rancheros. The veggie omelet was almost entirely veggie, with very little egg. Interesting, but I wouldn't order it again .The huevos rancheros were smothered in salsa and came with chunks of steak on top. Decently good, not great. The pancakes at the table next to us looked and smelled amazing - wish we had ordered those. Our waitress seemed to be engaged elsewhere most of the time we were there, so we had to keep repeatedly tracking her down. We might come back again if we're in the neighborhood, but we could probably find something better.

The ying and yang of Mexican food on the doorstep of my office. •_I had a meal in the evening here of a beef enchilada and a taco and it was delicious, the carne asada was not even remotely chewy and the rice was wonderful, by far the best taqueria rice I've had in Northern California. •_The sauce on the enchilada was superb and it all came in a handy round foil container that I could munch away at my desk while I toiled into the evening. •_The refried beans were out of a tin and generic and bland and the cheese that topped everything was pretty tasteless.Impressed with this experience however I went for lunch and tried to order a regular burrito. •_I don't care for the "super" burrito with the frankly un-necessary addition of sour cream, guacamole and cheese and like mine really simply done. •_They had trouble with this concept when I ordered my burrito minus those embellishments and I had three seperate people check that I really didn't want another 700 calories of gloop added to the burrito and then wanted to make sure that I wanted each of the other ingredients. •_I asked for refried beans in my burrito and when I got back to the office they had put sour cream and black beans in and omitted the salsa. •_Not good.

What do I know about what's good Chinese food and what's not in a city like San Francisco? •_Pretty much nil. •_But, I know good tasting food when I eat it and House of Nanking delivered. •_What they also delivered was really fast and friendly service which made my two dining companions and I feel even better about the entire meal.We were quickly asked for drink orders and then asked if we liked vegetables, seafood, beef, chicken. •_Yes, yes, yes and yes. •_She then offered to order for us and just bring some dishes to share. •_Another yes and a really good call on our part.Two appetizers appeared at our table in about 5 minutes. •_The first a roasted portobello in some delicious soy based sauce, the second some yummy potstickers. •_Three entrees came next - 1. Crispy Beef 2. House Chicken 3. Some shrimp and apples dish. •_All three offered great flavors in a range of profiles - sweet, salty, savory, some heat...At the end, needless to say we were three stuffed and very happy House of Nanking campers.

I can't say enough good things about this place. The service is so exceptional and always so attentive with us and our daughter. The food is delicious and they have a great variety in the menu of amazing Mexican food. My favorite plate after a good night out is chilaquiles Veronica they come with chorizo, beans and rice. My husband loves their birria and the fact that the tortillas are •_handmade is a big plus. They have wine, beer and their micheladas which are really good.
