They also have Jamaica and horchata water that are delicious, love the fact that they are not so sweet. The inside has a very interesting decoration with a lot of culture. It gets pretty busy during the weekend specially Sundays after church but its definitely worth the wait plus the service is really fast and once again exceptional.

In comparison to other Michelin star restaurants, Quince is far and away one of the best. The decor is lovely and they typically have awesome hot chocolate when you wait for a cab or your car. The lounge is also a nice place to just relax after a long day for drinks and snacks.They're rapidly becoming one of my favorite restaurants in the Bay Area.

The burger was of average taste. Nothing special. The fish tacos were good, price to high for what you get. Atmosphere was good(had a western style vibe). Food over all seems expensive. In my opinion price doesn't match quality of what I ate. Not a bad experience over all.
izzeria|

Hole- in- the wall in Chinatown with great affordable Chinese food! We got the family dinner combo A that guarantees to feed 4. •_We had 5 people and still had left overs! For only $48 the combo included soup, beef, crab, seafood clay pot, vegetable dish, appetizers, dessert, etc. Service was excellent for a Chinese restaurant. Our water never went empty. They were quick at refilling our tea as well.

Where is a legitimate Mexican restaurant in San Francisco? Not a taqueria, not a taco wagon...I mean a sit-down restaurant with waitstaff and big plates of food not wrapped in foil, accompanied by tasty beverages.EL TOREADOR TO THE RESCUE!I have yet to find a single other establishment in San Francisco I would classify in this fashion, but El Torreador pretty much makes up for what the city lacks. I have been hauling out to West Portal from various distant neighborhoods in SF for years just for the food here, which is absolutely delicious and delightfully plentiful. Just about everything on the menu is a combination that comes with a most unique and tasty soup. And of course, you have unlimited chips and really good homemade salsa with a great kick at your disposal - they replace an empty chip bowl more quickly than you can say "gracias."In addition to the great food, the service is always friendly and efficient - just when you think you're going to wait forever for a table (don't let the long list of names ahead of yours scare you), or miss your movie across the street at the Empire Theatre, you're in and outta there. The host , who has turning tables down to a science, has been there for as long as I can remember and always recognizes my husband and me. And the decor..well, let's just say I hope they never have to move from that location. Did I mention the very affordbale prices? Awesome food + great service + fun atmosphere + $11 entrees = 5 stars!

Excellent food and preparation! Fresh swordfish, fresh shrimp, fresh salmon, and fresh Pacific cod! Fresh because it is caught the same day it is served! The mixed grill was terrific and the crab Louie salad was outstanding! Everyone at our table was delighted! Our waitress was really on her game! There when you wanted her and not when she didn't need to be! Quick to offer ti take our picture, friendly and engaging. She offered appetizers, and desserts but didn't push.This place was recommended to us by the Delta airlines counter person as her favorite SF restaurant. We can understand why, and are very appreciative of her recommendation!Now we recommend it to you!
Was here with friends and we are all delighted! Girls love cocktails, but pizza was soooo delicious :D Cheers for pleasant service!
inetti|

I go to this place whenever I have cravings for Taiwanese food. •_There aren't that many Taiwanese restaurants in SF. •_I used to have to drive to Cupertino, Santa Clara, or LA to find good Taiwanese food. •_The food in this place is decent but pricier than other places I'd been to outside of SF. •_This is probably due to lack of competition in Taiwanese food in SF. •_I order the following dish and here are my thoughts about the food:5 stars: •_Braised pork over rice (Ru Rou Fan). It's very authentic and tastes great. •_It's my favorite dish when I was growing up in Taiwan. •_This is the dish that got me hooked to this place. •_I love this dish so much that I look for recipes online and make it at home. •_5 stars: Green onion pancake. •_It's so crispy and slightly buttery. •_It's on the oily and greasy side, so it's not a good dish to order if you are trying to loose weight.3 stars: Smelly tofu. •_I had better ones from Taiwan. •_3.5 stars: Taiwanese fried rice noodles. •_It tastes good except they put too much MSG.5 stars: ice cold soy milk. •_It's tastes very refreshing and similar to the hand made soy milk. •_It's not too sweet either. 2 stars: Taiwanese sausage fried rice. •_Don't bother with this dish at all! •_The sausage was good, but they added only peas, carrot cubes, soy sauce and MSG over rice. •_The rice tastes kind of plain and generic.Overall, I think this place is a good place to go if I only order dishes that have good reviews on Yelp. •_I do save time and money on gas, so I can go on a real trip to Taiwan to have all the good food out there. •_FYI: •_They provide free deliveries to Richmond District SF (minimum $20 or more) and to Sunset District SF (minimum $30 or more). •_They also provide free parking on 23rd Avenue if your dining bill is more than $35.

For years I was told to not come to The Stinking Rose. •_I was told, "Its a tourist trap." "Go somewhere else on Columbus." •_Everything was all bad. My man talked me into it. •_He said if you love The Dead Fish you'll love The Stinking Rose. •_He was absolutely right. •_I really did enjoy The Stink.We came in on a Friday and it was not busy around the time we came in. •_Reservations are recommended and there wasn't a seat at the bar to wait either.They had really unique cocktail menu. •_That always earns extra points from me. •_I started and kept with the Garlictini. •_It was a dirty martini with these amazing little marinated chunks of garlic rather than olives. •_Ugh! •_So goooood!One thing that was weird. •_They serve bread at the beginning but no butter. •_I don't eat carbs that often but a girl needs some butter on her bread when she does decide to partake.The Mussels were a must. •_This restaurant is associated with The Dead Fish so that means their Mussels are on point. •_If you've never been to The Dead Fish or The Stinking Rose get the Mussels. •_Its my number one thing to always order.My Braised Short Rib was delicious. •_The sauce and the succulent meat were excellent. •_My man got the Prime Rib. •_Of course it was incredible. •_Service was great. •_Not one complaint at all. •_They are very fast and efficient. •_Towards the end of our dinner they did start getting busier, but they run a tight ship.It was a wonderful date night with my sweet man. •_Im so happy I put all the bad things I heard aside and went. •_I was not disappointed.
Thank you for getting back to me so quickly I really appreciate you taking the time to look at your reviews yes our second visit was on December 31st

Bar/club hopping with good friends can make this fella super hungry. Okay, even if I didn't do that I'd still eat like a mofo.Panchita's was super crowded at 1:30AM, with all the drunks congregating for one of the few open joints in the midst of rain.One of my boys actually almost got into a fight with another dude a few tables away. They were both drunk obviously because alcohol somehow escalates small things. The other party heard a few comments they thought were directed at them. Oh, you know it's ON!The melee was prevented though because cooler heads prevailed. The sober ones in both parties mediated common ground and we all shared chips n' salsa later. By the end of all this, I was starving so I had to getS my grubS on yo!The five of us ordered:*Cheese quesadilla •_ •_ +Grilled to just enough crunch, melty mozzy and cheddy*Cheese and spinach pupusa •_ •_ +This is usually a winning combination to me •_ •_ +Spinach didn't seem like it was frozen, which is a peeve of mine*Chicken pupusa •_ •_ +Shredded chicken, juices trapped in the bread*Steak and pork pupsa •_ •_ -The chicken is better; the steak and pork had a foreign redolence to  •_ •_ it, no bueno!Final Call:While I wouldn't make a specific trip here, I'd visit again after an evening of fun in the area. Spinach and cheese pupasas makes my tummy growl!

Amazing food. The best ravioli I ever had. The cheese in the ravioli melts in your mouth. •_The sage butter sauce great with it. The spinach and also the cheese calzones were excellent especially with the tomato sauce. Service friendly and prompt. The seating area is limited but very cozy as you can see the past making in the back from your seat.

Like most people in their right mind, I love pizza. Everything from fancy Neapolitan to frozen from the corner store - it's carbs and cheese in one mouthful.That being said, Tony's was good but I really don't get what the fuss is about. Let's talk positives:+ Great location in the heart of North Beach.+ Perfectly cooked crust. That is one very big promise where Tony's delivers.+ Tons of pie options - there's something for everyone on the menu.+ A special wine by the glass offering where proceeds benefit a children's charity.Due to the sheer hype of Tony's, I was expecting blow your mind pizza. It was good, don't get me wrong. But there's tons of delicious pizza in North Beach without the wait.I don't get it...

I go to wild pepper regularly for lunch.Overall the flavor is good, ingredients fresh, portions plentiful.The Dining Room is clean, and has a reasonable level of noise.It has a nice location, tucked out of the way.

SF's Best Restaurant! My wife and I come so often out here, it's amazing. They treat us very well every time and the wine is just exceptional. Their Italian wine selection is unparalleled and their food is amazing. They have the best Neapolitan pizza outside of Europe and their burrata appetizer dish is so tasty. I recommend everyone in SF to try this place at least once!
Scrumptious menu through and through. Professional, happy staff.Dynamite place for date night.

Came here for lunch with one of my friends. We got the 2 for $25 deal! First, we started off with salad(unlimited). There was soup but we wanted salad to start off fresh. Breadsticks came along too and they were also unlimited. I really like their breadsticks. Then, we had the entree with two of the same dishes which was some kind of shrimp pasta(it was alright) maybe I'll try the chicken alfredo next time and we ended it with a slice of cheesecake. Btw, the service was pretty good. Must get this deal because it's so worth it!

I wanted to revisit my review of HRD. I think it was rather unfair of me to compare it to Korean food trucks and other Korean food I've had. •_This is the same establishment featured on Diners, Drive inns, and Dives. It looks like a Korean version of Chipotle.I've had the spicy pork burrito and the bulgogi burrito. The flavors are good. I understand that they have to appeal to a mass audience, so the food is not to over powering. •_Overall, HRD is great for a quick lunch. •_Instead of the regular chains like Chipotle or Togos or Panda Express, HRD is different and is a good alternative for lunch. •_If you happen to be in the neighborhood, you should definitely try it.

Practically closing my eyes as I'm about to inhale my slice of pizza, I open my eyes to find another table staring at me as I'm mid-bite. Uhh excuse me, please allow me to have some alone time with my pizza... but at the same time I wanted to say "yeah you should totally order this pizza, it's delicious, and I would probably be staring too!"Winter version of the Farm egg pizza ooouu yeah that hit the pizza cravings. "Come to mama" was all I could think when I first laid my eyes on it. The crust is just so crisp and soft in the right areas and the combination of what is put on the pizza just works well together and is not exactly what I've had at other pizza places. It makes their menu choices stand out! Glad I came. Cute spot. I liked it :-)

You know what, I really like Mission Chinese Food.It's not Chinese food, and you probably shouldn't compare it to the hundreds of authentic Chinese restaurants in the City. •_Rather, you should view Mission Chinese Food for what it really is: Chinese-inspired food, with a smattering of influences from other Asian cuisines, all uniquely thrown together in a setting that is 100% Mission. •_Take it for what it is, and you may actually enjoy your meal. •_But definitely avoid the temptation to compare it to real Chinese food.As for the actual dishes, here's some stuff I tried and my thoughts:+ Tiger rolls: a bunch of veggies in a rice noodle roll; this is reminiscent of Vietnamese spring rolls, but with a twist. •_Tasty and refreshing. + Szechuan Pickles: nice appetizer dish, lots of spice and kick, the peanuts are a great addition for taste and texture+ Tea-smoked eel: this is similar to the Tiger Roll in that you have some kind of veggie and, in this case, meat filling in a rice noodle roll. •_Pretty tasty stuff.+ Mapo tofu: super spicy, HUGE portions, but overall just okay. I wasn't wowed by this dish. •_Even if I'm not comparing it to "real" mapo tofu, this is still kind of a lackluster dish, one that you can probably pass over.+ Thrice cooked bacon: now THIS was a stellar dish. •_They stir fry rice ovalettes with a mix of vegetables, spices, tofu skin, and more. •_What you have is a flavorful, spicy, chewy, and delicious dish that packs a lot of punch into each bite. •_Loved this dish. + Salt cod fried rice: now, I know I said I wouldn't be comparing the food here to "real" Chinese food, but a dish like this begs to be compared to the real thing because it IS the real thing. •_This is the standard salty fish fried rice that is found in almost all Chinese restaurants, and Mission Chinese Food doesn't try to do its own hipsterized version of it. •_Rather, they do the real thing, and it's a decent version, but nothing too special. •_I liked it, but it's a pretty standard version.+ Pork belly: wow, SO fatty, but I liked it a lot. •_The crispiness of the skin is delightful, though the amount of fat on this thing is kind of frightening. •_But that's also why this dish is good. •_But be warned: lots of grease!I was also pleasantly surprised by how generous the portions are - the dishes are just as big as what you'd find in an authentic Chinese restaurant, which, if you've been to one, you'll know that dishes in Chinese restaurants come with very generous portions. •_What else...food comes quickly, the place has a very "Mission" feel, there's usually a wait but it's not atrocious (we came here around 8pm on a Friday night and probably only waited about 15-20 minutes), it's kind of loud but not unbearably so, prices are fair though a couple dollars above standard Chinese restaurant prices. •_A unique eating experience, and I would certainly recommend this place.

Let me start off by saying the Fried Dried Wet Wingz were hella good!!! I dont know how else to explain it... It is almost like - I dont know, but they were Hella good. We arrived at 4:45 and sat in the car for about 10 minutes, they opened the doors up 5 minutes early, so us and three other people were the first to be seated. We ordered Shrimp Fried Rice, dry sauteed green beans, and Dry Fried Wet Chicken wingz. Rice came out 5 minutes after we ordered it... Fast service!Greens were next, and the highlight of the night was on deck - The Dry Fried Wet Chicken, an orgasmic experience to my taste budz! The wait staff was pretty good. They kept water in my cup, and napkins on the table. After the waiter poured our water he would thank us, instead of us thanking him.. Prices were also cool. I read a yelp disclaimer where the facility was red tagged for some food quality issues, but fukk that..... Experience it for yourself!

Every girl has a best friend.I have two: carbs and alkie.Okie, maybe three since I rely on my spanx to hold in all the carbs and alkie I inhale.BaoNecci is my new best friend. They have spectacular pizzas and wine. I'll even go as far as saying, they serve one of the best thin crust pizzas if not the best in SF. With over 20+ choices, BaoNecci beats my favorites: Tony's, Capo's, Delfina and Beretta. And, although the wine list is small, it's a quality selection. Get the chianti ($10/glass)!Don't think about walking in here without reservations (listed under Opentable as "Baonecci Trattoria

Pros: -HUGE dim sum! Love the portions-I got my order in seconds -this is good picnic food for the park down the street. Free entertainment by the Chinese ladies doing Chinese Jazzercise. Cons: -No seating area, cash only I literally craved dim sum again that night!
Convenient place for dinner in between shopping and watching Hamilton. •_However, the Pasta was too salty.

Great fresh simple Chinese that went to the next level!! •_The greens and the porkbelly were to die for!! •_I mean absolutely fantastic!! •_I won't forget this meal for a long time!!! •_This place is fed hard to find even though it is directly on mission street but if you try hard enough you will find this small hip place!!
The food's generally good but there's usually a wait, it's usually loud, and they barely put any meat in my fajitas last night (the guac. serving was weak as well)

Love this place! Cool atmosphere/decor. Delish/inventive twists on tacos. Great beer selection. Friendly staff. It is indeed perfect for a casual night out - alone, with another, in a large group. We need more places like this.
great service, great food thats reasonably priced, perfect for groups maybe not dates cause it is loud

I was impressed with West of Pecos! No wait even during peak weekend brunch hours, fun and laid-back atmosphere, and delicious, quality food. That's awesome for a bumpin' neighborhood like the Mission.My friends and I split the guacamole and queso with chips. They dust their chips with paprika or some other spice that makes them awesome, and they're generous with refills. Their queso is the BEST queso I've had outside of Texas (my hometown) in quite some time. I ordered fruit and the puffy mushroom

I heard many good reviews about this place but unfortunately based on my own experience, I can only give it a 3 star.Food: Went with their chef's choice menu. The dishes' quality, taste, and presentation were rather average. There was only one dish that stood out- the corn chowder with a hint of black truffle. The rest didn't really match up to my expectation for a 3-dollar-sign Michelin restaurant.Service: Very average. The waitress appeared extremely busy and didn't have much patience and care for the customers.Atmosphere: very dimmed dinning room; slightly crowded.Price: $180 for two.

A little pricey for what it is but tastes so good that you can't not splurge on it. Everything there is good and I like that they have Bohemia Beer. •_Great red roasted salsa in the squeeze bottles on the table.

GF and I had a great dinner. •_We each ordered a pasta dish, shared side of vegetables and a pizza. •_Probably could have ordered a little more (maybe a starter) but I wasn't still hungry at the end of dinner like I was at SPQR.The only negative was eating at 5:30 pm, but not that big of a deal.One tip - ask for the bread. •_It's good.

Came here with a couple coworkers. The food taste fine, but the staff was very pushy in the ordering process, and I'm pretty sure they snuck in things we didn't order. We end up getting a check that was bigger than we expected. Overall a pretty bad experience. Would not recommend.

Deal with the devil.One must have been made to create the Shrimp Diablo.An unholy amount of prawns. A nefarious amount of cactus, onions and black beans (subbed for rice). A hellish kick from the spicy garlic tomato sauce.So good. So big. Almost couldn't finish it. Almost.Which brings us to another round of the sinful S'mores Nachos.Fried tortilla strips, cinnamon, sugar, crushed graham crackers, Mexican chocolate and marshmallows lit on fire as the dish is brought to the table.Planned on two or three bites. Still wanted more after ten.Did my will power get signed away in exchange for culinary indulgence? It wouldn't be the first time I accelerated my path towards hell. And it most certainly won't be my last.Bet they've got those S'mores Nachos down south. Fire included.

Ever hear the expression 'you are what you eat.' This is especially true for Gordo, the taqueria that's bringing mexy back to the richmond. When I eat gordo, I am gordo.The burritos are HUGE, the quesadillas cheesy and the price couldn't be more right.

I had a hankering for Mexican food (what else is new?) while finding myself downtown one day. I headed to the Ferry Building, since I remembered they have an El Porteê±o stand, but checked my map application for possible Mexican eateries that I would pass en route. My map pointed me directly to MIjita.I had already decided my order would consist of multiple tacos before I had even entered the building. Given their taco selection limited--carnitas, carne asada, pescado y vegetariano--my reluctance to order a fish taco unless it was recommended to me by a trusted friend, and my refusal to order a vegetarian taco, I ordered one carnitas and one carne asada for a total of $9.20, sales tax included--somewhat more pricey than I expect for non-gourmet tacos (Jose Garces' Philadelphia food truck, Guapos Tacos, has short rib and duck tacos for $4 each, just sayin'). I chalked it up to the location and thought no more of it as I awaited my grub near the water.I was astounded by the sheer volume of meat in each taco when I received my plate--I actually had to use the second tortilla for the spillover. Taste-wise, the carnitas was scrumptious--juicy and salty with some guacamole to boot; the carne asada...not so much--rather bland and lacking some sort of salsa to make it pop, perhaps a jalape. The tortillas were also bland, definitely in need of some salt. On the plus side, there was a ton of diced, fresh onion...2.5 stars (bump up is for meat volume, which I appreciate as a staunch carnivore). If you're desperate for tacos, stick with the carnitas and you'll be happy.

Stopped here for the first time. I was told that this place was pretty good but there would be a wait. Little did i know there were 2 lines. After waiting for an hour outside and another 10 minutes inside we finally ordered and made it to our seats. The food was pretty good. I recommend the mama cristo and the regular French toast. Stay clear of the banana nut and the orange cranberry French toast. Sometimes less is more. If you're willing to wait in line for an hour plus, check this place out. If not there are plenty of other places to eat.

I reserved a table for Sunday evening for 5. We got to the reserved time and got seated very quickly. Between 5 of us we ordered pork belly, pastrami, salt cod fried rice, wings. We had leftovers only because we were hungry before our reserved time so we ate a meal before hand but still wanted to go to Mission Chinese. The crowd favorite was the pork belly. We personally felt the dishes were a tad bit too salty. My group felt like the wings were not spicy at all. I personally have a really low spice tolerance and I felt like it wasn't all too spicy. The fried rice was good. This is a fun place to go to with your friends to try different dishes. I like this place.

This small and cozy place met us with prompt and amazing hospitality! The food was amazing and delicious. They are more than happy to let you sample some of their delicious food and drink options. I will return to see them again the next time I am in the neighborhood.

We had a great attentive service on a not too busy Monday night. Food was fresh, hot and tasty. The tortillas, salsas and chorizo tasted like they were made in-house. It's a rooftop bar and restaurant so expect small tables.

NOT GREAT. Very over hyped for what it was. Food was good. Tasty but not amazing. Overpriced for sure. Portions were small. Pasta with mushrooms and no protein for 20 bucks is a bit much ( being that is a small portion).The music and ambiance was good and energetic.The first waiter was very attentive and polite and we talked about all the hot spots to dine in sf. We eat out every night unless we have a dinner party at someone's house or we host people at home. I'm a big time foodie and this place was just ..... meh. Then the waiter had to go home and he was polite and nice but did not introduce the new server.I am not sure how to say this although I'm a very direct person but the waiter who was running the food smelled horrible. I know is San Francisco and everybody is free to do whatever they want including not wearing deodorant, but it is a food environment which requires hygiene and that particular waiter with the long earring was not hygienic at all and the smell was very offensive. I understand chefs ask the waiters to not wear cologne so the fragrance does not interfere with the smell of the food but he took it to the next level and it was not appropriate. Then a female waitress showed up and she was pushy and on a rush to get out of there. I was not even finished with my pizza and was offering offering anything else.I asked for dessert menus and the smelly gentleman •_brought them. The desserts were good, the coffee tasted good. The wine selection was decent and we picked a Sangiovese.Overall, a mediocre experience. We are not cheap by any means. We dine all over the place and travel the world, but after the lack of good service by the waiters that took over when our original waiter left, they did not deserve more than 16 percent tip. Also, the waitress came to grab the check because she really really wanted to leave. Again, inappropriate. Flour and water think they are " so cool" and they were probably good 5 years ago. NOT ANYMORE.Go to SPQR or Delarosa, both are amazing places for less money and better, professional and hygienic service.And Flour and Water is also not cheap. We spent 250 dollars for a 2 top on a Monday. Flour and Water, get it together, there are a lot of amazing restaurants in SF and the hype will fade sooner rather than later. Mediocre.

7/6/14 •_DinnerSolid 5-Star now!Scala's is one of the few hotel restaurants in town where the prices justify the quality of food. Pastas $17-21, entrees $25-$33, from steak to fish. Service has always been attentive and efficient. Scala's has become my go-to place to eat when I'm in Union Square. They have constantly outdone themselves.*Peppardelle ($21) was the special pasta for the night, with slow-cooked pork sugo, very tender, almost like pork cheeks with housemade peppardelle pasta in a tomato sauce with parmagiano. It's orgasmically tasty!*Hanger Steak ($30) was grilled to medium rare and sat on a piece of toast which soaked up the meat sauce. It was topped with grilled mushroom radish and grilled summer vegetables on the side. Another winner.The server recommended a medium-body Benziger Merlot ($11) from Sonoma to go with the meal. It's very smooth and perfect for the evening. I'm one happy camper here at Scala's. It's an oldie classy restaurant that is an epitome of a San Francisco dining experience!
ar|

Grilled fish tacos were delish! (nick crispy style) I only needed 2 because they were so huge but totally worth it and pretty inexpensive. It is also a good place to watch sports if you are interested in that and it is also good for larger groups. I would definitely come back here.

My Family and I ordered from Beijing's for dinner last night, we had chicken fried rice it was light, fluffy, and amazingly good. my two daughters ages 4 , and 5 ate most of it! For the Adults we ordered beef with scallions and kung pow chicken. I was really impressed with how tender the meat was and the •_amazing flavors. When you order dont forget the egg rolls and crab and cheese ragoons! Yummy!

Since moving back to the Portola nearly 6 years ago hubby and I have been regulars at Guadalajara. •_We've been there right when they opened in the morning and have been there right before closing and all the times in between. •_Every burrito is consistently yummy! •_They are all good but for me they have the best veggie one in the neighborhood! •_Hubs fave is the wet burrito. •_My BFF from high school moved to AZ 2 years ago and every time he is in town hubs and I take him here. •_He loves being able to have a taste from home and savors every bite. •_Says there is nothing like this in AZ and that this is the best. •_If we could safely send him some from here we would! •_And even if we move out of my hometown neighborhood someday I know we'll be making the drive back here to get our fix!
Cafe|

Definitely worth the hype. The crust is great, and prosciutto and fennel sausage pizza perfect, not too salty or bland. Salad with pistachios, beets, and avocado right on point. Shorter wait than next door, and wonderful ambience with great music.
Great spot, great neighborhood. Love coming here after playing tennis on weekends. The Quesadilllas are my go to
Lounge|

Pizzas are great. •_However, there are many more places with better service. •_Last few times service has been horrendous. •_Then the kicker - we replaced meat on a pizza with vegetables. •_They charged us extra for the veggies! •_Wha? •_ If you can't cater to vegetarians, then why be in SF?
love this place, a slice of the Mission in downtown SF
talian Restaurant|

so close of five stars but minus one for wet burrito. I don't like when my burrito is dripping wet. It soaks the tortilla and gets all messy. I like having the sauce and lime wet it up. You walk in and wait in line. While waiting they make you more hungry by cooking everything right in front of you. Boy oh boy it looked so deli. I think the reason my burrito was super wet was because I ordered chicken and the chicken is soaked in the juices. I like juicy chicken but... I'd rather have no extra juice. Just my preference. Then you tell them what kind of burrito/ plate, you can change the type of tortilla to spinach or whatever you like, the meat and then wait again to pay. While you're waiting for your food( only takes like 2 minutes) you can walk per to their sauce bar and seriously, try em all. My fav was the verde (green) sauce. Orange was creamy but no spice. Red was okay but not really spicy and verde was perfect!!! At the bar they also have cilantro and onion. You best believe I went to town on that!!!Real good place to try out. If you don't like wet burritos, I recommend not getting the chicken.

A fairly good place to hang out with friends after work since they have a fairly big patio, but the bar inside is just as good. Just make sure it's a sunny day... since you have a pretty bay view. The crowd is all professionals hanging out for a drink or two. I got a Fragole, which was fairly good but the Pizza was pretty darn good... hopefully coming back for more

One of the few rooftop + outdoor places in the city. I have frequented this venue from the time it was Medjool. On a nice day, it's a fantastic place to be. If it's cold and windy (hello san francisco) it could be a little difficult to enjoy a cocktail. They menu has a good variety and I would highly recommend it as a Happy Hour spot on a warm SF day.

Great place for a good variety of fresh pastas and appetizers! It seems like the restaurant gets pretty busy, so I'd suggest making reservations here beforehand. Went here last Sat night with a friend around 7:20pm without a reservation. We had to wait about 40 mins, and we were seated promptly at 8pm on an actual table and not the bar. I was super craving pastas that night, and everything on their menu sounded amazing. •_Locanda started us off with some complementary, perfectly toasted focaccia bread glazed with light olive oil. Then we proceeded to order the following:APPETIZERPizza Bianca w/Smoked Bass, Horseradish, and Dill for $9 (4 stars): To start off, this is not to be confused for actual pizza because it is NOT. It's more like large pieces of crostini topped with various ingredients. Despite having a dislike for horseradish, I really enjoyed this dish! I really had my doubts... but the flavors of the smoked bass and horseradish complemented each other very well, and the thinly sliced dill on top made each bite very refreshing. Great start to the meal!MAIN DISHES - THE PASTASLinguini with Dungeness Crab/Lettuce/Sorrel for $21 (4 stars): Delicious! Linguini is not my favorite pasta, but combined with dungeness crab? I'M THERE. The pasta was slightly wider than the average linguini noodle (probably why I liked it), cooked al dente, and there were tons of pieces of fresh crab meat in the dish. I ate the entire thing up, but I think I would've liked the sauce to be a little less oily. I was also thrown off a couple times by some small pieces of crab shell in the dish. Still tasty though!Radiatore with Lamb Ragu for $17 (rating: NA): My friend ordered this, but I had one bite. The texture of the pasta was good (Flour + Water was still way better), but I thought that the lamb flavor was a little too potent for the dish. Although I'm a huge fan of lamb, the flavor of the lamb seemed to detract from the other flavors of tomato, pecorino, and mint. It was still good though, and my friend devoured it all.Both of us really enjoyed our food, but I definitely think the service could've used some improvement. The service was a little sporadic... Our waiter was super slow at times, especially when taking our orders and giving us the check. But he did come back pretty often to fill our water glasses. To wrap up -- Locanda, your food impressed me (even though your service did not), but I still look forward to coming back and seeing what other types of pastas and appetizers you have to offer!

The pizza was incredibly delicious. Two slices was more than plenty and very filling. The best part was the service and hospitality. I will definitely make it a ritual to go to Golden Boy Pizza every time I visit San Francisco.

Came here in hungry anticipation, after reading the reviews. Approximately, 15 minutes in line on Friday during lunch time, I suppose wasn't too bad.Most slices are $4.25, and come fully loaded. •_Unfortunately, the pizza was nothing special. •_I liked that the bottom of the pizza was crisp, while the inside was soft and doughy. •_The clams tasted like what one would get from a can. •_Of the three of us who ate it, one person really liked it, while 2 of us thought it edible.We also ordered a pesto veggie pizza, which was said to be so-so.The combo pizza was also reportedly okay, though my lunch date said he has had better. •_So all in all an okay experience. Nothing that I foresee myself ever craving. •_However nothing really to complain about. •_Extra kudos for good service.

$2 for tacos and cheese quesadillas. •_Tasty and good but not the best. •_And for $2 it's definitely a deal. •_The portions are fairly large, too. The place can get a but crowded and stuffy (poor ventilation)
You want a great calzone? •_Here's your place!

Little star has been in my bookmarks for some time. When the roommate said he was craving pizza, I suggested Little star. Finally, I get to try their pizza! I know they're known for their deep dish, but I wasn't in a deep dish kind mood, so we stuck to their thin crust pizzas. We got take out of the following:Spicy chicken wings ($11.50) - Pound of wings served with baby carrots

After much anticipation, I went to Crystal Jade Jiang Nan for dim sum lunch today. •_The place is super nice, but I will not return soon for the following reasons:1) I was expecting this place to be expensive, but everything is over-the-top expensive2) Oolong tea is $7 per person3) a dim sum plate of 3 pieces of shrimp and scallop dumplings is $12.504) fried rice and noodles are not price by plate, but by serving. •_$15 per serving of chow fun (that's $60 chow fun for a party of 4)Frankly, I don't mind paying for high prices for food if the food is super good... in this case, it isn't. •_Everything I had was good, but no better than the dim sum you can find at Yank Sing or Koi.I am glad I experienced this new place, but there is nothing compelling about it that makes me want to go back. •_My next financial dim sum outing will be at Yank Sing.

Franchino's was a great mom and pop Italian restaurant in North Beach. •_It was a warm, friendly atmosphere and to top it off they served delicious food. I ordered one of the specials. •_The fact that the waitress said, "My mom made this great pasta..." made me soon realize that this was food going to be made with love. •_:) •_The pasta was very tasty that even my friend dug into it himself.The service was great and either the daughter or the mom checked in on us. •_The bus boy continually made sure our waters were full and I was bummed that I didn't have enough room for dessert.The only reason I'm giving it four stars is simply because the space is pretty small. •_Be sure to get there a little early though because it'll get crowded quick and they don't take reservations.Another great thing about them was while I was waiting outside for my friend, the owner was outside opening the door for the guests and while doing that he and I would chat as if we were hanging out at his house. •_Really great people and welcoming environment.Go eat at Franchino's!
First time here and I'm a fan! •_I heard this place was featured on Guy Fiery's show Diners, Drive-Ins

Amazing amazing amazing and amazing did I say it was amazing? This place is so good it might be the best pasta and Italian food I have every ate. It is fresh and home made and great service. MUST TRY IF YOUR IN SAN FRANCISCO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

My mother always told me that I should focus on the positives whenever possible. With that in mind, the salsa verde tacos I ordered the other day used very fresh ingredients.Papalote's flavor just wasn't to my liking. Perhaps it was because the salsa that came with the chips reminded me of creamy tomato soup. Maybe it's because my tacos had a spice level usually reserved for the residents of Branson, Missouri.It wasn't terrible... I've just had better.

It's what they call one of those "hole in the wall" places. Actually, the ambience was good for a "hole in the wall". I took my date (who was previously unimpressed with Chinatown restaurants) here for more authentic Chinese cuisine and fresher seafood in Chinatown on a budget. The seafood claypot met our expectations.

A DIOS MIO!Let's remove the fact that this place is vegan. •_Take it off the table. •_They are slingin some incredibly tasty food for anyone.I get the impression that you can't survive in The Mission if you serve bad mexican food. •_In my mind, you will get laughed out of the neighborhood by the incredibly advanced Mexican food palate of Californians and Mexicans alike. •_Thankfully, Gracias Madre will never suffer such a fate.As soon as my tamal got to the table, I knew this was going to be a memorable meal. •_I ordered it "mojado" which means then unwrap it and drizzle it with mole and with their cashew sour cream. •_With the beans and escabeche on the side, this was probably one of the best meals on my trip and will certainly stick out in my mind for years to come. •_I only wish we had one in philly because I would frequent it.The prices were excellent and the design of the place just made me feel like I was in Mexico, even though I have never been there. •_I imagine the colorful tiles, deep dark wood accents and religious paraphernalia to be straight out of plenty of Mexican joints. •_I support everything they are doing here and I'm happy I had the chance to experience it.

Everyone has their favorite Taqueria in the Mission, and mine is hands down El Buen Sabor. I admit that I've never ordered anything besides a super vegetarian burrito, but what a super vegetarian burrito it is. •_The food always tastes and looks fresh and it's often busy which I take as a good sign.

I was really excited to try this place with my friend for a weekday brunch. I was super shocked at how long the line was on a Friday morning. We definitely waited outside in the cold for at least an hour before getting inside. When we walked inside, we only had a little time to decide what to order before we found ourselves at the cashier. The cashier was really friendly!My friend ordered the Monte Cristo and I ordered the french toast and homefries to share. Our food took FOREVER to come, but I guess that made sense considering how many people they had to serve, but it seemed like people who got there after us were getting served before us. In terms of the food, the french toast was great but pretty average and the homefries were delicious but a little too oily. I am not a very big fan of ham but I managed to also really enjoy the Monte Cristo, and I would definitely recommend others to order the Monte Cristo. The presentation of the Monte Cristo is very very nice as well.Overall, it was a nice restaurant, but I think the place is a bit overhyped other than the Monte Cristo. I would definitely come back here if the wait isn't too long!

Hint: Even though they say that they deliver, they only do so within short "walking distances". Otherwise, the food is good. I've had the garlic noodles, the Vietnamese pasta, the canh chau and ca kho. Expensive but good.
I LOVE this restaurant. My absolute favorite waitress is Claudia. She's super nice and attentive... She explained everything on the menu to me and told me about Llamas.
Still great, just wanted to add the Beijing Chicken and Eggplant is the bomb. •_Also, you can now get delivery through trycaviar.com

From my 3 days in San Francisco this was the best meal we ate. The food tasted fantastic, the service was speedy and polite and the price was low.Even 3 days later I am still thinking about this meal and am now searching for a Vietnamese •_restaurant near me that comes close to Kim Thanh

Love this place. Definitely want to keep this place my little secret...but here it is: One of the few Italian restaurants I know that offers a whole page dedicated to seafood pasta/ Italian cuisine. Start with the caesar salad! My all time favorites are the crab pot pie and sea bass ravioli in lobster reduction sauce. Salmon farfalle is rich and decadent as well. Definitely hits the spot if you're looking for a hearty and comforting meal on a chilly night.

They were severely understaffed on a Sunday evening. They seated us and promptly forgot we existed. They took 15 minutes to come ask about drinks, and then 30 minutes later there was no sign of a waiter. I even asked the host to send someone over and no luck. We left hungry after being at the table for 45 minutes.

My Thanksgiving trip back up to Nor-Cal consists of catching up on all the food places I have been missing out on.For one- Paxti's. My family loved Zachary's but didn't want to make that trek so I came here instead. It was delicious! Lunch special for $9.99 is sooooooooooo worth it! Salad, slice, and soda. Salad is humoungous!! And you can pick any from the menu- I chose the Greek Salad. Tons of freshly chopped veggies and a nice chunk of feta atop. For the slice I got the veggie. Super cheesy and gooey :) I loved the artichoke hearts inside. It was a bit salty but nothing a wash of soda couldn't help. The best part was the crust!! Flaky and delish!! I hate really doughy crusts and Paxti's crust is like a cross-breed of a biscuit and a trad. crust. YUM.I have tried Chicago-style pizza in Chicago and this place reminds me of the Windy City :)

this place is quite close to my house, so i go there a lot, and i have to say, i really like it. the servers are not the friendliest bunch, but the food comes out fast as hell. if you get as cranky as i do when i'm hungry, and let yourself be hungry for a very long time before actually deciding you should probably really get serious about eating something (as i do), then that kind of speed is clutch.for those veggie-minded folks:-mandarain eggplant. oh god yes. am sitting here hungover on a saturday morning and cannot wait to get my hands on that shit once they open in....ugh, 6 hours.-sauteed string beans. tons of garlic, but very tasty.-kung pao tofu. yum.this place is totally delicious, has a totally nice atmosphere, and is way reasonably priced. recommended: yes.

Came here on a Saturday night for a last minute dinner around 7 because the wait for Tony's Pizza on the other street was 2 hours. •_It looked pretty busy inside and out but our friendly hostess said it would only be a 10 minute wait. Ordered a Moscow mojito at the bar which was really good. Our waiter at the table was on point with service. I ordered the gnochetti with garlic and I loved it. I only finished less than half of it since it's such a heavy dish. Can't wait to go back and try dessert next time!

Best traditional mexican in the city. The fish torta is unbelievable. The salsa bar is on point, clean, fresh and has 10 different choices. The chicken tortilla soup is the best in it's class... and i got both the chicken soup and the fish torta for 5.75?!?! what!!! orchata is super fresh and not too sweet. i love it, i make up excuses just to get down that far in the mission. great atmosphere, nice hand painted tiles, art, and tables. great for a casual date... it is an order up front and pay and then they bring it out to ya kind of gig. No booze as far as i could see, but that isn't really the point here.

Deal with the devil.One must have been made to create the Shrimp Diablo.An unholy amount of prawns. A nefarious amount of cactus, onions and black beans (subbed for rice). A hellish kick from the spicy garlic tomato sauce.So good. So big. Almost couldn't

Just as good as I remember, and luckily the place was empty at 6pm on a rainy Saturday so the food was ready right away. The food here is excellent.The decor is meh, and I don't recommend sitting facing the front window unless you want to be panhandled to, repeatedly. Next time I'll try take-out, and there definitely will be a next time.

I like the outdoor patio, it is a bit pricey but what do you expect, it's a hotel venue along the waterfront. Drinks are good, bartender is nice. We had almonds with garlic, it was ok. Spicy Cashews, that was ok too. Fried Cheese balls, eat them fast so they stay hot and melty. And olives were good, I wish there were more big olives and less small ones.

Dumpling Kitchen is a solid dumpling place. We arrived at 7:15 pm on a Thursday and waited about 15 min before we were seated. As a party of two, we were seated at a larger table with another party of two. Not bad if you're open to meeting strangers and being nosy about what other people ordered!We ordered soup dumplings, pork dumplings, pea shoots, and Shanghai noodles. All delicious and filling! It's not gourmet by any means, but the food was warm and good.Will return!

I finally got the chance to try this place out! I figure I would take my boyfriend here to eat before our show to wicked since he LOVES italian food. We got the baby octopus for our appetizer and it was well executed. The broth that came with the octopus was amazing! •_We got the seafood linguine with squid ink and the fish. They were both delicious! My boyfriend loved the squid ink linguine and would of course drive back all the way to the city for it! For desserts, we got the Sardinian Ricotta and Saffron Cake, it was perfect. A flavorful, light dessert that didn't feel too heavy but was suffice for the sweet craving. As far as ambiance--it gave me a romantic/ intimacy vibe. It is a cute little small place so it's intimate for two or even a small group of 6 would still fit perfectly at this restaurant. If you want to come here just for a small bite and a glass a wine-- feel free to! They also have bar seating!Parking kind of sucked....so good luck with that! We had to park at least 5 blocks away. I'm pretty sure it's more of a challenge on a busier night like a friday or saturday.

Get the turkey with avocado and swiss on a french roll for $5.50 and you'll understand why this place is worthy of all the repeat customers. AMAZING! The best sandwich I've ever had in my entire life. Every time I'm in San Francisco I stop here, despite the hundreds of other options. It's located right along the Powell St. cable car line, so after you finish eating you can hop on and ride down to Fisherman's Wharf to digest and watch the sail boats coming into the bay from under the Golden Gate.

Meh is the perfect way to describe this restaurant. Food was ok at best. Smaller portions, higher prices and a much lower quality than Chef Hunan, a chinese restaurant just two blocks away. Can't find a single reason to go back to this place.

Delicious! Decided to be adventurous and try the garlic clam because it's the one that kept having to be replaced as we watched from the line outside. I love the crispy crust and thought it had great flavor! •_Also, my kids never eat the crust but they both devoured their pepperoni slices!
The best vegetarian burrito I've ever had. Whoa.

I love this little, homey neighborhood gem. •_The food is wonderful. •_The fresh, homemade pasta and sauces are incredible. •_My favorite is the light and flavorful lasagna. •_It isn't anything like the overly cheesy American version. •_Everything here is delicious. •_The restaurant is small, with a few tables and stools. •_A very unpretentious place that puts the emphasis on food and not decor. •_Great Italian owners/staff.
Lounge|

Rough around the edges is the best way to describe this restaurant, the employees and the clientele. The staff sort of acts like they don't really care. The guy who brought me my plate neglected to tell me the plate would be scalding hot. The food takes a long time and is pretty mediocre. This place will not survive the next wave of gentrification.
I didn't love anything about this place. My chicken taco was subpar - not enough flavor and dark meat. Where was the salsa? Primavera on Saturdays at FP is bomb, but forget this place.

What an excellent restaurant! The restaurant is nice and has a good ambiance. •_On my visit, the restaurant was dimly lit and it created a nice sense of intimacy. •_ The service I did not care for. •_ If I didn't like the food so much I would have deducted a star or two. •_The waiters seemed snooty to the point where it almost made me uncomfortable every time they came to the table. •_We did a 3 course meal which was more than enough food for me. What ever you do, do not miss the lobster panzerotti or the foie gras pasta. •_ The panzerotti were little pillows of perfection. Beautiful Italian flavors and delicate stunning food. •_I loved the food so much I would visit again knowing I would have to overlook the service.

I've come here several times w/friends or just my boyfriend. I always got the Chicken Fetuccini Alfredo, but I chose something from the Nutritional Book and got the Grilled Chicken Penidi (or something like that). Which was 400 calories vs. my usual 2,000+ calories alone w/the fetuccini. I barely ate what I got. Our waitress was super nice. She was very attentive. She noticed that I barely ate any of my food so she insisted to not charge me. The manager comes up to me and asks if I'd like some chicken fetuccini to-go, and I declined. And they still charged me. Not that great customer service, why would you insist to not charge me but end up doing so? It doesn't make sense. If anything, I should've just took that fetuccini offer to-go. I gave more tip than 15% too. I won't be coming back anytime soon, only if I'm super craving Olive Garden. Otherwise, no.

YES!!! A million times yes! •_This place is awesome and I'm so happy it's in this neighborhood. •_Plentiful tacos, plentiful sides, plentiful chips.Just the right amount of spice and these people are nice!

Small little place with a huge menu! We waited in line for a good 30-45 minutes before we were able to order/pay/be seated. It was just crowded for brunch but it was well worth the wait! They have really great fresh squeezed juice. I got pancakes with fruits and scrambled eggs and it was all delicious. My husband got their club sandwich with a side of potato salad and it was also really good! Aside from the wait it was a good experience! I'd definitely come back :)
Gotta love this place.. food is good and service is super fast!. One of my top destinations after a night out in the city!. A hole in the wall but always hits the spot!

I'm going to start off by saying, the service was good! •_Totally acceptable despite what the other reviewers have written. •_My critique lies in the food. •_I think it has potential, but there was little to no taste in any of the dishes we had. •_My friend ordered the Rojas enchiladas and there was nothing inside the tortilla. •_Everything, which was not much, was thinly layered on top of 4 tortillas. •_My other friend ordered the Tinka and it was nothing to write home about. •_I had the carnitas and they were fine, but could have used a whole lot more flavor. •_In one word, I'd describe the food here as bland. •_For the price point, the food should not to be bland.
My wife and I had the clam chowder which was very good. We also had the signature cioppino that was NOT very impressive.
Ceviche is sooooo freaking good! And I'm really picky when it comes to al pastor tacos but they were delicious!!! 100% recommend!

Kind of hyped. We waited for about an hour and 15 minutes starting at 9:00 PM on a saturday evening. Yes, we came at 9:00 PM and there was still over an hour wait!I was excited to try with all of the good reviews... and it always seems busy with people standing outside. Figured it should be good.And it was good, just not a spectacular, "wait-for-an-hour-and-15-minutes-for-an-already-late-dinner" type of good.Admittedly, I just don't think I'm that into "fancy" pizza. It's just not satisfying in that pizza way. You want that pizza from childhood. The one that's greasy with both tomato sauce and mozzerella on that simple crust - possibly with good old fashion pepperoni. Not that it has to be simple, like I love the crust at Little Star. I guess I like a more down-to-earth pizza. Yeah, I think that's what I'm trying to say.I'm glad I tried it because all of SF seems to be obsessed with this place. But I think I'll pass on the wait.

Yes they are expensive but boy is it delicious. It's an adaptation of fresh and fast street food but at ferry market price offerings. •_Last visit it was $3.50 for a carne asada taco. •_It's delicious enough that I eat here everyday when I'm out in San Fran. •_I have never had anything close or better to what I have eaten here. •_Their soup is good. •_The chilaquiles left something to be desired. •_Oh, if only I lived closer. •_I'm always happy to see the same staff every time I go there! •_I can't wait to go back for a taco or two or three.
Nice ambience, so was the staff, the portion is good for the price

This is for take out only. I have not yet dined in... My kids and I were hanging at a park nearby and I could tell they were getting hungry and not willing to sit at any restaurant. Time to duck out quick and grab the kiddos something they'll eat and fast. Low and behold I trusted my app (w a 10% off check in offer) to lead me here. I phoned in my order and the gentlemen on the phone said 15mins. Wow fast! I quickly drove there and it was ready as expected. Large half pep and half cheese + 10% off =$18 (plus tip, I always tip I'm in the biz to).Good thin crust. Nice and hot... I'd return.

Look no further for a prefect dim sum joint in SF metro area - this is THE PLACE! You wouldn't go wrong with any of their orders. I had tried many other places and by far there is no comparison. I read a lot of reviewers who complained about the long wait and lack of parking. In order to beat the crowd, you need to get to the place right before it's open (10 am on weekends). We had a party of six and we were seated right away even though there was a line outside the restaurant waiting to get in. This will also solve the issue of lack of parking spaces since there will be plenty spaces early in the morning. This proof the point when you see so many people want to wait to eat at Dragon Beaux, it's a good indicator of how awesome of this place is.
The food is yummy so we keep coming back. They have a great selection on their lunch special

Beretta was able to accommodate •_our 20 persons reservation for a dinner on a Saturday (broken off to 3 different tables). The dinner was prix fixe and served family style. 1st CourseAntipasti- marinated castevetrano olives with citrus: im not a olive person, but my friends said it had a strong flavor (?)- walnut bread with burrata
The clam pizza was delicious! And the server was very friendly. Remember cash only! Would definitely go back.

I came here for lunch, and the lunch specials are awesome. Each order comes with hot and sour soup, which was pretty good. I'm not usually a fan of this soup because they're usually very sour, but this one had a nice balance with the heat. I tried the chicken breast with green beans, and it was delicious! It's deemed spicy, but it really wasn't. But the flavor was great! The green beans were cooked perfectly, and the chicken was very tender and moist. Each plate comes with rice, too. The service was great - really friendly.

My favorite go-to delivery/take-out Chinese restaurant in San Francisco. Delivery is free and pretty fast. The food satisfies every time. They do the standard dishes well. The best part about ordering from Yum Yum is when you call and they answer - "HELLO!! YUM YUM!!!"Our favorites: Beef and broccoli, sweet and sour porkAvoid: Hot and sour soupMust do: Order 3 (used to be 2) entrees and get a free chow main or fried rice. Only available for delivery orders

Great service and Good Dim Sum! A friend and I went to Hakkasan on Saturday for dim sum! The dim sum was very tasty and seemed very fresh. It was not traditional, but very good! I devoured the roast duck pumpkin puff and almost asked for a second plate! We had 7 other plates and there wasn't a sour note in the bunch!The best part of our visit to Hakkasan was the service! Terrific people who made us feel like royalty! They checked in on us the perfect amount and really seemed to care about how our experience was going! I think I would go back just to be treated that well again! :) If there was an area that needed improvement, it would be the venue! We were there first thing on a Saturday and the space felt like my moms house after a high school party! There was this post boozy funk everywhere, it felt like the restaurant had a hangover! Overall, I'd give Hakkasan 4.5 stars!

I came here and there was a decent line at 11am on a Saturday. •_The place was pretty small and there's no place to sit. •_The owner of the store next to them kinda shouted at me to wait in line across the side walk, because I was almost in front of his door. •_Anyway, I ordered 6 shrimp dumplings, chive and shrimp dumplings, and noodles. •_They were all really good, but I would pass on the noodles next time. •_Good place to come for good dim sum at an awesomely cheap price!

Everything they use is fresh so no one can really talk down the quality of their food. The flavor was spot on for the simplicity of these dishes. This is not an attempt for a Michelin star people but hot damn, their house salsas were killer and full of flavor. I tried their mango chicken and was so happy to bite into RIPE mango that I'm sure they're getting from a produce stand nearby. Green tea salad (ask for spicy) was disgustingly delicious and this is a guy who's had Burma Superstar before. Curry chicken was a good choice for a low sodium option cause shit was bland. House noodle was decent and the beef was flavorful! Egg rolls were meh but this was fried 20 minutes before they closed so I doubt any oil used was fresh. Was in and out in 15 minutes and only exchanged a few words with these ladies. Guess kids expect thrones while they're literally surrounded by poverty. Come if you're an adult and expect fresh and good tasting food at a very low price.

Amazing Italian food. •_Great service. A San Francisco original. •_We highly recommend this establishment. •_For two people we ordered two appetizers. It was almost too much. •_We almost couldn't finish our entrees. •_As locals. •_We'll be back
I dislike most of SF Mexican food because I've lived in San Diego and had the good stuff. BUT this place has super tasty and fresh meats. 'Nuff said.
Amazing! I prefer the chicken to the beef, but simply delicious. I especially love the salsa they give you with your chips - so fresh and yummy.

Update. I have been to Uva approx. 20 times in the seven weeks they have existed. That's 2-3 times per week. I've spent somewhere in the four figures. I have never done this with a restaurant before much less anything I've mentioned on Yelp. I hope that is saying something. Just some highlights:1. They do amazing things with greens I've never heard of. It's all about the pea tendrils. Zucchini blossoms (not deep fried) -- crazy. Barley-corn-fava-squid! Some other shit I've never heard of nor could remember if you asked me apart from it being delicioso. And this is "supposed" to be a meat/cheese kind of place first and foremost.. Even the veggies are interesting.2. The staff is universally adorable. And professional. I have to imagine that any dings in service are completely attributable to their being slammed at times.3. The carne, cheese and most of all *wine* are all geared towards sampling and experimentation. It has kept me interested all this time and they keep it fresh.4. Do not be afraid to go girly with the rosato, pignoletto, in bocca al lupo prosecco cocktail, salads, crudos.. Not every meal has to be heavy with tannins and fat.5. You probably know about the crudos and the cheeses but their *condiments* are standouts in and of themselves.. vanilla salt, son!6. I mentioned this before but it's worth mentioning again. The wine list is broad, interesting and pretty reasonably priced.7. Do not miss the sorbet. It's really creamy and fruity. Not at all sugary/icy.Something to keep in mind is that this is a perfect place to meet with friends and have a casual meal with wine. Each dish is around $4-8 and the wines are all $10-14 or so for 8 oz. carafes. 2 oz. pours are exactly a quarter of that price. Within that framework it is a fantastic experience. The atmosphere is airy and conducive to conversation. Their pricing structure and menu is very much geared towards sampling and experimentation, so I suggest you take advantage of that and explore stuff. And drinking. It's very good for drinking.

Yum. •_Great service, nice wine suggestions, involved and happy owners, hardworking as well. •_Make a reservation during power hours. •_Cable Car stop right outside, One of my favorites, which says a lot in this town for Italiano.

Awful experience, awful food. •_We ordered the hot pot with three vegetables. My friend asked how to use the hot pot, and without asking, the waiter used my chopsticks to demonstrate. •_He threw some cabbage into the pot, fished it out, dunked it in what was rather gross tasting "dipping sauce", and poured this glop onto my plate. •_In addition to his unprofessional behavior, the hot pot was bland and a huge disappointment.We also ordered the Beef Pancake which was really disgusting. •_The meat looked raw and the pancake was soggy and drenched in oil. •_Nasty!

Yummy! Not my favorite pasta ever but I'm glad I tried it out. Had the octopus soup and it was very flavorful. The uni pasta I loved but you have to be a huge uni fan to appreciate it... Very rich but the breadcrumbs on top balanced out the richness. Definitely delicious and very different

OK, I should preface my review and say I am not a fan of House of Nanking. Brown sauce, loud tourists, brown sauce, rude waiters ....did I mention the brown sauce? Sauce just shouldn't be the shade of cow dung, I don't think. Back from a Yelping break (...I was out of the country so sue me!), I tried to keep an open mind about their new sister restaurant, a FiDi-focused place called, rather unappetizingly, Fang. I was hoping that the waiters would be dressed like Dracula and the Wolf Man but no. They went the more predictable route for this neighborhood, a trendy look heavy on the dark wood and orange lighting. I just kind of felt like I was at a Hong Kong franchise of Lyon's. The analogy is not that far off. The prices are pretty reasonable by FiDi standards, and the portions are pretty hefty. It's as if you mixed Max's Diner with Yank Sing in a blender, I think Fang would be the result. For all that analysis, the food is just a couple of inches north of adequate. Jamie W. and I first tried the $5.95 Fried Onioncake which was covered in a sesame sauce that was - yes, you guessed it - brown (see photo). It was decent, but it does pale in comparison to the same concoction to be found at Henry's Hunan right on the next block. We had better luck with the $13.95 Cooling Lettuce Wraps with chicken - but they don't give you enough lettuce to scoop up the filling (see photo). I also wish they would mince the poultry rather than dice it into chunks. I felt like I was eating a Hungry Man Special in a chuck wagon. The brown sauce came back in the $10.95 House Lo-mein with chicken, garlic, peashoots - but it didn't seem as overwhelming this time (see photo). The $6.95 Dry-Braised Green Beans were standard issue though nicely crisp (see photo). I welcome those anytime for dinner. I would likely come back to Fang for a business lunch since I'm just down the block, but it really doesn't feel like a dining destination to me despite the trendy touches. I'd likely go back to Henry's since I am a creature of habit. FOOD - 3 stars...ok...Max's meets Yank Sing, and this is their bastard offspring AMBIANCE - 3 stars...I hope you find orange lighting flattering to your skin tone SERVICE - 3 stars...a bit on the disorganized side, but they seem to come back for confirmation a lot TOTAL - 3 stars...I guess I'm just not that much of a Fang fan
Food was sub par. Even for American Mexican, it had no taste or flavor at all. Drinks were acceptable but nothing to write home about. Great views of the city and good atmosphere though.

Dim Yum! (#sorrynotsorry)After reading through countless reviews and scrolling through so many delicious-looking pictures, I decided Lai Hong Lounge would be a great place to get authentic dim sum in San Francsico. •_We came here shortly after it opened (9:30) on Saturday and were lucky enough to avoid any lines. We were seated right away and given a laminated menu and a marker. •_This is where you can get in big trouble if your eyes are bigger than your stomach! •_You read through the menu items and mark off how many orders of each particular item. •_Warning: these aren't little dinky tiny dumplings. •_These are decently sized orders and anything that has shrimp comes with huge pieces of shrimp. •_We ordered Shrimp Dumplings, Pork Shrimp Siu Mai, (2) Shrimp Noodle Roll, Chinese Doughnut Noodle Roll, Beef Short Rib, Steamed Pork Buns, Broccoli w/ Oyster Sauce, Tofu Skin Roll w/ Pork

Gargoyle balls taste better than their burritos.No kidding. I was quite drunk when I went to this place, and you know how drunk people think everything is good, but this place - it sobered me up (the bad way).

Needed a place for lunch and my coworker recommended this spot for a bite to eat. Took my zappatos to go. I had carnitas in •_mine and it was as people say a quesadilla/burrito hybrid. The outside tortilla is cooked to a nice crisp, and the goodness of a burrito all contained within it. Very unique decor, dimly lit so i thought i was in the wrong place only to realize that this place is a restaurant. This place is great and i'd recommend y'all trying it out and checking out the other items on the menu that I haven't gotten to yet.

Two burritos make this place sing. One, the mexipino burrito. Chicken adobo with garlic rice. A classic Filipino dish presented in a Mexican staple. It's a beautiful combination showcasing the best of Mexican and Filipino fusion.The signature item is their triple threat burrito. Named in honor of one of the best DJ crews in the world, you will find this burrito a tasty, unique concoction. Though it lost on Throwdown it's still worthy.
It's your standard pizza places but due to location it's always swarmed with tourists and has a line for average food. I like the Greek salad and the chicken sandwich is a nice alternative to pizza.

Came here around noon on a Saturday needing to have my pizza inch scratched and it certainly was. •_I like all types of thicknesses when it come to crust and this was definitely on the thicker side. It has a really nice soft texture inside and a little crispy on the bottom. •_I had the pepperoni slice and my wife had the combo and the toppings were solid. The sausage on the combo had a really nice fennel flavor that I would come back for.

I am prefacing my review by saying, Italian food is probably my least favorite type of food (I don't like cheese and I don't like pasta). But every once and a while I try an Italian joint.I came here with some friends for a Saturday night dinner. When you walk in you are overcome with the aroma of the food. It smells heavenly at this place.I thought it was interesting that they had a lot of Japanese artwork on the walls of an Italian restaurant. Just an observation.I thought the food here was decent, but ungodly expensive. I can't believe I paid $26 for a skirt steak. A SKIRT STEAK. This arguably the cheapest and lowest classes of beef. In its defense, this dish was pretty good. You can't go wrong with a steak cooked very rare; like buttah. This dish comes with a side of roasted cauliflower and greens. We go a plate of mixed cured meats as an appetizer. Nothing to rave about, which is why this dish only gets a mention. I would not come back here willingly. Too expensive for such Plain Jane Italian food. You could do a lot better elsewhere.

Terrific food and experience~Our waiter was Jose who is exceptional~Order the beet salad~ its heavenly.Also the shrimp cocktail and Dungeness crab cocktail are both tasty. Had the bolegnese entree and wow! Incredible meal!

Love their dumplings; so yummy and so cheap! •_10 scrumptious dumplings for under $5? •_YES PLEASE!! •_Just wished this place was close enough for me to come everyday and gorge on their dumplings all day long.We ordered some XLB, crab and pork dumplings; all were fresh and tasty. •_Their spicy pork and chives dumplings, though, was what really stood out for me! •_Nice, delicate skin and yummy fillings...sitting in a heady chili oil...gawd, so good!I even found myself liking their non-dumpling items: Green onion pancakes, Shanghai noodles, and lionhead meatballs - just delicious! •_My only issue with this place was how cramped the space feels, but that's because they have so much going on in here. •_Cramped feeling aside, I am such a fan of their dumplings and have found myself craving for those spicy dumplings ever since...*drools*
Pizza was one of the best i have ever had! The hospitality was the best! We will definitely go back! It's like a diamond in the rough!

Not sure if I would recommend this one for families with young children because it's in kind of a sketchy part of the neighborhood, but once you get in the restaurant it's fine for the young ones. Many of the reviews on here describe having a bit of a wait, which I also experienced (about 15 to 20 minutes so not too bad). And the food was certainly worth the wait, as a local woman kindly told me on my way in! Overall I'd say it was a great place for dinner :)
Don't bother..... Went to watch the Giants game tonight

I had reservations yesterday at 630PM (via OpenTable) with my girlfriend to celebrate a personal milestone. I had kept it a surprise from her the whole day and just before we left, she guessed the restaurant based of the address. Needless to say, she was very excited as she loves Italian food and heard good things about Barbacco.We left our apartment in a cab at 615PM, and at 625PM while in the cab, I received a call from an employee at the restaurant informing me that she is canceling our reservation due to some type of flooding in the restaurant. It's not clear if that was a result of the rain the day before or if it was a plumbing issue. She said that they had fixed it in the morning, served people for lunch, and then something happened again. She said that they started serving dinner and since something happened again, they decided to no longer take patrons. This implies some folks were already eating dinner, and we missed the "cutoff". I also asked if we could get a reservation at the sister restaurant, Perbacco, and she couldn't help there either. I was very frustrated at this given that we made reservations a week ago and I ended up getting the cancellation 5 minutes prior to our dinner, when we were already in a cab on the way over.5 minutes notice after I've already hopped in a cab is pretty frustrating, as I ended up sinking money into the cab. We then had to find another quality restaurant (we couldn't use OpenTable since our reservation at 630 was still active and couldn't be canceled), that could seat us. The first opening we could find was 8PM, at which point we had to cab there. We were starving. All of this, because Barbacco decided to give us really no heads up or support in accommodating the inconvenience.I'm sure the food is delicious •_and service is excellent, but I'm disappointed in how this cancellation was handled. I was put in a difficult and frustrating position because of the last minute cancelation. Lucky for me, my girlfriend is a trooper.

I always passed this place when roaming around Chinatown when I used to live in the Bay. There's always a long line out the door of this place. I haven't gone to a sit-down dim sum in a LONG time, so it was nice to do it again.Since it was only 9:30 AM on a Sunday, Great Eastern wasn't packed. We were seated right away at a table meant for 8. Oh well, I guess my bf and I can have more elbow room. Their dim sum doesn't start til 10 AM, but I guess if you're ready, they can have the cooks cook the dishes for you, so you can have it before 10. Between the two of us, we ordered 8 dishes-lotus wrap, deep fried taro balls, shrimp dumplings (not sure if they're dumplings, but they have a white wrap), Chinese donut wrapped with...a wrap (#55 I believe), meatballs, shrimp noodle wrap, deep fried pork bun, and..I can't remember the other dish. Anyways, out of all the dishes, my favorite had to be the lotus wrap. Though it was smaller than other places I've been to, this has got to be one of the better tasting ones. The rice wasn't as sticky, but it stuck good enough that the fillings stayed together. The fillings (chicken?) was juicy. It mixed very well with the rice. I also liked the deep fried pork bun. It was crispy on the outside, but soft like mochi on the inside. The pork was good, but the outer layer just outshined it more.Get here early because this place can and will get full! There's a downstairs to seat the overflow, but even with that, it gets packed. The service here could be better, but then again, it's Chinatown. Our waiter didn't give us a choice of tea, yet the older group behund us got to choose a tea they wanted. Oh well...They're only there to make money, not to make you feel comfortable. I'm just used to it having lived there for so long. Both tea and water are $1, so might as well get tea to wash away the oils that you put into your body.Overall, this place is okay. Just make sure you get here early, or be prepared to wait in line. The "host" when you ask for the check, adds up manually, at the table, without using a calculator. Kinda impressed me. Props to you dude!

I am an avid fan of Mexican food and have eaten it all over California. SoCal is known for better Mexican food but only because the people that say that have not had Vallarta. They have fresh ingredients, you can customize your burrito with any tortilla and go all veggies or all meat and everything on the menu is great! I first fell in love with their nachos but then went on to love their super burrito grill. One dayI added shrimp to that super burrito grill (fresh carrots, bell pepper, onions, zucchini grilled up plus beans and rice) and since then I've never gone back. I now call that the Kassandra special and have multiple people try it and love it. Yum!!
inetti|

I've been here couple of times and every single time it's always packed with people waiting to get a table. This place is definitely one of my favorite Chinese restaurants to hit up! Especially their chicken wings are to die for! Mhmm...just thinking about them makes me drool. The fried chicken wings and the garlic spinach were absolutely my favorite things on the menu. This past weekend I came here to order to go and I ordered the chicken wings, chicken w/ mushrooms, combo fried rice and garlic spinach. The wings are super flavorful and honestly if my boyfriend wasn't around or if I wasn't sharing these dishes, I'd probably just eat all of the order by myself. That's how good they are!! Also, you can never get enough veggies! Especially the garlic spinach. It might be a simple dish to make but it's still tastes super good. The combo fried rice tasted good but it just tastes like any other fried rice that I've had before at a Chinese restaurant to be honest. The chicken and mushrooms were okay too, nothing special. My order took about 30 minutes or so to prepare. Overall, I definitely love the chicken wings from here so I'll be back to order more next time!

Every time I go here, I hate it a little more. •_Here's why:1. The line to order drinks at the bar is typically 5-people deep.2. The line to order drinks at the bar operates either on a complicated algorithm or a chaos-generated multi-variable equation, because you can stand at the "head" of the line for 15 minutes and not get waited on, while people to your left, right, and rear all get their drinks.3. It is more packed with people than the sea lion floats at Pier 39 are packed with sea lions. •_Which is to say, quite packed.4. It is expensive beyond any resemblance to reality. •_I am okay with paying $15 for a drink, but every time I do, I need to know why I am doing so. •_And when I can't answer that question, I hate you a little more.5. •_High choade content. •_The ratio of frat-robots to humans often exceeds 3-to-1, which is ordinarily considered toxic to thoughtful humans. •_My collar popped of its own accord one time when I walked in.Past experience suggests I'll be dragged here again sometime, I won't like it then, either.
Excellent food! Baja tacos and tortilla soup was awesome! Please come to San Antonio Texas!

Don't come here looking for a handgun, however, the food will definitely blow you away.If you think that was cheesy, try their walnut bread with burrata cheese. That dish is insanely cheesy and delicious, it was not overly sweet with the honey but quite good as an appetizer. We also had the beef carpaccio which was good but nothing amazing, thinly sliced and almost tasted like smoked salmon but.. maybe I was just enjoying my Vulture drink a bit too much...They have a secret 'bird-centric' bar menu which is quite fun and the first drink, the hummingbird, is incredible.
