This place was super packed and there were also people waiting outside for tables.Get the house margarita! It was the perfect drink to end my Friday night. I had the chile verde and it was pretty good. Nothing out of the ordinary though. Don't expect authentic Mexican food, it's definitely not that. The meat was tender and the sauce was flavorful. I just wish it had more of a kick to it. My mom had the Huaraches "tres Cochinitas" which includes three different kinds of pork, chile verde, carnitas, and al pastor with pineapple. I like the al pastor with the pineapple. The pineapple added a touch of sweetness to the meat. They also give you free chips and 3 kinds of salsa. One of them was really really spicy so I couldn't really eat that one, but the other 2 salsas were great!

The food is good and it's in a bar. I was a bit confused when I got here. It's unfortunately cash only which is a bit annoying. I had the fried chicken sandwhich, it's a cute theme and wouldn't mind coming here to hang out with friends. I do not recommend for a work meeting.

This bakery is located in china town. There is always a line out the door because of its fresh and delicious pastries. Their dim sum is a must try all of them taste mouth watering. They make things fresh. During harvest moon festival time they make their own moon cakes. These are the best moon cakes in town! Must get the one with mixed nuts or the lotus with two egg yolks. Good place to stop for a snack.

Good burrito, but in the category of super burritos this one is a little on the smaller side and a bit more expensive than most taquerias. •_The meat is cooked to order which is nice, but then again it also means that your burrito won't be done by the time you finish paying. •_The inside of the burrito can get a little mushy, but it's still quite tasty nonetheless with the fresh ingredients and lightly grilled, crispy tortilla.

My friends and I came here for my birthday. I was welcomed with a raspberry margarita and chips as soon as I walked through the door. Once we were seated, the servers were just as attentive. The drinks were plentiful and potent. The guacamole was fantastic. My burrito was the size of a small child. And the s'mores nachos were too big for a table of five to finish. Everything was delicious!

So I just realized I mistakenly reviewed this location the last time I went to Tacolicious instead of the one I actually visited - which was the Chestnut Street location. Regardless, this location was just as amazing, if not more. I had been craving these tacos for what seemed like ages. I visit SF at least once a year but hadn't been to Tacolicious in about three. My aunt and uncle made it a point to take me here for lunch one day since I had been eagerly awaiting them. These tacos are some of the best tacos I've ever had in my life. And trust me, I've had a lot of them. I'm pretty big on tacos. They probably make up my top food group on my personal pyramid. We went on a random weekday for lunch and opted to sit outside since the weather was nice. They gave us complimentary salsa and chips which we devoured and we loved all the different kind of salsas. We also got an order of the guacamole which was delicious. I ordered the pasion as my drink because I remembered it from three years back at the chestnut street location. Just as delicious. For tacos, I ordered the baja fish and barbacoa taco - which was a special taco on their menu. OH MY GOD, they were just as heavenly as I remembered. The baja fish was perfectly crisp and the barbacoa was so tender and flavorful. I loved these tacos so much. I seriously wish they had Tacolicious in NYC, but it would be seriously detrimental to my healthy diet. I'm truly jealous of all SF dwellers because they have this gem of a place to chow down at. Go here and have a taco for me. I'll be daydreaming about them until my next visit...

Whenever I'm shopping at Safeway during lunch top, I always pop over to the kioske that is below the restaurant for dim sum. •_It's super yummy and reasonably priced. •_Much better than the place (won't name names) on the place on 24th street just down the road.No fuss, Dim Sum - great light lunch.
Great burrito. Fried chicken burrito. Need I say more? Sauces were good too. Highly recommended.

I was in San Francisco Memorial Day weekend and my friends and I and we saw the reviews were great for this place so we stopped by given we were nearby! First of all I did not expect it to be like chipotle but then very nice modern to sit down in after grabbing your food.All I know is, I saw the women cooking behind the counter and I knew it was going to be Authentic Hispanic food. All the food was being cooked in front of you. The prices were a little high for being a chipotle type restaurant but *faints* it was worth the price. The food was incredible. I ordered the enchiladas with chicken and a pork tamale. The sauce in the enchiladas was so tasty not too tomato-ey and a little spicy! I've never ordered a tamal from anywhere except my grandmas but this came fairly close to being the best tamale I've had (love you grams) Would I drive five hours again and come back here? 100 times yes!

Great lunch ... very busy but we still got good service from Joy .... unfortunately we had a family with a shrieking child that didn't even have the decency to take the kid outside. •_Luckily the staff politely asked them if they might be able to calm the kid down and they got pushed out of shape and left. •_Oh well .... I'm sure they will write a bad review of this place but maybe they should remember to think of other people when they're out in a public place .... we want to enjoy a nice meal and not have to listen to their unruly kid.
im Sum Restaurant|

Awesome find in the financial district. As a former New Yorker, I had visited both locations in Manhattan many times. This outpost certainly lives up to the legacy. Great location, bright airy atmosphere, and friendly service. It's great for a business lunch, but I have a soft spot for their happy hour. The carnitas tacos (2 for $6) and chicken flautas are my go to faves (not including margaritas of course). Its true that it can be hectic at times, but its great for a fiesta after work. For a full meal option, I recommend the chicken mole enchiladas. The sauce is delicious. You may need a siesta after the fiesta, tho.

This was the worst food experience I've had in San Francisco Chinatown. The wonton noodle was soggy and had no taste. The jook was very bland. •_The service is ok but don't ask too many question. •_The hk milk tea was the only good thing I had there. •_Definitely not recommended

So.... the other night I had some time to kill before a concert, so my best bud and I decided to have a Burrito Showdown in the Mission. We stopped at El Farolito, and then at LA TAQUERIA. We cut both in half and had a little bit of heaven from both...We ordered the super carne burrito at Farolito, and the Carnitas at La Taq. We ate both side by side, and hands down La Taq was the victor... Their carnitas were without a doubt, the best I've ever had. I prefer rice in my burrito, and La Taq does not put it in, and it did not matter one bit. I will say, the free chips was a nice perk at Farolito - and their burrito is much bigger.... but size doesn't always matter - right ladies??? The flavor at La Taqueria was unmatched. La Taq was definitely more crowded too. El Farolito - 4.75 starsLa Taqueria - 5 stars!

Came here for a free chicken burrito and that is what I got. •_Well, that and steak nachos and a fish taco. •_I NEVER order chicken but since that's what I had to get for the scoutmob coupon, I hesitantly got the chicken burrito and it was... MOIST! •_I was quite pleasantly surprised. •_I really like the fruit salsa

I know where my pizza by the slice to-go-to place is!!! I LOVED the garlic clam pizza - piping hot from the oven. The crust is spectacular - a thick, crunchy, and yet very airy. It wasn't overloaded with cheese, which I feared, and the garlic + clam taste to it was very satisfying. Great dive place with a casual vibe. For $4.25/slice it's a little pricey but very filling. I wished there were more variety though but I'll probably be sticking to the garlic clam since it was just that good!

Actially, 3 1/2 stars.Wife and I had a rather mixed experience here despite the rave reviews. •_We made a Saturday 6 PM reservation and when we arrived, it was already rather crowded (it opens at 5:30 PM0. •_We were seated promptly and the service was initially quite prompt and solicitous. •_We started with roasted calamari which were quite delicious with wonderful sauce, and also their special arugala and tomato salad which was fresh. •_We also had the baby octopus stew, which had a rather thick tomato sauce- wife liked it a great deal, for me it was a little too tomato thick. •_Wife had their special lightly broiled Norwegian salmon, which was wonderful, but my Sardinian fregula (VERY small droplets of pasta) •_with sea urchin and shaved tuna heart was again in a very thick and sour tomato sauce almost completely obliterating other flavors- the tomato sauce here is VERY thick, which I did not know. •_We also had their Sardinian flat bread with evoo and pecorino, which was wonderful- light and crispy and cheesy. •_We also had a small portion of their extra virgin olive oil, which was fine, but not outstanding. •_As the evening progressed, the restaurant became very crowded and noisy and the service slowed down to a crawl- about 30 minute wait between the last of the appetizers and the long-awaited arrival of the main course. •_They have a very extensive wine list and some artisanal Sardinian beer- I enjoyed the "diavolo." •_Overall, an interesting mixed dining experience, but we will probably be back for the calamari, flat bread, and some other of their interesting dishes sans tomato sauce.

My god avoid this place completely. •_we went here for dinner, looking to satisfy my craving for good chow mein. •_I figured, hey, it's americanized, maybe they'll have, at the least, generic chow mein. Ive never walked out of dinner so dissapointed. •_I didnt even want to take any of the large portion of left overs home; it was that bad.I dont understand why people go here. $5 for tea? please, go to a chinese restaurant, and it's free, and way better (bottomless too)

Sesame Beef with the asparagus and fried rice is my favorite. It's kind of funny because Alice's is right around the corner. This place is always busy with a lot of locals. Take it from a San Francisco native this is one of the top Chinese restaurants in the city. Customer service is amazing my brother and I ate here a few weeks ago and the hot and spicy soup was too spicy! Lol but the waiter just said 'I'll fix that for you' that was really nice of him. You got to get lucky with parking but it's totally worth it.
Pretty darn good, but the complementary chips are hilarious. •_I received a bag with a total of 4 chips. •_What a joke. •_Save the paper.

A small, quaint neighbourhood restaurant in the middle of Nob Hill that serves surprisingly good Italian food. My friend and I tried the Gnocchi Bolognese and the Fettuccine alla Vongole. I absolutely loved the fettuccine, the taste of white wine was strong, while there was an ample amount of clams. The gnocchi bolognese was also quite good and I liked the meat sauce. I wish they would give bread during lunch though, as the sauce would go so well with it. I did feel that the pasta did not stand out against the many many Italian restaurants in town, but this place offers relatively good value and serving size for the price. The brunch menu looks pretty delicious too, and I'm excited to go back and try!

Hands down, a MUST try when visiting San Francisco! One of my favorite places to eat and go to with my friends. I don't think I've ever met another San Franciscan who has said that San Tung's is anything other than amazing! I always recommend this place first when I want to eat and hang out with friends and I always order their famous chicken wings with a side of their garlic green peas and just regular steamed white rice. Such a simple and delicious meal at a very reasonably price!

Peking duck was amazing! Our other favorites are baked bbq pork buns, pork rice noodle, durian puff pastry, deep fried pork balls, steamed custard buns...the list goes on!!For dim sum I would recommend coming for the lunch menu because the options are much more than the dinner options. Go early before opening or wait an hour plus on weekends!We came for dinner the first time today and the craziest thing happened when I didn't write a tip on the bill. My intention was to personally hand over the $20 tip to our waiter but a lady (boss?) chased us before the exiting and said we didn't tip! She said there must've been a mistake because we didn't leave anything. Wow she was demanding and I can see how she puts off customers. So in her hands with our signed bill open we dropped $20 on $114 and she happily thanked us and walked away. But why so aggressive hunny? LolAnyways, we love the food and will be back for lunch!

I'm forever ruined for any other pizza. •_This is perfection, folks. •_I dream of their Margherita Pizza with an additional topping of homemade fennel sausage.Where else can you get Michelin rated food for around $15 a person? •_Enough said.

Taco Bar is just OK. •_They make you pay for chips and salsa which I don't like.Not a ton of vegetarian choices.Prices are average/little pricey in my opinion. •_Veggie burritos are like 8 bucks (and then you have to pay for chips/salsa).
The cola braised pork (in a baked bun)is AMAZING! Jeeze. I have dreams about this. Seriously.

Came here for a late lunch around 3:00 PM. I heard good things from friends so I had high expectations going in. 10 minutes in, we still didn't have a menu, even though the restaurant only had 2 other occupied tables. I had to go grab them myself. Another 10 minutes passed and all the wait staff was no where to be seen.The food did come out very quickly after we placed our order. We tried the Dan Dan noodles and the dry fried chicken wings. The noodles had good texture and flavor with a decent amount of seafood/meat. The chicken wings were on the larger side like other reviews mentioned. The larger size and piping hot temperature made it difficult to eat. The sauce did have a nice sweet flavor and the skin had a very satisfying crunch. The food here was fine, but didn't live up to the hype. All the items on the menu sounded delicious, so may come back to try their xiao long bao and other dishes. Maybe if we came earlier instead of near their lunch/dinner service break, we would received better service.

Oh. My. Goodness. This place is as good as it gets! I had been wanting to go to La Palma for quite some time, and recently found myself down on 24th St. on a mission for some carnitas. Because I grew up in San Diego, I am a little judgmental toward the Mexican food of Northern California (i.e. Chipotle just doesn't do it for me), but as soon as I entered La Palma, I knew I found a gem. All around the store are homemade tortillas, salsas, guacamole, cotija cheese, chips, dried chipotle peppers, and other delicious things for you to take home to enjoy later. As you proceed to the back, you see the open kitchen where employees are making tortillas from scratch and preparing food. La Palma is doing it right. And my carnitas burrito was absolutely heavenly. I cannot wait to come back here and try more of my favorite dishes!

The perfect place (I actually probably went too often this summer!) for meeting friends and grabbing drinks after work downtown. Everyone is basically there to do the same thing - either outside on the patio or at the long inside bar / lounge area. I've been to all three areas and, though usually busy (especially on Fridays), it's always a great time.A few notes:- The bar is inside a (fabulous) hotel - you walk through the lobby to get to the inside entrance (it's a bit confusing)- The bathrooms are in that same lobby- Hail down a waiter/waitress - service can be a bit slow - mostly due to the overwhelming crowds from 5pm onwards!Food: The antipasti dish is great to share with a few people, as is the pizza. Ask for a few plates and extra utensils and you're all set. There are also lots of options to eat in the area if you just want to grab a drink there.Drinks: Lots of 'by the glass' selections and fun cocktails. Get a bottle so you don't have to go back and forth to the bar!

My review is solely on the idiot I just spoke on the phone with. Wouldn't even let me finish my sentence that we had 9 with our party. Whatever! I had a budget of $350 to spend, will take it else where.

FOOD:1.) TotoPos con chile - basically tasted like a burrito with the cheese n salsa in one bite, except it's on tortilla chips2.) Taco w fish - this was good3.) Fish on top of beans - this was goodTo be honest, I just thought the food was alright, just good but not spectacular. However, since I like the atmosphere and service, I enjoyed my experience here :)DRINK:1.) Mezcal verde Cocktail - smokey tequila! Very interesting2.) Cool, instead of beernuts if you're just having a drink, they give these pellet things that taste kinda like corn nutsSERVICE:Great :) Especially if you know the bartenderATMOSPHERE:Not too big, but it's nice, cozy, modern simplistic - there is a backyard area that has seating too. Restaurant is in the hip foodie area of inner Sunset too if you wanted to walk around, bad thing is, parking is difficult if you drove.

First, one point for a funny entry in their menu. •_In Chinese, one of their offering is young lamb. •_In English, it is inexplicably called "lamb eggs". •_Since lambs don't have eggs, I will leave you fair readers to figure out what they are really trying to say.. •_God bless my people and their literal translation. :)That said, the restaurant earns way more points just for food alone. I love, love, love this place! •_Of course my really positive experience may have something to do w/ the fact that I brought my stepfather, who is a Beijing native, to a restaurant which specializes in northern Chinese style cuisine (read: what Beijing eats).When my stepfather started to order, the restaurant owner •_was so pleased to find one of her countrymen at her establishment that she recommended things for us to eat without any prompting. •_Some highlights of what you should order are: the hot pot w/ the lamb, beef, and tripe, the beef pancake, and the vegetarian version of the pancake (not the green onion one, but the one w/ the vermicelli). •_The stir-fry tofu was really good as well. •_I concur w/ the rest of the Yelpers' review here that their lamb dishes are outstanding.Although some of the Yelpers have complained about service, I didn't experience the same. •_To ensure that you have an equally positive experience, here are some tips:- If it's possible, bring someone who speaks Chinese (Mandarin). •_Although their staff can speak English, it is limited. •_They are more comfortable explaining various items on the menu if they can do so in Chinese.Bonus points if you bring someone from Beijing, or someone who really knows northern chinese cuisine. •_- Regardless of language, don't be afraid to ask for recommendations. •_They know what's good, what's popular, and what's their specialties. •_If you want what's popular, say that. •_If you want what they think is good, say that as well. •_Please note that those are two different requests, meaning very different things. :)-Last but not least, don't just raise your hand like you do in a classroom when you want service. They don't always notice you because their small staff is rushing around, attending to various tables. •_It's not considered rude if you ask nicely for their attention. •_Calling them "Lao Ban" (Boss), or "Lao Ban Niang" (Ms. Boss Lady) doesn't hurt.By the way, bring cash. •_The place only accepts that. •_You know my people. •_Cash is king.

Good location. Good idea. They got the drink and food orders wrong and both did not taste good. It was actually amazing how bad of a job they did. I'm only giving 2 stars bc I hope whoever runs this place can help fix it up. It is too bad how poorly everything turned out

Really awesome neighborhood spot :) The pizza is delicious!Cracker thin crust and toppings/combos are on point.Place is small- 4 inside tables, 4 bar seats, 4 outside tables so be prepared to wait during peak hours. They don't take reservations.Seasonal menu so pizzas and apps rotate, can't wait to try this place again!They take credit cards now via Square.

Not San Diego. Not even Los Angeles. Hell, not even the Mission.It's a burrito place in Pacific Heights, which is mediocre at best. Though, it understands that, and serves up a good-sized burrito for a decent price.I'm pretty sure that I paid something like $7 for a big ol' burrito

They have hand pulled noodles here which is their specialty. Which was pretty good. And they're also known for their beef rolls which was generous. My only gripe with this place is that it feels very tiny and cramped.
You know how there is something oddly magnificent about an M
Nice place but the pizza was soggy, the salad was small and tasteless and the glass of wine seemed like a half glass. •_I would recommend trying somewhere else.
The tequila, the guacamole, the food! Yum! Highly recommend the pitcher of house margaritas and the guac.

First time eating in China Town. •_Loved it. •_It was in my city guide book. You would never know the food is as great as it is. •_We had the salt and pepper calamari, clams in a black bean sauce and a plate of roasted duck. My favs were the clams and calamari. •_Prices are reasonable ($12 per dish) for the portion size. •_Its a small place and the food comes out quick.

Best pizza for the price. The atmosphere is •_little cheesy (pardon the pun). Everyone working there takes themselves a little but too seriously. You work in a pizza shop, just remember that. I ordered the panna and my husband got the margherita. Both were fantastic, the wait wasn't long at all for the seat or the food. The restaurant is small, if you plan on taking more than 2 people expect a wait. The bar seating did fine for us. They also do take out so you can just walk in and order, wait and walk out. We probably would have done that if we knew that there was a 1.50$ service charge added per person before the tip

Steak Taco was awesome! Nice chunks of carne and diggin' the radish garnish. Beer Battered (fried fish) Taco was a bigger portion than the Steak Taco, yet nothing about the taste will make me want another. Groovy atmosphere and they have beer.

The food's not spectacular, but I'm giving three stars because everything here is DIRT CHEAP.+HELLA DIRT CHEAP. +INSANELY DIRT CHEAP. +SO CHEAP that even my parents would approve (and they don't approve of much, being Chinese immigrants who always look for steals, deals, and sales of any sort). •_A hearty bowl of won tons, or noodles, or jook will set you back $4. •_Maybe less! •_Most of the stuff on the menu is $3.95. •_WUT! •_Now, the downside is it's not very good. •_My bowl of congee with pork and pidan was hearty, but the pork was dry and confused me. •_I ended up not eating any of the pork and just ate the congee and pidan. •_My friend's egg noodle won ton soup looked really mediocre too. •_But hey you get what you pay for, right? •_And I needed it after a tiring weekend. In the foggy white,On a Sunset night,This was just right.

They have the best won ton noodle soup for years in the SF. the won tons have meat and shrimp inside the wrapper. the broth is good and not too salty. price is definitely afforadable too. street parking is hard to find and there is no parking lot.
One of my favorite taquerias in the Mission.Food is delicious, fair prices, the music is great, the decorations are beautiful and the workers there are hilarious!! Definitely recommend this place!

If you're looking up reviews for San Tung, you've probably heard about their Chicken wings. I'll just say the stories are true; staff routinely wipe brains off of the walls from all the minds that have been blown while consuming those wings. Get them.Tips:- eating there on the weekends can be rough; 45+ minute waits. I last went on a Thursday night at 7 and waited less than 15 mins- the dumplings are aight. Solid, but nothing too special.- you might share a table with a random group. It's chill, but be prepared for that.- if you're looking to get some greens, the bean sprouts and garlic spinach are great.- and the fried chicken wings are really good if that wasn't clear

Five of us tried Zero Zero while in San Francisco attending a convention. It's convenient to Moscone Center and the neighboring hotels. The Italian menu is eclectic and creative -- not just your spaghetti and marinara sauce. I tried the spaghettoni Amatriciana, which had pancetta, sweet onion, garlic, and a "spicy" tomato sauce; however, the sauce wasn't that spicy to my palate. The dessert menu includes homemade soft serve with various toppings, which bumps my rating from three to four stars. The service from our waitperson was good, even though she was clearly busy with a number of tables. My only complaint, not unique to Zero Zero, is the noise level from the cumulative conversations around us. So if you want a quiet, romantic dinner or need to finalize the very important details of a business deal, this may not be the best choice.

We stopped in after a long day of traveling. •_ Hungry!Ordered pizza and salad. •_Salad was awesome! •_Fed three of us. •_Got basic pepperoni. Not bad. •_Very basic pizza. Great service. Cute placeCold beer too.

The best part of eating here was the red salsa that came with the chips. Extremely tasty and delightful. Other than that, Tia Margarita's was a let down. Our drink orders were taken immediately then for the next 15 minutes...nothing. No drinks, no water, no entree orders, nothing. I finally ordered a combo of chicken tamale and a flauta. While the flauta was decent, the tamale was surprisingly flavorless. Surely not worth $13. Though the lady serving us was very nice, I don't think I'll be coming back here again.
Great first experience at this restaurant. The food was good and the service was fast!

As a tourist in SF, I would never have found this place had it not been for Yelp - so, thank you, fellow Yelpers. I made my way over on my last day in San Francisco (for coffee lovers, look across the street for some really incredible beans - no brews, mind you - just beans), and left with a heaping helping of their lasagna - two meatballs added. It was outstanding - so great that I fashioned my own little icebox and brought the leftovers back to Denver with me. It traveled well, and was just as good reheated as it has been on the first day. Tip for travelers - ask for some plastic ware if you're staying in a hotel... I forgot to do so, and was too lazy to go back down to the lobby. Ended up eating mine with leftover chopsticks, which wasn't the best way to dig in. :)

This was the first Mexican vegan restaurant I've ever tried. The food was delicious but very pricey. Especially for the mission district and Mexican food. I ordered the coconut ceviche. The plate was small but very flavorful. It really tasted like cerviche. My sister and niece ordered the wrap and torta and they both loved their plates. The decor is beautiful. The juices delicious and the service very friendly.

----------------CASH ONLY and grab a menu so you can # or circle your orders before they serve you. There is very limited seating (not good for group of 4 or more). So picnic it out or something.-----------------Basically good luck dim sum is cheap (you can feed 4 people with ~$20), fast, and tasty. I haven't tried too many dim sum places on clement st so I can't tell if this place is way overhyped or actually better than its neighbors (there is always a crazy long line). Doesn't matter because this place is solid. Its nothing that's going to change your world but if you are craving dim sum, this place is legit. They have a variety of baos and dumplings. Not too many desert choices or veggie/dishes but they do have zhongzhi, egg tarts, and some other pastries. Bring your •_own sauce if you are picky with that stuff (they only have soy sauce and red chili sauce). I'm glad this place isn't a try-hard restaurant. It's got a very street-fast food feel. You order bulks of whatever and everything is straight forward. Wish there were more places like this in the city.

"Shame!" -Ding~~~ •_That's how I've felt after visiting Zero Zero. •_Well, not quite in a Cersi kind of way, but I did break my diet plan over its chicken and waffle. •_I am hard pressed to find anyone that can resist all that glorious greasy goodness. •_The fried risotto cheese balls and the sausage pizza did not apologize as well while I walked down the guilt trip. Oh yes, I'll be coming back here... However, not before I hit that gym for an extended session... or a few sessions.

I wish I knew about this place earlier... all I can say about this.My friend took me here trying to find a gift for another friend, and she said this is one of the best places she's been to. So we went and I came along with her. Apparently, I thought it was just for fish tacos but I was really wrong. I ordered a rice bowl; the Korean BBQ with two fillets of salmon, and oh boy, it filled me up and it was probably one of the best rice bowls I've ever had! Will be back for more, definitely!
5 stars strictly for the legit street tacos! The carnitas tacos are the best IMO! I started coming here years ago, when the tacos were only $1.50 each

Great place for Italian! My wife and I both were impressed with all dishes that we got (spaghetti, roasted chicken w/ potatoes and olive oil). The food was hot, the place was busy. And as previously mentioned, it opens at 5:30 pm - when we got there, a line of people were already waiting.
Service takes forever, place is filled with marina bros, and the margaritas taste like straight Mr T's margarita mix. Fish tacos nick's way weren't any better than Nick's crispy. Very disappointed.

Great drinks, great food, good vibe. •_This place is a nice, fun addition to Cole Valley. •_The food is a tad expensive, but very tasty. There are not a lot of vegetarian items on the menu, but those that they have are quite good.

Quite mediocre.. I got their seafood risotto and the only taste it had was from capers. Looks like the seafood was boiled and put on the risotto, with no flavor.My friend got the meatball spaghetti and it was alright. Nothing to remember.

Had a grilled veggie burrito on spinach tortilla - SO good! Came here for a friend's birthday dinner and munched pretty hard on their chips and salsa waiting for the burrito. Was pleasantly surprised how quickly it came. I'll definitely be back :)

You know it's good when...- you walk in and smell grilled meat. - you see grilled meat. - a long, quickly moving line- a lot of other people eating delicious looking foodCheck. Check. Check. Check. I wasn't super hungry when I came here, so I ended up with a baby burrito. I was initially going for some tacos, but the sight of the carne asada on the grill totally won me over. And the place smelled awesome (like grilled meat!). •_But I am so happy with it. The tortilla was so soft and the flavors worked together really well.The restaurant itself is bright with a lot of natural lighting. I think it's also one of the few places in the city that allow busking - so expect some entertainment while you dine!

We've had good burritos in SF but this place by far as the best!!! The steak burrito was so fresh and tasty here. The unlimited salsas and peppers makes this place one of my favorite new places to eat. The lineups are usually near or out the door, so get ready to have your mouth water as you wait in line.

I have been craving authentic, homey Italian in a hole-in-the-wall place like this since moving to the Bay Area and we just happened in last night with friends - our four-top was seated without a wait, but I think we got lucky with our timing.This place is the real deal - as authentic as you can get on the West Coast and outside of Italy. Simple, expertly prepared, casual fare dressed up enough to feel like Sunday Supper. Family-owned for twenty-five years, Franchino is comprised of a husband and wife team featuring any one of their three daughters ("The SHORT One, The TALL One, ..." Etc.). The trio serves up just the right amount of Old World charm you want in a place like this - great service, pleasant and passionate about their food, and if you're lucky the Mister will favor the joint with a duet, usually alongside one of the more attractive female diners chosen at random. Tiny and cozy, be prepared to wait if you haven't secured a table, and not surprisingly wine is the order of the day as this place does not have a full liquor license -- but you won't miss that unless you're somehow not a fan of wine.I enjoyed the Veal Saltimbocca - succulent and perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of mozzarella and prosciutto. Alongside it, I chose the pasta of the day which happened to be rigatoni -- my favorite!! - with meat sauce. The pasta was perfect al dente, and the entire meal was so good it almost made me cry. You can't pass up dessert in a place like this - I went for a cannoli which they make in-house, and oh my god - amazing!! So get in there already!!

This place wants badly to be fancy, but charging $7 for a half sized hotdog + $8 wells won't make it so.Go literally *anywhere* else for Mexican food in san francisco, especially this close to the mission. Go anywhere else for drink specials, too, because this place is trash. •_ •_They have lots of comfortable couches. That's about the only nice thing that can be said.Azucar, stop trying so f'ing hard, get your hotdogs the right length, and pull your heads out from south of the border.

Their dim sum was super good and by dim sum i mean pretty much everything we ordered. The ha gao was def my favorite: fulllll of shrimp and just the right amount of skin. Chang fen, sticky rice wrapped in lotus leaves, wrinkly tofu skin, and stuff mushrooms were really good. I didn't really like the chive dumpling (thick skins) and the luo buo gao (chunky pieces). I took one star off because their service was very slow even though we went really late. Would def come again but never when i'm in a rush.
Cotogna was listed as one of the top restaurants in 2011, I've been wanting to try it forever

Really nice atmosphere, delicious food, and yummy drinks. PLUS, the kitchen is open until 1:30am!!! It's nice to have the option of great quality food instead of just pizza, tacos or cheap indian food if it's late and you're hungry. The cheap food is yummy too, but it's nice to have this more upscale and cozy option with a nice sit-down restaurant.
exican Kitchen|
Mexican fare for non-Mexicans. San Francisco has lots of fantastic Mexican food and this place is decent and convenient being in Downtown. Good but not special!

I know Zuni to be a favorite among many...and a constant "top ten" in SF write-ups....that's why I got a table last weekend to celebrate my sister's bday. The good: 1. We were seated quickly and at a nice table.2. We were offered beverages quickly (they were not served as quickly but that doesn't belong on this list).3. Oysters were fresh and delicious (though I ordered four and was served three - also doesn't belong on this list).4. Didn't feel rushed at any time - which was awesome given the wait outside for a table.5. Our food server remembered to put a candle in dessert (cheese plate in our case) but didn't sing (not like every restaurant or server will, but it's nice).The not-so-good:1. Our food server was often missing in action...fine except when the entrees come before the beverages.2. As I mentioned above, I ordered four oysters and received three. Didn't even think to check the bill until it was too late.3. My sister ordered the pasta of the day and simply put, it wasn't very good. Nothing exciting about it and probably the wrong choice for a restaurant known for it's meat.4. My steak was good but not great and there was more potato than steak on the plate.5. The cheese plate was uneventful. Like, really uneventful.When you drop a couple hundred dollars on a birthday dinner and walk away feeling only "okay" about it, it begs the question of whether or not to return. We were off to a concert at the Warfield that night and so it made sense for our needs. But alas, we may not return for a while.Three stars because it was "okay" but not great.

Called for lunch reservation and it was booked, but they said there was room at the bar. So we arrived and got a great window seat. Our server was a bit aloof and below average. Food was excellent. •_I had a pasta w crisp cauliflower, raisins, and other stuff I can't remember. •_Wonderful. I left nothing on the plate. •_My wife got a pork dish and was very happy. •_We had a panna cotta that was smooth, not too sweet and fruit accompanying matched perfect. •_Nice open and social ambiance.

The first time I ever had Victor's my friend paid. He said that the cannelloni from victors was kinda like crack, and so he figured my first one should be free. He was right after one bite of the most delicious cannelloni ever, I was hooked.Victor's delivers, but only to a limited area, and unfortunately we are out of the area. •_So sadly I do not eat the cannelloni of my dreams as often as I would like however this is probably in the service of my health. I love Victor's so much that I had my last birthday there and it was perfect, one of the best. •_They have the perfect little side dining room that is perfect for larger parties. To make a reservation for a large party, just call the morning of the dinner and they will take your reservations, otherwise, Victor's is no reservation, first come first serve, yet unlikely to be a wait.The food was amazing as usual. The service was on point, even for our large rowdy and loud table! The prices of the entrees are so reasonable, and everyone was super stoked on whatever they ordered. The decor is super cheesy and awesome; we were graced with the amazing addition of Christmas decorations for that extra WOW factor. The Snowmen were the highlight of the evening. Victor's also has great pizza and awesome calzones. If you live in their delivery area Order up some Victor's ASAP. If you don't, call in an order for pick up or just dine in.
Very convenient when looking for affordable delivery food, with large portions. The sesame chicken is a favorite.

Don't go here expecting to sit down and eat. •_This is a raw, down and out Chinatown bakery with in and out service! Know what you want and order it quickly because the line is long! •_ My absolute favorite is the steamed pork bun. •_I can't remember how much they were but, I do remember cheap: $2.00 or $3.00!

The food was pretty good, but this place needs serious help with hostess.Pro: early girl tomatoes, funghi, sommelier, beet soup, halibut Neutral: meatball. Chocolate cakeCon: tables are not well managed by the hostess. We called 30 min ahead and was told that we shouldn't worry about reservations. It was packed with people waiting for tables and multiple open tables •_. The rest of the FOH staff were nice but frazzled because of the hostess.

The best burritos I've ever had. •_That 538 contest totally blew it.We've been going since they opened, and then expanded. •_I love seeing the same faces behind the counter; it says something about long-term employee satisfaction.

I work in an auto shop near the Gordo's on Clement and I went to elementary school near that Gordo's, so all of my previous burrito knowledge had come from a great many visits to Gordo's. I can safely say I've been pampered. I've ordered nearly everything, and it's all great.  I love the feel of the place- it's too small, too claustrophobic, but too great at the same time. I especially love that it is tucked away, but when you look outside, it's smushed between an empty parking lot and an empty smoke shop with a line of 15 people coming out of this place whose storefront consists of a wooden bench, a doorway and a large window. That being said, I've never been let down by Gordo's. It's been there for me through the thick and thin, since I struggled to catch all Pokemon in elementary school all the way to now, 10 years later and in college.

Order carefully. Not everything is great here, but there are some really great standards that keep people coming back. Good clue to know if you are ordering correctly, look at the table next to you. There's a lot of regulars at this restaurant and they know what's good. Not everything on the menu is great, but once you've gone enough times you will find your favorites.I'm a sucker for this restaurant. I know it's not anything compared to what you'd find outside of San Francisco, but it's grown on me and I love coming here for steamed vegetarian dumplings, Schezuan spicy noodles, tofu and mustard greens, Taiwan special deep-fried tofu, dry braised green beans, sizzling rice soup.This place is super cheap, has good food, and has an extensive menu with your normal and not so normal (see "stuffed baby squids") Chinese food. They are known for the dumplings. They make them in the window. I've heard their Xiao Long Bao are not so good, but I really like their vegetarian steamed dumplings.Most of what you see in the window is on a small dim sum menu. Look in the bottom right corner of your menu to find it. It's on one of the folds.

Was craving Chinese food..So I yelped around the area saw the reviews and went to try Tai Chi.I order two lunch specialsBeef Tofu and Chicken w/ Mushroom and broccoli: All the dishes looked the same like they just threw in a ton of soy sauce! Where is the flavor of the chicken or beef or the vegetable?lunch came with a hot

Italian food that makes you wonder if you've ever made pasta right, some of the best lasagna, gnocchi, and tiramisu you could ask for and affordable prices to boot! My go-to spot when I'm looking for a casual dinner with friends.
My boyfriend and I were craving Chinese food, and found this gem. The owners are so sweet, and the food was great.

Dim sum here is extremely good when you get them at a good day, comparable / better than Hong Kong , sgv. Somewhat pricey and service can sometimes take long, but worth it when put the things in your mouth

Didn't even know they had a bar in there! Great food to chomp on. They don't skimp on the ingredients. Good vibes especially on Fridays. They have live music and they play all types of Spanish classics. Feels fresh, clean and well lit. Good for a group of two to four people tables. Believe they have ALL CAN DRINK MARGARITAS Fridays

At least 4, with the possibility for 5 on return visits. i'd have to say, the only downside is that it's lit like an interrogation room, and it's hard to pry beer out of them. it's the first time i've ever asked, "do you serve beer?" and had someone say, "let me check" - it's usually pretty binary. but the answered tured out to be, "we DO have some tonight" (??) so that was good. and the food was quite good and a screaming bargain. would be fun to go back with more people to gorge myself even more fully on all the options.

I would give this restaurant 3 stars based on the food but I gave it one more star for the excellent service. •_This restaurant is run by a family who offers quick service and is very accommodating. •_One of the owners personally greets all the customers and socializes with each table. •_He even sings and dances...very entertaining! •_The prices are reasonable for an Italian restaurant (entrees range from $12 to $20).We asked for recommendations since it was our first time here. •_Here are the reviews of what we ordered:-Chicken Marsala •_ •_ •_ •_ •_-This dish either comes with mixed vegetables or pasta of the day. •_The chicken was very tender and the sauce was delicious! •_The seasoned vegetables I got as my side was also very tasty. •_Best part was that the dish tasted light and healthy...one of the better chicken marsalas I've had. -Homemade Gnocchi with Pesto Sauce •_ •_ •_ •_ •_-I've had better gnocchi. •_The pesto sauce was the best part of this dish. •_The portions were generous.The menu is extensive so I would come back to try some of the other items our server recommended (i.e. Lasagna, Chicken Amalfitano , etc.).

Same here I got ripped off the first time just like Michal R.review below. •_ I ordered 2lb lobster at $16.50/lb they charged $44.56. a small steam vegetable they charged $10.95. and steam rice $4.50. I ended up to pay $80..Stay away - not honest business. that is why less than 1 star...

Good bang for your buck, considering location.I've been there once and split the nachos and had a Corona. The nachos were $8 and the beer $4. I honestly thought it was going to be more expensive. The nachos were served on a tortilla, which I hadn't seen before. It wasn't an overly generous portion but it was decent. Plus you cannot stop the view. The bay and the bay bridge are fantastic to look at, especially on a sunny day :)They have a kids' menu.

Everyone raves about the chicken wings and yes, they are definitely something special, but my favorite dish from here is actually the mu shu pork. Their sautee is spot on and without excessive sauce/liquid - as it should be! And the combination of tender pork slices, chopped cabbage, eggs, and black fungus is delicious! Add to the fact that they make their own mushu wrappers and it's just bite after bite of heaven in my opinion. There are also various other dishes that my family considers "go-to's" but we tend to mix it up every time we come. This time, we opted for the three spice noodles. The noodles were chewy, yet soft, but I didn't really care for the sauce - I thought it was much too sweet and definitely not spicy enough. The addition of sauteed squash was very nice though. The potstickers we ordered were HUGE. While I wish it was pan-fried and not deep fried, it was still very delicious. The filling was juicy and tender and the exterior was crispy.We came at 11:25 just before the rush and didn't have to wait, perfection on a Sunday.

This review is for the evening hotpot.ENVIRONMENT:Extremely clean and well decorated. All tables and chairs are is prime condition, like new.FOOD:We ordered the mid-autumn winter melon set. It was fun to see a whole winter melon boiling in our hot pot. Food was good quality and authentic. The highlights of the meal was the geoduck (as expected) and fried rice. Their signature fried rice that came with our set was sooooo good! It was probably my favorite dish and I would definitely recommend it even if you're just there for lunch! The pork slices and "pork belly" (so thin it looks like store bought bacon) was bland - not much flavor and must have sauce added on top. The sauces are what you'd expect from hot pot except the peanut sauce literally looks, smells, and tastes like peanut butter SERVICE:Manager was pretty nice but he offered and forgot to give us a Chinese translation of the special menu for our older family member who can't read English. Assistant manager/supervisor (in black suit) was not so helpful. He kind of rushed our order and didn't listen to what he wanted unless it adds to our bill. He didn't explain the order very clearly and just didn't match the rest of the restaurant. He also never served us tea (we were tealess for like 10 minute until another staff came after he left with our order). All other staff were attentive and accommodating especially employee 0277 without an English name. He was very friendly and sweet - he periodically checked on us to help us cut the winter melon.PRICE:We ordered the mid-autumn winter melon set for $168. Feels like a rip off for 4 people since we paid the same price that 6 people would have. You only get one hot pot for that price, one oyster per person. We asked for two hot pots since we had a large table and one of us was pescatarian but the assistant manager/supervisor who took our order kept pushing us to "add soup" for $12. I don't want to add soup, I just want another hot pot boiling! It took forever to cook everything in just one hot pot •_Like seriously $168 for 4-6 people and you're only allowed one hot pot?! wtf???

This place is a hidden gem in SF downtown/Chinatown. Great and authentic food, especially great for Chinese tastebuds. Decor is also decent. Food was served very quickly. Highly recommend if you are looking for authentic Nanking food!

Korean + Mexican?! Spicy sweet Korean flavors mixed with substantial, savory Mexican cuisine is exactly what we've been missing in our lives. The ultimate fusion taqueria. Plus, California style here means stuffed with tater toys instead of fries. Amazeballs.

Went here for dinner while on vacation.The husband and I decided to sit at the bar which was lively and was more interesting than their restaurant seating.The bar service was prompt, friendly, and thorough.We ordered the bruschetta with burrata (I did not care for the emptiness of this cheese- just my opinion).Dinner was the scallop spiedini and a fennel sausage pizza. •_Both of these entrees were delicious. •_The scallops were cooked perfectly and paired perfectly with potatoes and leeks. •_The pizza was also great- good sauce, quality cheese, flavorful toppings.I would love to have tried much more on their menu- but...Oh, on a side note- there was a elderly lady seated beside me who told the bartender she would only be having a glass of wine before she met her companion somewhere else and she got the same quality service and attention as anyone else. •_Classy.

Great place for tacos all kinds of meat to choose fromJust make sure you have cash the cashier on evenings is not accurate with charging people when paying with a card.I was double charged using my card she claims the machine was not working others have had the same issue charged incorrectly when she's on.Eventually I was reimbursed in cash after having to get a bank statement per her request

I really hate to disparage a place when the meal was on someone else's tab. But when I am just as underwhelmed the second time around, then something must be said. I've been to Eliza's on two occassions for work-related lunches. The only explanation I have for this is that my colleagues probably don't know any better or are too busy to figure out another place to have the end-of-the-semester luncheon.Eliza's seems to be trying to be upscale Chinese...hey, check out the Wedgewood china, the stainless steel chopsticks, the glass-blown sculptures...with that much effort in the details, you would think that they would strive for upscale food. But they're also trying to be mid-priced. It just doesn't add up to me! The food is largely uninspired, and while inauthenticity does not necessarily preclude quality, Eliza's just doesn't measure up to an objective standard of goodness. Sauces are either too salty or undifferentiated (hey is that the same sauce from that other dish?). Seafood not very fresh. I can't even comment further because everything is so unmemorable! Not to mention the service is really whacked out...they had a mad rush to clear our plates, but then took forever and a day to get us our check.2 stars because their lunch specials ARE pretty cheap (about $6 for entree, brown/white rice, soup) and the food wasn't really inedible. I suppose there is a subset of people who will find Eliza's appetizing, but if it were up to me I would rather spend my money somewhere else. Either I would want to save some money and go somewhere •_more hole-in-the wall, or I would even be willing to spend more for better upscale Chinese dining. I just can't win at Eliza's.
Great low cost chinese food spot. Love the noodle dishes and soups. They don't deliver but I'll be ordering from this place through caviar.

What can I say! This place never seems to fail me! NEVER! Its a great little restaurant with a nice cozy feel. Great place to bring a date for some good food! The servers and manger are always awesome! Always on point and attentive! You'll feel like a true King when you go to Jasmine Tea! THANK YOU for your great food! Love the coconut walnut shrimp and seasonal CRAB! YUM!

The first night of our trip to SF we decided to come here for dinner. Let me tell you what a nice surprise it was to find a halal Chinese restaurant. It was a Saturday night. We put our name on the list and joined the other people waiting outside. We thought this must be good if people are willing to wait like this. After about a half hour we got in and were seated. The place is very small. They put huge mirrors on the wall to make the place seem bigger. In the whole restaurant there are only 7 tables (2 large round tables that could sit prob 8-10 people and 5-4top tables). The waiter was nice. We also met the owner who was also very nice. We ordered way too much food for just two of us but everything tasted good and we came out stuffed and with leftovers for later. If we come back to SF in the future, we will be coming to eat here again.
This place is great, quick, and cheap. Won ton noodle soup is about $5.50 and they make it in about $5-10 minutes depending on how busy they are..

Chinese food can be exceptional! I was pleasantly surprised by how delicious each entree was. The food presentation was enticing. I highly recommend the spicy seafood dumplings, chili crab, and the lobster clay pot. Lastly, I'd like to thank Nu-Beer for making our first dining experience truly enjoyable. Wonderful service! I'm already looking forward to the next visit.

I've been to the first Hong Kong Lounge, so obviously I needed to try this location too. They're so organized and efficient with their ticket system, and they seat guests fairly quickly. I would not recommend leaving once you get your number, because they will not wait for you!! I was told that it would be 1.5 hours until three of us were seated, and we only ended up waiting 45 minutes because I waited outside the whole time for our number to be called. The other two members of our party were wandering around somewhere, so luckily I could be seated first.We marked what we wanted on the menu while we were waiting outside, so this made our lives easier once we were seated. We tried a variety of foods, which were all pretty good. I especially liked the sticky rice in lotus leaf. The beef tripe was excellent as well. All the dishes came out very quickly, and unlike other restaurants, they do not try to rush you in and out of the place. Great experience and great service - would recommend trying this place!

burritos are just always better in california, it's actually a scientific fact. these burritos are especially delicious. i have a friend who fancies himself to be a mexican food/burrito conneseiur, so when he was raving about this place, i knew it would be good. i copied him and got the works and put legit everything they had to offer on it, including their medium salsa and guac.i was not disappointed! everything was super fresh and flavorful.as many pictures have shown, these burritos are beasts- i definitely couldn't finish the burrito in one sitting and i unfortunately had to get on a plane, so i couldn't take it with me. needless to say, i immediately passed out from a food coma on my flight home. some have noted, this place isn't exactly spacious, so try and go at off hours or with a small group!
The food was good, but the service was so interminably slow. •_It took ages to get the order taken, for the food to arrive, to get jam for my bread, etc.The outdoor seating is really lovely though.

I stopped in for two steamed pork belly baos after hearing how good this place is from a roommate. •_The red miso glazed pork belly was high quality and the turmeric pickled daikon really helped bring the texture together for each bite. •_I'm going to have to stop in and try the other varieties real soon!
Abosolutely delicious dishes in a lively and colorfully decorated environment.Love the takes made with Jicama, salads and finally the fondue dessert.Love it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

My friend introduced me to this Italian restaurant and I love it!I'm a picky eater when it comes to Italian food and usually I only eat home made Italian food, however I may just have a go-to restaurant in San Francisco when craving some pasta or tiramisu!We ordered a vegetarian salad, a bottle of their collector's Zin to start our night with.Bruschetta and margherita pizza followed.Steak with shaved truffle mushrooms, ravioli, pasta in arabiatta sauce were the main course dishes.We finished everything. The food was not loaded with cheese or grease. The desserts were super! Tiramisu, molten lava cake and affagato! I've never had affagato this delicious before!The staff is friendly and they speak with an Italian accent and kinda scream - I guess that's how they speak in Italy??I'll definitely go back. You must visit too, however I highly suggest making reservations else you could be waiting for at least 45 minutes or more depending on the time you show up.

Pretty good hotpot and grill! You can choose from a whole pot with two different soup base flavors or half hot pot and half grill, which is pretty cool. There's an open sauce bar with a lot to choose from - my favorite is the Satay sauce and a mixture of the sweet and spicy soy :) they have some dim sum times, a variety of meat, meatballs, fish balls, seafood and veggies. The fish balls with fish egg filling is really good! Also gotta have the crabmeat and enoki mushrooms :) there is a huge variety to choose from, which is always great :) I also liked the •_condensed milk buns and green onion pancake, yum! It also comes with ice cream too! There was green tea, cookies and cream and a few other flavors too. We also got the watermelon juice which is really refreshing and goes pretty well while you're eating something boiling hot. There may be a wait during dinner time, especially on the weekends, but they are pretty accommodating so it doesn't seem too bad. They have a tray of candy and also serve hot food from time to time too! We waited on a Saturday night around 7pm for about 30-45 minutes maybe? And they served lamb skewers and French fries to help satisfy your growling tummies ;) •_I've came here twice and it did not disappoint! This place isn't amazingggg but I'd crave it from time to time!

The only place in SF (that I know of) where you can find the rare, San Diegan delicacies that are the California burrito and carne asada fries. •_They do both pretty well, •_although a couple of times the fries in my burrito were a tad too crispy. •_Not over-doing the fries is crucial, man. •_ •_California burritos (well...and perfect weather) are pretty much the only things I miss about San Diego. •_So, whenever I feel that pang of "homesickness" in my stomach, I come to Los Coyotes! Problem solved.
The service is fast and the street style tacos were good but the price was really high. I guess you expect that in the Market District but this still seemed off the scale.
Really great place to eat and grab a drink. •_The food is very flavorful and the staff is awesome!

Seriously worth the hype. Garaje is the stuff taco dreams are made of (What, you don't have taco dreams?). I ordered two Como se Llama taco (one with chicken, one with steak) and I was seriously full for the rest of the day. A crispy taco embedded in a cheesy flour tortilla with refritos, then filled with chicken/steak, pico de gallo, and guacamole - all for $6. Truly delicious.Water is self serve, food is cash only. Funky, fun ambiance. Bus your own damn tables. Altogether delightful.

Really good! I love Italian, this place is great for dates. I saw a lot of couples here having wine and chit chatting away, I also saw group of friends just having a nice meal together. The service was kind of off, kept switching off from the lady with the really nice accent, Ramona I think (sorry), to another guy who was really nice with helping us. My bf took me here the other night and it was really nice and romantic. Dim lights and a little cute candle in the middle of your table. The food was amazing, the appetizer was on point, the bruschetta! The tomatoes were the right flavor and it all combined perfectly together. I got the Sorrentina, wasn't what I expected because I like to look at pictures to know what I'm ordering (that's what yell is for duh) but it was really good anyway! My bf got the salmon dish, I tried it and it was good too. The sauce is delicious but the noodles may have been undercooked for it was a tad bit hard. After we had the flan for dessert and it was so good! I loved it here!
Cafe|

After reading all the great reviews we decided to take the drive from Oakland all the way to try this place out. •_While the food is great, it really wasn't worth the drive out there. •_There are only 2 things that I liked... 1) they have the best potstickers I've ever had... and i've had a lot in my 31yrs of life lol •_and 2)normally a lot of asian restaurants use so much oil in their cooking. •_not this place. •_the food was oil free, very very delicious. •_Also the portion size for what you order is definitely not to be desired. •_If you're not a local skip it. •_And if you do decide to go don't listen to everyone and get the cummin beef. •_it was beef with a whole bottle of cummin. •_lol not that great. •_:)

Dinner = yummy, especially the pizzas, but you can't go wrong with the pasta, either. Brunch = awesome (biscuits and gravy!!)Bottomless bellinis at brunch = delicious (and generous...)Wine list = extensiveYou should definitely try this place on your next date night or girl's brunch.

Very cute ambiance, I came here a few times but the wait was over an hour so we always left. This time we came 10mins before they opened at11am on a Saturday and was seated right at 11! We came for the king xiao long bao that was so well known for the size and how you have to drink it with a boba straw. It was very juicy and delicious. We also ordered the shrimp toast, shrimp and chive dumpling and trio bun. All very tasty which is good when you're paying a premium for the ambiance and Instagram worthy foods.
Nice place , cheap and good testy pizza at Italy area in sf. Easy to find and either u can eat inside or to takeaway!

I've been eyeing this place since the last time I visited San Francisco 6 months ago, so needless to say, this was my first meal stop when I landed in the city again. Food-wise, I loved it. Space-wise, be prepared to talk about nothing important since chances are the rest of the restaurant are probably listening on your conversation too. The tables are put so closely together that I had to (as politely as I could) tell my friend to talk more quietly multiple times throughout our meal. For starters, we ordered the Sweet Potato Fries

Crossing over to the Northern Chinese Cuisine, I tried this place with a friend! •_I must say I was pleasantly surprised that Yao Ming must have ate here because his picture was on the wall. •_I tried the sour cabbage warm pot and it really hit the spot! •_My friend also ordered the Mu-shu chicken and it was really good with just the right amount of veggie to meat ratio. •_Try the onion pancake! •_Honestly it was the best that I have eaten in the bay area! •_Not too greasy but just enough crisp, flakiness to explode more flavors into your mouth. •_I look forward to trying other dishes!

My husband works in the building so I've sat in the car across the street and watched the crowds walking in. You'd think judging the crowd it'd be a great place. Today my husband asked me to meet him and his colleague for pre-dinner drinks. They got there just before Happy Hour ended and the waiter suggested a jug of margarita (which he claims is 5-6 glasses). Like some men, my husband didn't ask about the price. When I signed the bill, I got sticker shock- the jug costs $84! It was basically billed as 7 glasses of the El Jimador Clasico!!! The bill was $111 for a jug of margarita, 1 order of guac and a (Happy Hour) beer. And to make matters worse, we were sitting just off the bar and it took the staff 10 minutes to notice us signaling for the check and another 5 minutes to bring it. Ok, first AND last time then.

Homemade Orchata just tastes divine. Not too sweet with rice dominating and making me smile.Three other guests at the table, one chef and two in cooking school, one of them from the Yucatan, MX. They were all highly pleased with level of spice (high), service (excellent), and the over all deep authenticity of the food. Dining room is medium sized with bright decor and clean bathrooms. Sort of an odd spot right on 16th at S. Van Ness feels sort of out of the way or like you wouldn't just pop by. Menu is accented heavily by the meat items, although there are veggies options, it feels like you are missing the point. Never fun for a vegetarian. Their specials change every day and they obviously care about the food they prepare.Definitely worth a vist!
I would definitely recommend Rose's Cafe . I had brunch on the patio the food and service were impeccable.

One of my new favorite restaurants and I go out to eat. alot!!My friend and I decided not to make a reservation and just try and get a seat at the bar. We got there around 6:30 on a Thursday night and lucked out because we only waited about 10 minutes before a couple left. The food was delicious!What we ordered:1) Jewish artichokes - if you like artichokes, you will love this. Crispy and savory.2) Duck egg w/asparagus - My friend's fave dish. The egg was delightful and the butter sauce was good. Dip your bread in the leftover egg + sauce mixture. You won't be sorry.3) Pizza bianca. 3 choices but we got the one with califlower. Delish! A little spicy too which i enjoy. If you dont like spicy food, maybe you should get one of the others..4) Entree - Rigatoni alla Carbonara - Super rich. I mean, honestly, I couldnt finish it. It was sooo thick and meaty even though you couldn't really see the meat in it. I think it was the sauce. Really heavy and might make you sick if you eat it all. Just saying.5) Entree - Bavette Steak - $26?? Um sorry not worth the price. It was good, but not $26 good. Plus the sauce tasted like hot dog. Don't believe me? Try it. All in all a good meal. Next time I go, i might pass up the entrees all together or at least try another pasta. The appetizers and small plates were the WOW-factor for me and this restaurant. Plus, with all the food we got plus 2 drinks ($10 each), the bill came out to $102 for 2 people!! Everything adds up. You order this and that and booom, a fatty bill so be careful.Will have to remove a star for the price. Sorry! :(BUT what I really really appreciated from this restaurant was the customer service. World class. The bartenders were really friendly and looked like they really really enjoyed making drinks :)Also, as we were walking out, a gentleman stopped us and said that he worked for the sister restaurant Delfina and wanted to let us know that there was a stabbing in the area recently and wanted us to be safe. That made me feel really good because they honestly care for their patrons.

First time there, very Italian(fun). We all had the ravioli's they were very tasty we would recommend to anyone. •_North Beach is a fun area. Stopped and had gelato at the deli next door on the way back.

This is one of my favorite places to get dumplings. My bf and I eagerly arrived to get brunch for our very second time here. Per usual there was a long line so we put our names down and decided to wonder around Taraval street. We came back 30 mins later, but it seemed that they had already called our name. I explained to the hostess that we had put our name earlier, but weren't here when they called our name. I hoped that they would understand and perhaps place us higher on the waitlist, which had grown significantly since we left. She told us that this was not possible and put our name at the bottom of the list. She told me that she had called our name and since we weren't here we have to wait from the bottom again!Since my bf and I came all the way out here for this place, we decided to wait at the restaurant, fearing that we'd miss the call again. But the situation upset me. Does it make sense for people to wait all 30-40 minute right infront of their restaurant when the line is long and the weather is cold? How does it help them to have so many people crowded at their entrance? I'd recommend the business to be more lenient in these situations and think from the customer's experience, especially considering that they have a rather long wait time. We waited 20 more minutes before we were finally seated.

Still a fan.Had lunch with the same mentor from two years ago, who's still cheering me on as I look for another job.We both had eggplant dishes, mine not spicy but his, very much yes. •_What's great is that your meal comes with soup. This time it was egg drop which was velvety, creamy and filling. •_We also orderd that infamous onion pancake which is one of the best I've had. •_Brown rice all around and good fortune cookies and fried sesame dough balls for dessert. •_Nourishment in food and friendship.
Love this place!! Great service, good food choices, frosted beer glasses. You can even order online with your phone!

This place is always busy. Love the interior. Open kitchen. I recommend making a reservation. We had a little bit of wait even with a reservation for 7. We were seated at a large table in the middle of the restaurant. Plenty of room for more people. The waitress was very attentive and fast. We ordered bang bang chicken wings, calamari, pork belly bun sliders, wild boar scissor cut noodles, mushu pork, fried rice, lamb dish, Peking duck and chili lobster. Most items were small portions. I didn't really care for the wild boar scissor cut noodles. It was sort of bland. Everything else were tasty

The service we got here ONE time deserves two stars. My man's dish never came out, she never put in the order. She thought our appetizer was his dish, if that was the case why did one come out 15 before the second one?! This lady I will say barely spoke English and should not have been waiting on tables. She screwed up the table next to ours several times and they started getting loud. When they found out she screwed our order up too they laughed and commented. This table started getting racist and it pissed me off so I said everything was fine. This bad experience just happened once, very rarely will you have a a server that does not speak ANY English.The food here is amazing and the price is more then worth it. This is probably the best Chinese food I ever had in the city. With the combination of a nice atmosphere and good prices I am now a loyal regular.

The food was very clean for Mexican food. Filet Mignon was great! A friend introduced us to the Pizole and it was delicious! Fresh corn tortillas with an array of salsa temperatures. Definitely will be back!

I was recommended Tai Chi for delivery and decided to try it out for myself. •_The delivery is free after a minimum $15 order, so ordering it for an individual meal will be too much. •_The food is very fresh and delectable compared to other Chinese restaurants in the area, and you can really taste the technique and freshness of each bite. •_The only downfall is that in delivery, please remember to order a side order of rice, as what you order is exactly what you get.

I have been here a few times and am confident to say that this is one of the better places to eat in Chinatown. •_The quality is great and the prices are reasonable.Many people reviewing this restaurant have praised the seafood claypot, and rightly so. •_There were generous portions of succulent squid, scallops and shrimp and it was overall, quite yummy. •_We also tried the braised tofu clay pot, fried pea sprouts with garlic, ginger crab, and salt and pepper pork spare ribs. •_While these dishes weren't nearly in the same league as the seafood claypot dish, they were still very solid options.Service was fine and we ended up paying $17.50 for a tasty, yet filling meal.

This restaurant recently replaced another similar type of hole in the wall but they dressed up the space a bit and simplified the menu to mixed results. It is a popular spot now, usually I see a line out the door and it has typically taken me at least 5 - 10 minuets of waiting in line to order. There is seating but it is really limited and if you are coming in a large group I wouldn't expect there to be much of a chance to sit down together. The food itself is mediocre though. This area is in great need of a good but simple burrito/Mexican restaurant but this isnt it. The food is REALLY white washed, if you are looking for authentic Mexican food skip this place. That said their version of the California burrito is ok, it has tater tots instead of fries. It isnt very flavorful though. I dont like crazy spicy food but I expect a burrito to have something interesting going on that stands out. I have had it a few times and usually the first few bites are enjoyable but then it really starts to become bland halfway into eating it. With that in mind I went there to try something else and went with a wet burrito which is the same as a regular burrito but with some enchilada sauce on top. I was hoping the extra sauce would make it stand out a bit instead of suffer from being bland like their California burrito. After a 5 minute wait in line I ordered it to go and went across the street to the market to pick up some juice and fizzy water. Once back I continued to wait for my burrito for another 15 - 20 minutes. The place was busy, maybe a tick more than usual. When they called my name they handed me a bag with my burrito and I headed home. Got home and discovered they only gave me a regular burrito and skipped the enchilada sauce so I wasted an extra $1.50. I gave the regular burrito a shot and it too was really bland (I ordered it with carnitas). I gave up halfway through and wont be back again.If you hate spicy Mexican food, tend to like the "Tex Mex" kind of fare and dont mind a long wait this isnt a bad option. Prices are reasonable for SF (about 10 bucks for a burrito) and the service while slow is friendly. Personally I am going to continue to have to travel out of the neighborhood to get my Mexican food fix.

Don't try and make a group reservation... they don't want your business. •_Needed to book a group of 12-14 for a Friday night. •_Called 5 weeks in advance and the woman who answered said it wouldn't be a problem but I had to speak to a manager who was in a meeting. •_Took my info and no one called back. •_2 weeks later I called again... same deal with the manager being in a meeting and they would be getting back to me. •_I explained that if I didn't receive a call I'd be taking my business elsewhere. •_No call again! Booked a reservation for 12 at Pane e Vino in the Marina in 2 minutes. •_Their manager wasn't in a meeting and they seemed to actually want the business. •_I don't see this location being in business for much longer with the poor management they have in place.

The Dish: Forget Chinatown dim sum. This place has it all. It is on the pricier side and they realize that many of its customers are business/working people. Instead of what I'm used to (waiting for the carts to roll around), the waiters have mini-microphones to tell one another what customers want so the cars come to us. I came with my co-worker who knew all the good dishes. I typically only order shu-mai and shanghai dumplings. I know, no variety. But, here, I had maybe 6-7 different dishes? Definitely finish off with the green onion cake w/ peanut sauce and coconut rolls. Ambiance: This place has fast service and really nice people. My coworker didn't know the name of the green onion cake so could only describe it. They came out with the wrong order and was really cordial about it all - and got us the right dish even with just descriptions. They have patio seating as well as inside seating. Good place to come with friends and share a bunch of different dishes.

you will not find a better thin crust pizza anywhere else.Try the monte bianco pizza which is listed under "special pies" on their menu.it comes with a heapy dollop of mascarpone cheese in the middle.You smear this on top of the prosciutto and eat away.Its not something you see everyday, but the salt from prosciutto, combined with the buttery sweet mascarpone will not betray you. •_seriously.of course, all the other pizzas I've tried here are fantastic.but that monte bianco is so out of the ordinary that i must share it with you yelpers.want pasta?go for the lasagne or the pesto.pesto actually tastes like fresh basil. not jarred mediocre stuff.i wholeheartedly appreciate them for using such great ingredients, in great combinations. •_thank you.oh! i almost forgot.if you need some appetizer, try the caprese with BURRATA. •_not regular mozzarella. •_ask for it if the waiter does not offer it to you.HOOOLY.

Bad. Taco. I was here about a year or so ago and don't remember hating it. Today it was just embarrassingly bad. Tasteless beef, bland hot sauce, gummy tortillas. It was about 12.30p on a Saturday and there were only about 4 other people here - seems every other place in the ferry building had lines out the door. Next time I'm at the Ferry Building, I'll get in one of those lines. Getting a bad taco ruins my day and ensures that the next day, I get to treat myself to one of my favorite taco joints, so yay for tomorrow.
The music is absolutely offensive. Head banger sounds are not conducive to nourishing the body. TONE IT DOWN

- i've eaten a lot of chicken wings in my life and I will say these are darn tasty- recommend finishing the food in one meal; unlike pizza leftovers from here aren't always great- long lines but like any good asian restaurant gets you in and out quick- advice don't wait outside, the servers sometimes call the names inside and if no one responds they just move on5 stars - would eat here everyday4 stars - sure I'll come back3 stars - average2 stars - we paid for this?1 star - where's the exit.....

Yup - it's not authentic Chinese. •_I do like Chinatown too - but this is a block from home and is frankly better than any of the delivery places in this 'hood. •_My fiance and I went here for the first time last night and had the pot stickers (standard, but very good), sizzling rice soup (hadn't had it before and was very happy - needed some soy sauce to make it a little more flavorful, but loved that the veggies were so fresh and crisp!) and Mu-shu chicken (also very good, but I was VERY disappointed that it came with grocery store tortillas instead of the thin crepe-like pancakes). •_Overall, we'll be back because we ate dinner for $20, it wasn't greasy, and it's close to home.

I cannot tell you how fabulous Perbacco is. Spent Saturday dinner here for 20 year anniversary and birthday celebrations. The day after, I feel like I am on some kind of wonderful drug /elixir hangover. The atmosphere and service are impeccable, and the food is sublime. I started with the fritto misto, and Mark had a salad with kumquats and cherries, which were both superb. The frito misto even had a thinly sliced fried lemon-a big surprise which I loved.For mains, Mark had the plate of short ribs and tenderloin.
