The short ribs were flavored with red wine and melted in your mouth. My pasta with veal and mushroom sugo, well, I can't stop thinking about it, it was that good. From now on, I will always order a pasta every time I come back to Perbacco, which will be very soon.Let's not stop here, moving on to dessert, I had the ricotta cheesecake with candied mandarines and rhubarb, and Mark had a dark chocolate mousse. There was a great selection of desserts, which makes me happy, cause I love a beautifully crafted and executed dessert. This is also the place for wine lovers. The wine list has a table of contents and is probably about 25 pages long.This truly is one of SF's finest for Italian (or any other) food. This will •_become our go-to place from now on for special occasions or just to grab a bite on Friday night. . Thanks Perbacco for a beautiful evening.
I ate at this place weekly for over a year. Delicious, great service. No bullshit.

You are just 1 disgusting bowl of Sizzling (not sizzling) Rice Soup away from light headed nausea likely from an MSG overdose. Step right up and treat yourself to a regrettable afternoon for only $7.The only way I would return is if I had the opportunity to cook the staff a disgusting lunch of my own to return the favor.

This place was ... interesting.I came here a while ago for brunch. Perhaps brunch is not their best feature, but at least the staff here is EXTRA nice, very friendly and super enthusiastic to help you.I had a friend who required accommodations and they were very good about it as he had been there before. We sat at the comfy couches which were awkward for eating in general and had some decent food. I would say money for value there are much better Mexican places in the city and much better food.However, I think this place has a very unique atmosphere that you probably won't find at many other places. Many regulars are like family, and the staff treat them just like that. I probably wouldn't come back again for food, but hey maybe a drink or two?
exican Kitchen|

For months my hubby and I ate at Tacko once per week and it was always good. It does take a while to get your to-go order (sometimes 20 minutes +) but we didn't mind as we always run into a friend there and would have a beer while we waited. Food was always on point. Love the San Diego burrito. Unfortunately we moved and I don't get over there much anymore so when I can get in and pick up some burritos, it's a treat. •_And unfortunately my order has been wrong 75% of the time in the last year. It's usually chicken instead of carnitas. This has happened at least three times. It's happened so many times it's now a joke between my friends - weather or not the burrito will made correctly and if it will be chicken. Sadly there actually usually is always something wrong. Other times I will make an addition on the burrito which I have yet to receive. Tonight over half my burrito was a huge chunk of meat the size of my fist. You can tell in the food that the cooks are busy and just blatantly don't care. Disappointing as we used to love this place.

This by far is my favorite Taqueria ever...The ingredients are really fresh! I love the carnitas and grilled chicken. The meat is seasoned to perfection (not overly so - allowing you to enjoy the burrito as a whole versus your whole burrito tasting like a marinade). I even love the boiled chicken...The tortillas they use (although I think they may have changed this recently) are really thin. When you reach the end of a Gordos burrito, you're not left with a clump of overfolded tortilla, as you are with so many other places. •_And when they roll this burrito, the tortilla only wraps around the filling once, like a perfectly rolled doobie!The staff is cool...these are local types. For example - one time I placed an order, and forgot to bring my wallet. Just as I thought •_the days of bodega/convenience store credit were over, he let me go, no charge! (this was back in late 90s) And of course I returned next time to pay...With the recent price hikes across the board, Gordos didn't raise theirs too much...Kudos to Gordos for that. The only thing I can say negatively at this location is that there isn't alot of seating... There a funny legacy that goes along with my family and Gordos. The first time I came here was with my Uncle, who introduced me to the place. I was just a tike, probably around 8 years old. So it was my first burritto and I was very picky and choosy about what I wanted in it. I was really averse to wet ingredients like guacamole and sour cream, and beans were out of the question. So I ended up getting a steak with rice burrito. My Uncle got a steak with the works. So we drive over to presido to eat the burritos by the cliffs and oh man I'm loving it. It was my first burrito and I was really enjoying it. But my Uncle was like - wtf, my burrito is dry... Turns out all the while he had my dry azz burrito and I, who was so against any exotic shit, had his delicious guac sour cream and bean loaded meal. A perfect example of my fickleness towards food as a kid for no good reason.Gordos open a branch in the South Bay - seriously a strategic location would be in Campbell

Ahhh...September.Long remembered as the dreaded start of school, I now find myself loving September for that very same reason.The little bastards that get in my way on my days off are now locked up in the prison that is the public school system. •_September also brings out, in my opinion, the best weather SF has to offer. •_Fog blankets are 1/2 of what they were in summer, rain isn't quite here yet, and the temperature rarely cracks the upper end of 80 degrees. •_I don't quite love you yet September, but I am liking what I am seeing so far.The only thing that almost ruined my evening at Tommy's was the parking situation in the Richmond. •_Damn you rich. •_You are killing me with the limited parking. •_Anyways, after an evening at the beach, Tommy's hit the spot with some damn good tequila and some killer salsa to go with the chips. •_Mix that with the world's 2nd greatest guac and I likey.Buro.
im Sum Restaurant|

SALT - you had better like it if you are going to dine here. Everything is over-salted. We stared with the burrata with sea salt, the whole sea of salt!I ordered the salmon with summer beans and a side of summer squash. •_The beans were over salted and when I sent them back and was told that a new batch would be prepared. The dish was retuned with refrigerator cold beans and a now cold piece of fish. The summer squash was inedible it was so salty. •_My date was in full agreement on all of my assessments, so it wasn't just me! •_His pizza margherita was good, not exceptional. •_The wine by the glass pour is stingy for what they charge, especially since they are $$$ rated (dinner mains over $30.00)Let's not forget the biscotti - or should I say they'd best be forgotten. •_What happened to the second bake (as in twice baked). They were soft, chewy and fairly tasteless. •_Not the hard crunchy cookies one anticipates when ordering. No wonder you can easily get a reservation here.

Service was a little spotty, but it was a fairly busy night the last time I was there. •_I've been going to this place basically my whole life, and they have never let me down. •_Great pizza, and the sauteed vegetables were fantastic. •_I grew up in the bay area, and now that I live elsewhere, this is one of a handful of places that I want to revisit whenever I come home for a to see the family.

Terrible service. Better food can be found nearby. Sunday late afternoon, restaurant just cleared out from several large parties, so it wasn't busy. •_Placed order for a dumplings, chicken wings, beef with green beans. 20 minutes after ordering, we ask how our order is doing since we noticed other parties seated later getting their food after about 5 minutes. Server tells us he FORGOT to put the order in, tells us he'll get it in right away. Two dishes come out, after finishing them, ask about the chicken wings 15 minutes later. He comes back to tell us, sorry I didn't put them in the order. Again. After doing this with our initial order. That was it. This place doesn't care, the servers, the back of the house, no one cares. They get enough neighborhood regulars it seems like they do fine, but they clearly just want to crank out mediocre food as fast as they can and dick around in the back.

I've never actually been inside the Wok Shop Cafe, but by hands down found this the place to have the best Take Out/Delivery Chinese in San Francisco! •_No MSG is one of the main reasons, and all of the food is very "clean" tasting without any additional oils. •_Always fresh. And chicken dishes very moist. •_Two of my favorite dishes are the Honey Walnut •_Prawns, and the Chicken with Asparugus in bean sauce. •_If you order sweet

My first thinking about DELIVERIES means NO GOOD. •_They are only for neighborhood lazy ppl (like me) •_So, I never order chinese food... cause I am chinese and I know that no chinese fast food deliveries is good. •_They are cheap, greasy and you just don't have confident about their quality of meat.(turnover) •_I had a few hit/misses here, but they are pretty decent, but unconsistent. •_Sometimes, their food can taste incredible gordon bleu chef's style, but sometime is not eatable!!! •_(either too flavory or too spicy or salty) •_I never manage to call back to complaint
Fishermen stew is for real. Abundant amounts of seafood including clam mussels cod shrimp scallops in wine tomato sauce all in hearty serving..worthy!

Hands down the best pizza in the area. Get the victors special. Get a salad too, they serve it with warm pizza dough bread. Excellent with butter. Pasta/entrees are good. Not like my Sicilian Granma made but there's no one that can make sauce and pasta like Nonna, still this decent Italian food. Sandwiches are good too. I usually get the Italian combo with minestrone which tastes homemade. Overall good food for not too much money and speedy delivery.

I actually really enjoyed the food AND I had extremely high expectations. •_To me, that says a lot. •_Probably the most memorable part of my night was that the atmosphere truly reminded me of Florence. •_I have to be honest that my very positive association with Florence may have impacted my opinion of this restaurant. :) •_Regardless, the place is quaint and adorable with a romantic candle lit feel.My only negative comment is that the wait staff was straight out rude. •_Although one could say this adds to some Florence dining experiences as well....

Claypot catfish 3 yelps small portion but tastyPea sprouts and garlic 4 yelps very tasty small portionSteamed oysters with black bean sauce 4 yelps slightly over cooked.Salt and pepper fish 3 yelps slightly soggy but tastyWhite rice $1.50 per person mehhh Service was rushed but they want to turn the table multiple times a night.Yes It's a bit of a sketchy area just make sure your out before it's dark.

Ahhh, Tai Chi.Good memories with this place when I lived in SF for two years.I'd recommend it for nights where you don't have time to cook and just want a hearty Chinese meal. •_It's not classically done - if you put Panda Express and a Classic Chinese restaurant in a blender, you'd get Tai Chi.Reliable, quick service (they deliver within 15 minutes - what the hell?)and flavorful (sometimes too much)...Enjoy!

You will not be disappointed.In the culinary world of San Francisco, you have to be a giant to even perform, much less thrive.Acquarello does the job and does it well. We came here for the last night of our honeymoon after eating at some of Napa/Sonoma's finest during the week. This was by far our favorite meal. Granted, we splurged. We had champagne, wine pairings, multiple courses...and we didn't regret a bit. My only complaint for the night was that it took longer than desired for our server to greet our table and take our first wine order. After that the service was flawless. The sommelier was attentive and gave excellent suggestions for each of our courses. The little aperitifs provided between courses delighted us. The cheese course- absolutely divine. Don't miss it. They bring a large tray of cheese to the table and allow you to select your tasty bites. All in all, this was an absolutely heavenly experience. The icing was the truffle service at the end of the meal where we were able to select homemade truffles to end our meal (yes, after dessert). Perfection.It's the little things that count. The little things make you willing to drop $600 on dinner and feel great about it.Don't miss Acquarello.

I've been both at this location and the one downtown and from my experience, Delarosa is a hit or miss. Both in service and in food. The pizza is always a safe bet, I would say, but I also tried their pasta once and it was a joke. Super small portion and nothing memorable. Their burrata bruschetta is apparently THE THING, but I haven't come around to try it yet. Another reason why Delarosa isn't top of mind for me, is their service. They do an ok job, given that it's pretty busy here. But I can't help but feel like an obligation, not a guest. You are seated at large tables with other guests, which I don't really have a problem with, but here you don't have any privacy at all. Way too close to your neighbor. And this all adds up to a really noisy atmosphere that makes it really hard to follow your own conversation. If all else fails, I'd be back to Delarosa, but will first make sure that there really aren't any other options nearby.
Been coming here for about 5 years for •_dinner with my family the food was great! and awesome service the waitress was very helpful. Recommend the cheese bread!

This place exceeded my expectations for a to-go dim sum place. Definitely looking forward to coming back soon. •_+ Good quality food. Was in the store for 5-10 minutes and at least three trays of food was brought from the back of the store to the window displays for refill. They brought out the food as fast as people ordered, so my assumption is that the food is pretty fresh when ordered instead of just sitting around for more than a few minutes+ Good service. The people there were helpful and not rude, which is a big plus to me (non-Chinese speaker). Have encountered my fair share of lacking customer service but did not notice it here. Changed my order a few times, asked to have some food items separated in packing (sesame balls away from sticky rice), and did not at all feel rushed.+ Good prices. Girlfriend and I were stuffed and had small leftovers for under $20.

I used to really like this place, until I saw their most recent health score. 68/100. That is ridiculously poor. I really saddens me to see restaurant owners who do not care about the quality of their food.

We had dinner here a few weeks ago,after making reservations a few months previous. After all write-ups and awards that this restaurant and chef has received , there was no way we were going to try to get seated without a reservation. The quoted wait time when we arrived was over an hour. We were seated immediately, but it seemed to take awhile for anyone to come to our table. Once a server came by, she was worth the wait. She was very knowledgeable about the menu, and had great suggestions. She totally sold us on the pastas. We were also glad she let us know that the pastas were small portions, and advised us on how much we should order. Although this place is known for their pizza, we weren't that impressed with it. It was good, but I've had better. What did totally blow us away was their pastas! Wow, they were AMAZING! The pastas were very well thought out, creative, fresh, and totally delicious. I would come back for any one of them, but would skip the pizza. Service was pretty good, and prices aren't bad for the quality of the food. My biggest complaint was the bathroom. It was kind of gross. Not at all what you would expect from a restaurant like this. If you can get a reservation, I highly recommend it. The pastas are truly something special.

Food was standard Mexican, service flat-out sucked.The guy they have assembling the orders doesn't speak any English. At all. Neither did he appear to understand my Spanish. I asked for my usual: rice, refried beans, pico de gallo, and flour tortillas to go. Apparently no one has ever ordered this because it seemed to confuse him greatly. There was an issue with the sizes, then he kept attempting to toast the tortillas when I kept saying I wanted them cold (they congeal into one if heated before being wrapped). Then when it came time to pay, I was charged nearly $14! For some miniature sides! And they don't even give free chips. It may have been a mistake, because she lowered the price to $9 (still too much IMO) when I mentioned that the rice and beans were both a small.There's some interesting decor inside, but on the night I visited, the air was thick with smoke. Perhaps they'd recently burned something, but if this was the case it sure took a while to dissipate. I returned hours later to use their restroom and still couldn't breathe.The food, once I'd taken it home and reheated it, was pleasant enough. Not outstanding, but there was nothing to complain about.
Great if you're ready to wait 30 minutes for your comida. Check in with the waitress after 15 min because they'll likely forget about your order.

Barbacco is our office's go-to restaurant for all things catering. They are always super reliable, on-time, and friendly. Their catering orders arrive nicely packaged and our guests always rave about the food. They are also great for working lunch meetings or any last minute lunch requests. You can place a lunch order at 11 for a small group of people and it'll be ready for pickup in 30 minutes. The staff is a pleasure to work with, from the people running the takeout counter, to the delivery men who graciously unload all of the catering dishes for us. Our favorite dishes are: - Kale and roasted squash salad- Lasagna Bolognese- Farrotto - one of my FAVORITE dishes ever, creamy delicious farro, jam-packed with mushrooms. - Polpette- Braised chicken thighs- Focaccia - by far the BEST focaccia I've ever had outside of Italy. Super squishy and oily without being greasy. So delicious! I've never actually dined at Barbacco, but given that their food is incredibly delicious outside of the office, I'm sure it's an even better experience dining in!

Am I missing something? Is it because I don't order a fully-loaded anything, ever? Is that also why I don't think Farolito is all-that either, because I don't order the Super Suiza Quesadilla at 2 am? But, still, I shouldn't need to order all-out to have it be pretty darn tasty. The chicken is drained from a vat of orange grease and I start to wish I'd ordered carnitas as they look more flavorful and an order of magnitude lower on the grease scale. Love that I have a choice for my tortilla (regular, whole wheat and I think, spinach).The service is really solid though, always friendly and fast. The burritos seem to be a pretty good deal, too. I mean, I get two meals out of six bucks!?! Hard to beat that. Chips are *not* included with your burrito and for that I am thankful! It's all too tempting. Salsa ranging from negative-spice, positive-salt pico de gallo to deceptively spicy, creamy green tomatillo salsa.Convenience of this spot is key and I know I'll be back. It's a good deal for dinner and I'm pretty set on trying something off the extensive seafood menu next time. Maybe even their fresh squeezed juices. Carrot, anyone?
Horrendous service. If you get a server named Bruce ask for another table. Tried to be cute but ended up being condescending. Took an hour for our orders to come out. Unacceptable. Disappointing.
Lounge|

Location: in the beautiful and busy North Beach; I've never driven here (nor do I want to with those hills!) but it's probably a 5-7$ uber ride from Montgomery Bart. I've gone twice - once on a weekday lunch and it was dead silent. Once on a weekend brunch and I'm pretty sure I almost went deaf. It is SO loud and rowdy and most people around you are on their 6th cup of bottomless sangrias.. Service: pretty good at checking in and giving recommendations; you can leave your name and walk around, they will call you so you can show up within 5(i think) minutes to claim your table! Food: I think they recently changed their hours to no longer serve weekday lunches (really sad because their elote GAVE ME LIFE). Shrimp + carnitas tacos are both freaking out of this freaking universe. Chips and salsa are amazing too. I love you don pistos. I'll be back.

I'm confident this place will move up to 5 stars after a few more visits. •_We visited for breakfast and had fantastic brunches - huge portions of tender pork, fried eggs, beans and rice, washed down with hibiscus juice. •_Will be back for dinner + sangria. •_It's the perfect Mexican restaurant - lots of flair, friendly people, great salsa, fresh tortillas, affordable, jukebox-full-o-Mexican-tunes. •_If there is a better Mexican restaurant in the city, I haven't found it.

Heads up--- CASH ONLY, they have an ATM inside, but theres a Wells Fargo across the street in Safeway.I love this place! I've been coming here for at least 7 years. They know what i want, without me having to be specific. They have great steak burritos. Yummy! I always order a Steak Burrito with x-tra cheese, Pinto beans, salsa liquido, cilantro, avocado

Positive: •_Very good sausage pizza. •_Stick with the pizza and you will be okay.Negatives: •_Wife order squid ink pasta with clams. •_Very weird, strong taste of some herb. •_Fortunately waitresses took it back with no argument. •_Wife asked waitress to bring a pasta that she thinks is good. •_The Maccaronara showed. •_It was edible, but reminded me of the canned spagetti I ate many decades ago.Special that night was trout salad. •_Not good.Restaurant is pricey with 3 of the 4 items pretty bad. •_Vastly overrated.

The service here is bad enough that it doesn't matter whether or not the food is good.Something about having your waiter scowl at you, avoid eye contact, hurriedly toss food onto your table, and even greedily pick up the tip at the end (instead of waiting for us to leave their nearly-empty restaurant at nowhere near closing time) just doesn't make me want to ever come back.Also, almost no vegetarian options? In San Francisco? You've GOT to be kidding.(I'll toss 'em an extra star for having fresh ingredients, but that's all I've got.)

Awful customer service. Waited more than an hour for a table of four when we were 4th on the list. Table of 5+ that came after us were being seated before us, which happened multiple of times. There were also smaller groups of 2 and 3 that came after us and were seated before us. Unbelievable!!!
This is the good place if you want to go to hotpot. Everything is very good. The service is good. The food and the watermelon juice are fresh. I strongly recommend •_ my friends to try it.

2 stars when I'm sober. 3 stars when I'm drunk. Okay for a quick drunchie craving if convenient. Food is okay. Bit greasy. Lackluster compared to other Taquerias.There's quite a bit of seating. It's pretty dirty. The grounds uneven so don't trip if you are in heels or messed up!I ordered a lengua burrito and it was okay.

Nothing to complain about here but nothing over the top either. Service was o-k, not bad, but not great - It was fleet week so it looked a little busy, but we still got in with no wait so I'm not sure if that was the problem or not. Food wasn't spectacular but I had their signature (Cioppino, obviously) It was great except the calamari was a bit chewy. Will go back, just not with expectations being so high.

So we found this place on Aaron Sanchez's show, Taco Trip. Of course you're in frisco so parking is a joke. We got in around 12 30 (make a reservation) it's slammed busy all the time. We were seated promptly and given menus. What bugged me is the other waiters and hosts just walk around and look at you like they're gonna help you, •_but they dont. Then the waiter comes, takes our order. We got food before drinks. The food was delish.Tropical tacos - jicama taco shells, pinko shrimp, aioli, and cilantro. BombBeef tacos - very bold flavor. Delicious tomatillo salsa to go with it. •_The negative is they don't ask how you are, they just rush you, •_by clearing plates, even if you're not done. They don't ask to take it, •_they just take it. •_Very cocky if you ask me. But yeah, good food, loud place, crappy service. Other than getting your food quick, they don't ask you how the food was, or if you would like another drink. Overall delicious time. But service is awkward.
Cafe|

place is kinda hidden but once you find it its worth it. they have bottomless mimosas and margaritas. menu inst huge but it has enough of a variety for everyone to chose something on. we found the place online from good reviews and it was everything we expected. customer service was good as well. 9 drinks •_and 3 food orders for $150bucks not too bad. i will deff come back one day.
Dim sum is very good here, especially the xiao long baos! I still prefer DTF but this is the (relatively) closer alternative. Service is always better than other dim sum places.
I've loved Sam Wo for the past 10 years now.. •_my love for the bbq pork rice noodles will never end. •_Never. •_Not ever.

Good pizza...BAD salad. •_and when I say bad, I mean yucky, gross, nasty, no way no how will I eat that! •_The romaine was actually tough (not sure how they pulled that off), the dressing had to have been Kraft bottled, and the croutons were the the little white squares you get in a box at the grocery store for $.99....Blech!I'm so sorry Victor's, but with the good pizza, I thought you would have at least an edible caesar salad....sighSo, yeah. •_Get the pizza, if that's the place nearest to ya- •_I like cheese with fresh garlic. •_But that's it. •_Don't deviate from the pizza at Victor's.
Restaurant|

As an Angeleno with a constant craving for tacos, I was pretty excited to get some Mexican food in the Mission. I met a friend at Taqueria Cancun for a weekday lunch, and ordered up a trio of tacos. I enjoyed the place, and the food was fine, but I wasn't terribly impressed. Cancun couldn't hold its own against the tacos I have at home on the regular.The space was fun, casual and cheerfully decorated, with a kind of effortless appeal and easy atmosphere that marked it as pre-tech boom Mission. Service was quick and friendly. We ordered at the cashier, paid up (cash only), and waited for our numbers to be called. Seating was plentiful.The complimentary chips and salsa were pretty great--crunchy, fresh tortilla chips and chunky, •_flavorful red and green salsas. I ordered three tacos, a super taco with carne asada, and two regular tacos, al pastor and cabeza. All three came on soft tortillas with onions, cilantro, and salsa; the super added cheese, avocado, and sour cream. I was definitely into that super taco, and I enjoyed both the carne asada and the al pastor. The cabeza was kind of gross--definitely the squishy, mushy side of the cabeza spectrum, so I wouldn't recommend it if you only like cabeza half the time (I feel like I had a good cabeza run until Cancun, so I guess I was feeling lucky). I also just didn't find anything special about the tortillas or the quality/flavor of the meat. It all tasted good enough, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.I'll have to try some more Mexican food next time I visit the Mission. I liked my lunch at Taqueria Cancun, but it didn't step up as a San Francisco taco champion. I can think of a half dozen Los Angeles taquerias off the top of my head that would blow this place out of the water.

We thought we had a reservation, but it was never made. Thye asked us to take a seat outside while they worked to accommodate the two of us. We ordered a glass of wine and sat outside. Within 10 minutes they were able to find space for us at the bar, where we were able to watch the sous chefs. They were also very helpful with our questions regarding a few menu items. Our meal was absolutely fabulous. A little pricy, but well worth it.We highly recommend this restaurant.

Stopped in twice during my stay in SFO, I had dim sum in the bar and it was very good, excellent service by the bar tender and the food was excellent. •_On my 2nd trip back I ate the in the dinning room and my experience was equally pleasant. •_I was there on business so I ate alone, but I appreciated the excellent food and prompt service. •_I will come back, hopefully with a larger crowd so I can enjoy the duck,

Had an unbelievable dinner here. We were able to quickly sit down at a comfortable tall table in the bar, at 8 PM on a Friday night. Not bad for Valencia St! We started off with some guacamole, which was real fresh with pretty hefty chunks of avocado. I ordered two of the puffy tacos, carnitas and brisket. The meat was so tender and mouth watering. Extremely well crafted. The puffy taco shell was also uniquely delicious. Great texture and great flavor to go with the taco fixens. •_I also sampled the fried chicken that my brother ordered, it is surely a highlight of the menu. I've heard that the queso is incredible here, and I'll certainly be back to try it!

Thought it would be the perfect lunch for the day when we visited SF. They have a lot of high ratings and convincing reviews about their handmade flour tortillas. It is just 2 blocks away from 16th St. Mission BART station and we arrived around 2PM. It was a quiet joint and you will feel relaxed with the silence and dimmed lights. But after 10 mins, people came in out of nowhere and it was packed. It has a narrow space with lots of tables and chairs close to each other. You will have a basket of complimentary chips with Tomato and Habanero salsa. Crispy and not greasy. The salsa taste fresh. We ordered the Platillo Maya, Poc-Chuc and a free dessert of the day in which you could get upon check-in. We are looking forward for their Caramel Flan but it's not available. They have 2 desserts to choose from and we chose the Fried Bananas with Ice cream.Platillo Maya (Appetizer Combo for $10) - Handmade Tortilla cooked in 5 different ways. You'll get 1 Empanada, 1 Tostada, 1 Salbute, 1Kotzito and 1 Panucho. The Empanada is stuffed with ground pork and tomato sauce and was deep fried. I was not a fan. The tortilla is a bit thick and not enough filling to make it balanced. The Tostada is my favorite of all. The corn tortilla was crispy and complements well with the black bean puree and queso fresco. I don't like beans but the black bean puree was an exemption. The Kotzito is rolled and fried tortilla that was smothered with tomato sauce and queso fresco. It has the same taste with Empanada but the tortilla has a hard texture. I'm not sure if it was supposed to be hard or just crispy. Nonetheless, not a fan. LOL. I wasn't able to taste the Panucho and and Salbute but hubby said that the taste was ok. Overwhelming at some point. I guess it's just too much tortilla for the day!!! haha! •_Poc-Chuc - (Grilled Citrus Marinated Pork for $12) - You will get 3 big sized Grilled Pork, grilled red onions, shredded cabbage and bouillon rice. The pork was succulent, full of unimaginable flavors and refreshing. It was a taste of rainbow in my mouth on every bite during Pride day. Haha! I was so happy because I was so hungry and the food didn't disappoint. The grilled onions were the perfect side dish along with the citrusy taste of the pork. Don't you forget the perfectly cooked bouillon rice.Free dessert - Fried Bananas with Ice cream. We have 2 yelp accounts. Hubby and me. I was expecting that we could get 2 free desserts because we have 2 coupons to claim. We showed the server that we have 2 coupons and it was a very awkward conversation. He then gave us one. But it was all good. The dessert is big enough for one person anyway.......and...It's FREE! LOL.Quality and quantity of food is here. Inexpensive. The service was fast but they are understaffed. They have one server who runs around and dropped some of the plates at some point. Goodness gracious, give this man a huge tip!!!

I've been coming to this place for 20+ years when traveling, and have never had a meal that was not terrific. The waiters use handhelds to take your order, and the food comes out super fast. The plates are large, very fresh, and always very tasty. The salads are outstanding. They used to have a pappardella dish years ago that was possibly the best pasta I ever had. Sadly this came off the menu, but their offerings today are nearly as good. Even the bread is great.Apologies to those who think this place is mediocre, but I think it's top notch.

Korean food disguised in Mexican Style! FOOD: At first glance, it may look like a Mexican joint, BUT it's not. Basically, the outside looks Mexican, but the inside is Korean. They offer a variety of different dishes including: burritos, tacos, saucy burritos. rice bowls, salads, curry, cheese-steaks, po'boys and sides. My friend and I both ordered burritos: + grilled chicken kimchee/bulgogi burrito: all their burritos come with brown rice! YES! YES! YES! (screams the salubrious me), kiwi, kimchee (obviously), daikon and just a dab of sour cream and meat of your choice. Both the chicken and the beef were marinated nicely and very flavorful. The use of brown rice and fermented veggies with kiwi is the perfect amalgamation that creates a "lighter" but delicious burrito. SERVICE: Luckily, we arrive before the rush and didn't have to wait in line. The burrito came out literally 2 minutes I ordered it. And was very fresh! Utensils, cups, take out boxes are self served. Staff is also very friendly there! AMBIANCE: Diner style with lots of enacted single seats in the front and regular tables in the back. Very clean and brightly lit. There is also a bathroom in the back. Verdict: I will be back to try their maybe items. Only downfall is it's so far away from me!
Went for a last minute holiday celebration with friends. •_Good service and food was better than expected. •_Not quite used to co-ed restrooms though..

This is as good as pizza's going to get. If you don't like it here then my guess is pizza's just not your thing. Note: I only came here once and I tried the salsiccia and margherita pizzas. Both were amazing. Also, this is perfect for settling your stomach before some nighttime adventures :]
Restaurant|

Dim sum was good. Not the best I've had but good. Make sure to get there real early or later on weekends. Got there at 9:30a, half an hour after they opened and still ended up waiting 1.5 hours even though the door hostess said "20 minutes." Ok decor and ambiance.

We just missed brunch by a few minutes after 2pm on a Saturday afternoon at the Doctor's Lounge, and I was surprised to see an El Farolito this close by, so decided to eat here instead as I was a huge fan of the El Farolito •_just off the 24th St Mission BART station. This place didn't disappoint as it satisfied my hunger and food cravings. My friend got their Carne Asada super burrito, and I got their chicken super quesadilla. Both orders were huge and extra filling with extra guac and sour cream. It tasted just as delicious as I remembered. Prices still remained cheap, under $10 for the super portions and under $8 for the regular portion.
Probably the best Sicilian style pizza you will find in SFB.Good variety of toppings and fast service.

Their siu mai is huge and each bite into it is like juicy pork raining down on you. If I lived near here, I would probably be getting fat off of siu mai every day. I also got turnip cake and custard buns which were okay. The turnip cake was slightly burnt and I overestimated my ability to eat that much turnip cake in one sitting. Getting 3 siu mai, 3 turnip cake, and 3 custard buns only set me back about $7. Bang for your buck.When I came at around 1 PM, there was a line snaking its way out of the store of around ten people. Frequent people who come here are probably people who work nearby in the FiDi area and tourists.

If you are a Latino this is the worst place you can go. It is over priced and barely has meat on their burrito.Si eres latino es el peor lugar para ir, los precios son altos y un burrito casi ni trae carne, un sê_per burrito •_del size de un breakfast burrito from McDonalds. El peor burrito q he comido en la mission!!

I went back to this restaurant for the second time last week after a great first experience some months ago and they did not disappoint. We had a tight schedule and not much time to eat in so I called ahead to ask if they thought it would be reasonable to get fed within the hour. The host was gracious and said she'd reserve a table for us so that it'd be ready on arrival. In an effort to accommodate us, they got food to the table quickly - with no compromise to great service or food. I am particularly in love with their funghi pizza but everything was spot on. Feels like a hidden SF gem.
Best burgers. Best beer. If you are looking for either, this oughta be the first place you try.

I've never eaten at Tlaloc's locale, but our office gets lunch catered from there all the time and everything is great. •_We love it! I particularly like the chicken or vegetable fajitas, the mango salsa, the chips, and the grated queso fresco they provide for the beans.

The dark atmosphere and red lighting really complimented the pitcher of fresh fruit margaritas. The tone was just right. It's the kind of place you go with good company and get lost in conversation. The booths are rounded so you feel like you have your own private corner. The overall vibe is cozy.Excellent food! Home made chips? SO good. Thick and crunchy and not salty, perfect. I ordered Cornbread Sopas, yum as well. My friend and I both had this pile of pink cabbage garish on our plates...even if it was just garnish I ate every piece of it. What was this delicious surprise?!We got there on a Monday night evening 5 the place was empty. The crowd started to pile in while we were leaving.

I love this place so much. Capannina feels like an escape to Italy - all of the food is absolutely delicious, and the waiters are very charming and attentive. I've been here many times and have nothing but good things to say about it. Great spot for a date (might be a bit crowded for a big group though).

Was there the other night. Reserved a table for 10. The restaurant is kinda small, so make sure you make reservation if you have a big group. Not sure why they close at 9:00 pm every night, so be there early as well. The food is way better that what I expected for a small restaurant out of no where, and the price is great. Could not find a dish that costs more than $10, and they have their own parking in the city!!! For sure will go back and try the other dishes.
Great service, nice ambiance. Food was lovely, not outstanding. Will return next time I'm in town on business.

My husband and I treated another couple to dinner to thank them for being great hosts during our SF trip. •_We'd never been to Firenze, but a local friend had recommended it. •_Our friends arrived early. •_When we joined them, we were shocked to learn that the host refused to seat them and had asked them to wait outside in the cold, windy night until the rest of our party arrived. •_That's no way to treat new customers! •_It was a weeknight and the place was half-full.Firenze's poor hospitality put a damper on the rest of our evening. •_The gnocci was tasty, not sublime, and the spinach salad and bruschetta were good. •_However, the decaf coffee tasted bitter and looked like mud, even when I asked for a fresh cup. •_You can do better for your money.
Staff is very friendly and extremely knowledgeable. Vegetarian Dim Sums are a must. The Sea Bass is fresh and perfectly cooked. Had the Strawberry

Another totally dissapointing entry in SF's take out Chinese scene. I used to order from this place every once in a while when I lived in the Mission and while I could stomach it, I was never excited. I liked the *idea* of it, but not the execution. Only thing I can remember enjoying (but only slightly) was the Mu-Shu.

You have to order first before you can get seated and everyone in your party has to be present. It's also cash only. The dumplings definitely make up for the bad service. I felt like the server was a bit rude specially when we were ordering and trying to get seated. It did get better after we were seated though.We ordered the pan fried pork buns, Shanghai steamed dumplings, the crab

Yelp Check in offer: free hugs from David or Jay. Well, if that doesn't set the tone for the experience, then I don't know what will. This tiny hole in the wall is Korean/Mexican fusion as the name implies. They serve different kinds of meats in their burritos, tacos, quesadillas, and tater tot nachos - to be labeled as "totchos" from here forth. The first time we stopped in was our first day in San Francisco. I was beyond floored when I saw bulgogi on the menu and then how they were using it. Bulgogi... in traditional Mexican dishes? Win. We ordered a plate of bulgogi totchos to split and they were mothgasmic. Explosions of flavors layered with perfectly crisp tater tots. There was no skimping on toppings, either. Every single bite had every morsel of flavor in it. Truly amazing food experience. We came back our last night in town, ordered the same totchos, the California burrito with bulgogi, and bulgogi totchos. It was way too much food for 2 people, but we powered through and suffered the discomfort of being overly stuffed for a few hours. Worth it!
Went here because the Yelp menu had good prices, but this place is actually way over priced! A veggie burrito is now $7, totally ridiculous!
This is my go to Chinese restaurant in the sunset. Price is reasonable. I've been coming here for years. Food hasn't change. Lunch menu is great value.

Okay, as everyone saying this is mostly take out place. But I needed a lunch atm, and I usually would look for 4.5 or 5 stars in the area, but there were nothing above 4.This was one of these 4 star places.I hesitated a bit, but decided it maybe not that bad.I ordered curry chicken on rice.Well, I did not finish my plate. •_Everything was good, except chicken.There were sinew's and fat served in plate. To me it's not acceptable, but I can see how this place could be good for someone who likes fat and sinew's, because, well if you like THAT in your food, then you would like this place.

I would give 3 or 4 stars because the food is not bad at all. We quite enjoyed everything we ordered. Started off with the black vinegar marinated peanuts.. very good. Perfect with beer. We ordered white wine cava instead and for $8 is overpriced for the small glass you get. We shared small plate of tiki pork belly, which was good. Very fatty though but I like that haha. My partner ordered the westlake rice porridge, which was not my favorite. Way too much cilantro, which overpowered everything. I wanted the thrice cooked bacon.. but they ran out of bacon! Yep this is partly why they get 2 stars from me. I don't think they ran out of bacon.. I think it was almost closing time and they didn't want to make this dish that may take longer to cook. (I ended up ordering the lamb face noodle soup, which was good. The lamb esp was delicious).To explain further my low rating. There was a couple there who waited 45 minutes but when their name was called, the hostess could not read the lady's name (yes "Ellen" is very hard to read.. I guess). So she crossed their name off the list and gave their table to someone else. So there's that. Why not have someone take down people's names? If you're going to have a policy of not seating people because you supposedly can't read their writing? I made sure my name was legible by the way! I think that Saturday night the hostess did a poor job of managing the wait list. I think she was eager to get rid of people from the list because like I mentioned it was almost closing time and there was still a huge line. When we were eating we saw the cook/chef/owner screaming with the hostess. Employees started leaving one by one. And the restaurant was still full. So 2 stars for the ghetto situation. Not something I would have ever expected. Don't show up here if it's after 9pm because you may not get seated until 10pm, and they close at 10:30pm.

Good food, small, good portions, and good service. Got free tiramisu for checking in. Filet mignon was cooked nice and was tender. Had ravioli and a pasta with clams and mussells. Honestly, I didn't really like the pasta sauce. Waiter recommended a wine we drank which was good too.Our total came out to around $140 with tip.

Food only tasted good because I was starving. I ordered a super nacho through Uber eats and the food came smelling like it was sitting in the fridge for a day or two. The rice and black beans didn't seem too fresh. I grew up on beans and rice so I'd have some idea. I might of been fresh but seriously, it smelled like a f$

When the only thing u can rave about is the price, that's not necessarily a good thing. I'm really sorry if this review offends others who like this place. But this is SF, we have lots of asian restaurants that are much better than this place, so it merits only 2-stars.This is a true hole in the wall with only a few coveted counter seats available. I love how this tiny space has survived for many decades. Somehow all these years, the 2 older asian women manage to greet and handle customers, take orders, answer the phone, serve drinks (includes opening coconuts), cook, package to go meals, and wash dishes all day long. They are amazing!! so they get no complaints from me if on a rare occasion sometimes they appear to be grouchy.static.px.yelp.com/bphot_Ü_static.px.yelp.com/bphot_Ü_static.px.yelp.com/bphot_Ü_And I do remember that I raved about their house noodles and the rice dishes in the past when I was still a college student. Now that I'm older and hopefully wiser, food quality matters more. Yamo is just not that good. If u try many of their dishes, you'll taste the same horrible raspy sauce that's not even authentic. Sorry these night pics are not as sharp.static.px.yelp.com/bphot_Ü_static.px.yelp.com/bphot_Ü_static.px.yelp.com/bphot_Ü_Sorry Yamo, I won't B there.

One of the best tacos I've had in my life, hands-down. I got the carne asada super taco and the carnitas super taco. I wish I could give the carne asada super tacos a 6/5 star rating because it went above and beyond my expectations. I've never had anything so delicious in my life. The carnitas didn't compare to the deliciousness of the carne asada but it was still good. My friend got a super burrito and my boyfriend got the enchilada and those were delicious as well. Line was long but it moves pretty quickly. They only take cash so be sure to go to the ATM beforehand if you don't want to be charged for ATM fees within the restaurant. Don't use the bathroom. Seriously, it's disgusting. So disgusting to the point that they even covered their health score.
Fun spot and great service, with emphasis on seafood. Always nice to get a front seat at the chef's counter to watch the action. Tasty, though a bit heavy on the sauces.

While the service was great, the food was not. •_Our pastas were luke warm and nothing exciting. •_We requested to dine upstairs, but had to eat in the wine cellar below. •_It would be a great place for tasting, but it felt removed and isolated from the rest of the restaurant. Based on how expensive the bill was, I would not return nor would I recommend it to friends.

Puerto Alegre is a Mexican cafeteria with cocktails and the occasional mariachi. •_Sit near the front window and you will smell the street, ie, the pot. •_The quesadilla I shared there once tasted nice enough. •_When my friend ordered it again, it came closer to a panini. •_My chili relleno didn't hold any spice until the very end. •_It was also small and surrounded by a meager helping of beans and rice. •_Then again, I'd asked for the "one item" combo. •_Where's the food?

I went to this place a couple of weeks ago. •_I thought the food was very good, but the service blew goats. •_I had a couple of antipasti (the salumi and the octopus with bean), and my friend had the ravioli. •_The octopus was delightful. •_Service was initially fine, but after we ordered and had some bread and tapenade, things went a bit off the rails.There were four other occupied tables and two waiters. and a guy who was doing the bread/water/busing (whatever that function is called). •_Our waiter came by to see how everything was, and took off before I was able to request more tapenade; we were out, but had plenty of bread, and I had put the empty dish on the outside edge of the table to be in plain sight for such an occasion. •_I called him back and he brought a half-filled dipping bowl. •_I started to ask for more right then, but didn't.When he brought the plates out the bread basket and tapenade were empty, and he didn't even ask if we wanted more of either. •_After waiting for a few minutes, thinking he would have at least asked the table guy to give us more bread, I signalled the waiter in vain, then went over to the table dude (who was busy clearing another table) to please bring more bread. •_This while our waiter was chilling, standing in clear view of our table.Whatever. •_I figure the guy was preoccupied with more important matters in his head. •_And we didn't order a bottle of wine. •_I'd give it another shot, as the food was a solid 4/5.

Crowdy, loud and average food. Only good thing about it was the service.Went with my wife on the valentine day evening, even after reservation had to wait for aprox 30 min. I went there after reading yelp reviews, but was highly disappointed.

Let me start off by saying that the service is absolutely ATROCIOUS. My friend and I walked into the venue and stood at the front for about 10 minutes before any of the employees realized we were there, at which point they finally sat us at a table. After doing so, they had not attended to us to ask if we wanted beverages to start off with. When we finally got their attention after sitting at the table for 10 minutes, we ordered hot teas and our entrees. I ordered the beef and broccoli with a side of steamed white rice and my friend ordered the sweet and sour chicken. They did not bring us water, nor asked if we wanted any. A little while later, they brought an entree, but it was neither of ours... they brought a chicken and Chinese broccoli entree. Eventually (10 minutes later), they brought out the correct entrees and the hot tea at which point we asked for water and the waitress brought it. I will not deny that the food was good. Mine entree was good, hot, but a bit on the smaller side. My friends entree was bit cold, but was good. Again, after the meal, we waited for 10 minutes and the waitress did not notice us, so I had to come to her and get her attention to bring us a check. I gave it to her instantly because I didn't want to wait for her to acknowledge us again... The food is great, but the service is beyond terrible... If you are patient, I would recommend; otherwise BEWARE.

Let me start off by saying that the service is absolutely ATROCIOUS. My friend and I walked into the venue and stood at the front for about 10 minutes before any of the employees realized we were there, at which point they finally sat us at a table. After doing so, they had not attended to us to ask if we wanted beverages to start off with. When we finally got their attention after sitting at the table for 10 minutes, we ordered hot teas and our entrees. I ordered the beef and broccoli with a side of steamed white rice and my friend ordered the sweet and sour chicken. They did not bring us water, nor asked if we wanted any. A little while later, they brought an entree, but it was neither of ours... they brought a chicken and Chinese broccoli entree. Eventually (10 minutes later), they brought out the correct entrees and the hot tea at which point we asked for water and the waitress brought it. I will not deny that the food was good. Mine entree was good, hot, but a bit on the smaller side. My friends entree was bit cold, but was good. Again, after the meal, we waited for 10 minutes and the waitress did not notice us, so I had to come to her and get her attention to bring us a check. I gave it to her instantly because I didn't want to wait for her to acknowledge us again... The food is great, but the service is beyond terrible... If you are patient, I would recommend; otherwise BEWARE.

The waiter was extremely pushy, took our plates with the pricey crab cakes before we finished and accused us of there being nothing on the plate and THEN when he saw the crab cake in a bowl accused us of handing him the plate!!! Dude this place is a joke, everyone dropping everything and check your silverware, chances are there is food still on it!

The food here is horrible! All the familiar Chinese dishes did not taste the way they were supposed to. Everything was bland and all the dishes tasted the same. How do you make broccoli chicken taste the same as mongolian beef? I am perplexed. Never will I come here again nor will I ever recommend this place to any family or friend.

Great choice for cioppino (tues night) if you're not around Sotto Mare. Gets busy but can call in an hour beforehand to get on the wait list (for up to an hour) - and you'll need it, even for a weeknight. Pass on the eggplant burrata (we're all just interested in the burrata anyway, right)? It's like the hot friend that's an 8 who's accompanied by his/her sad four. Sorry buddy, not happening. Little charred gem salad, •_alternative if you're bored of lacinto kale / arugula. What else...bartender was heavy handed with the lemon juice that night. Gnocchi? A smidge •_doughy, but can't hate on all that is fried (goodness).

Decided to finally check out El Techo after months of friends telling me it's crackin. I came here with a friend after work right when they opened and even though it was drizzling and freezing, their rooftop was nice and cozy! They have happy hour from 4-6 M-F I believe and the food is so worth it! Their guacamole is bomb and so is their pollo frito. We also had a pitcher of sangria and their chicharrones but personally it wasn't to die for. The meat was a bit too sweet for my liking but everything else was yummy. We also got the ceviche which I could do without next time. Overall, our server was awesome. Actually service is general was great. Everyone was super friendly and they let us sit at a 4 person table even when we were only a party of two. I will definitely be back!
inetti|
My brother heard about this place

I've been eating at Puerto Alegre since the early '80s and it hasn't changed much, except that my palate has gotten more sophisticated. If I'm only giving 3 stars why do I keep going back? Because I like being there. Valencia is my favorite SF street and I think Puerto Alegre is one of the only places still left from the old days (Taqueria El Toro and a few other restaurants are still there too). They do make a strong margarita - watch out for the high pitcher prices. P.A has the standard Mexican food you'll find everywhere, at reasonable prices, completely good enough to satisfy, but nothing to write home about. •_But hey, I just love being on Valencia Street.
Excellent. Each pasta dish is so complex and balanced! I can't believe it was that good!Beyond my expectations.

Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)0/1 Star: had to pay a meter. But at least the meter was easy to find. The area isn't busy. No wait. _____Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)1/1 Star: in terms of Asian restaurants they were very polite compared to most of the other ones. Feels cleaner than other ones too. •_ _____Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)2/3 Stars: taste like normal San Francisco dim sum. _____Overall Experience3/5 Stars _____Pictures_____Last Words

Great food despite poor delivery. I was feeling a bit lazy and decided to order from here despite living close by, ordered through eat24. The food was out for delivery shortly after I placed the order. Unfortunately it took 40 minutes for it to travel 5 blocks and was tepid on arrival.The person whom I spoke with graciously explained the situation and reached out to eat24 on my behalf.The food was excellent after going in the microwave for 30 minutes. I will be eating here again soon.
The best hot pot place in San Francisco Bay Area.Great customer service and great food.
The meat is stenchy, its not even one type. All the meat choices were stenchy. Service was slow and inattentive even those they're constantly walking around. Definitely not coming back.

I live in San Mateo every time I go to san francisco I do not forget to go through the TASTE GOOD TAQUERIA excellent care of food preparation excellent burrito, tacos, tortas, quesadillas.tostado, chile rellenoI give them all 5 stars

Wow what a brunch. We toured all over the city looking for a good brunch place on our first visit to San Fran and we saw this one on Yelp. 15 min later on an Uber pool we got here and we had one of the best brunch food we ever had! My girlfriend and I got the American breakfast which was good but the crown jewel was the croissant french toast. Devine. Nothing can't describe how enjoyable was that experience.In a nut shell go there and order it!

Sat at the wine bar and had a great dinner. Got some glasses of wine that were well recommended and were able to try a couple different types before deciding on which one to get. Pasta was thick and not overly rich which is always a plus, kept it light and right. We got the pizza as well, can't remember what the name of it was but was spicy with some choice meats on it! Again really tasty and fresh. This place is a hot little number for a date or casual wine bar. I suggest sitting at the bar if at all possible, always more fun.

A delightful experience. Fun and tasty dim sum, from tame dishes like duck and yummy bok chow to more exotic, like chicken feet and jellyfish. I didn't have anything I didn't like. Good service, genuine food, and surprisingly good prices. Fed five hungry adults for $83. Recommend highly.

First time trying deep dish pizza and WOW! Customer service was beyond excellent, we were very well attended to and loved the service. We ordered :garlic bread; scrumptious, mini pizza look a like, with cheese my garlic. Wings; were ok, wish they had a sauce. Deep dish; pepperoni with sausage, so delicious!We will most definitely we back soon!
I had the ceasar salad with sauteed calamari and tiramisu and some drinks the food wasn't special for north beach but acceptable along with the service see photos.

I've had Deflina bookmarked for ages but never went. •_Why? •_Cause nothing pops out at me.My friend managed to get a last minute reservation before the holidays. •_Both of us were stuck staring at the menu and struggling with what to order.We tried their signature Calamari, Risotto, Duck, and Panna Cotta. •_Everything was pretty forgettable. •_Risotto and Panna Cotta are all acquired tastes. •_Both got nasty as I ate more. A 4% service charge is added to support SF employer mandates?! What is this?!I still get into debates as to whether or not to count this as a tip....this bothers me....esp since dishes are already pricey and small portioned.

This place has some really delicious food. I order the chicken fried rice, General Tao Chicken and War Wonton Soup. Everything tasted fresh and light. None of the food was greasy. •_Found them on yelp

Stopped in on a busy Sunday at lunch time and managed to get a table outside! •_I had the pescado tacos, very fresh tasting and delicious. •_My friend had the chicken tacos which she said were very good. •_The chips and salsa were ok, could've skipped them, but the agua frescas are a must! •_Yum!

I really enjoyed my dinner here. They had some interesting selection of cheeses and I love the fixin's they give you with it (honey, jam, almonds, and some bread). Pizza was solid, and their boar lasagna was VERY tasty.It sounds like their happy hour menu is one of the best in town, so I'll definitely be returning to try that!
PIZZA MONSTER APPROVED Get there fast and order the housemade sausage pizza before it's gone, every bite is amazing.

This place is NOT as good as it use to be. Te food is bland and they give very small portions. I use to really like them. The family and I went last night and no one enjoyed the meal.We ordered •_5 different items. The only the item we liked was the pigstickers.Szechuan eggplant w/prawns: had a nice flavor but the prawns were over cooked.Lemon chicken: small portion and soggyHunan Salmon: mainly consisted of onions

I have heard great things about this place, so had high expectations when I tried it for the first time yesterday. On Fridays they have the 2 for $7 deal, which can't be beat! Everything we ate was delicious: the nachos, quesadillas and chicken and carne asada soft tacos. And a churro of course. I will definitely be back to Nicks and recommend!

Starting with a 30 minutes wait is never good, but I didn't want to knock off any points for that.But unfortunately, A16 wasn't able to redeem itself with the food... the Pizza's were good, but not as nearly as good as the neighbor Delarosa.The Uni pasta was interesting, but nothing to run back to.For the price and praise, expected way more
Got little star via door dash tonight. Showed up on time but luke warm. I quote my kid..."is this little caesars?"

Definitely a place I would recommend for some basic essential Dim Sim. Would say it's not a place recommended to go if you are looking for a full selection, but for what they do they do it well. Looks like they don't do reservation only waiting list the list outside the place so be prepared to wait. From the fact that they do fresh dough to wrap the dumplings to the fact the it tastes so fresh you are in for a delight.Tips:1. Tom Yum Soup Dumplings - They come in a nice reddish color to the outer layer of the dumpling which has a nice sauce to complement the pork inside2. Shrimp and Chive Shu Mai - Jam packed is some juicy decent sized shrimp with some hints of chive to make it all have a nice decadent goodness3. Egg Yolk Bun - So fluffy and the egg tastes amazing. A great way to finish off your meal with a nice treat4. Tea - Not as strong and steeped with a tea bag it is a good way to cleanse while you are having your meal
Restaurant|

I head here for drinks after work from time to time. The clear best aspect of this place is it's large outdoor patio with a BAY VIEW. If you have lived in San Francisco long enough, you will be as shocked as I was to read "big outdoor patio" and "water view" in the same sentence. It's right by the Embarcadero, which means you will have some traffic noise. Still much better than yelling at your friends in a tiny, crowded bar!The only reason this isn't 5 stars is because the drinks are mid-range prices, and I love a great spot with less expensive wines/cocktails. If you're looking for a fun summer cocktail, I would try the Fresca (watermelon, rum, lime and sugar) -- divine!

We were celebrating a special occasion, which we mentioned to our server Sarah who then made it a point to ensure that we two women had an exceptional evening. But it went beyond Sarah, from the minute we were greeted at the door every member of staff was super lovely.The food is the best both my foodie friend and I have enjoyed in a long time and recently we've dined at some pretty toney places that were disappointing. I have memories of the Jewish-style artichoke in Rome and Locanda's did not disappoint. The meatballs had us asking for additional delicious char-grilled bread so we could wipe the plate clean, and we did! The asparagus and blood orange was a sublime combo. We shared the Rigatoni all Carbonara - heaven in our mouths.We had the Italian sparkling to kick off the night and followed with the Costa Graia Cesanese Piglio Superior, which I'm still dreaming of today. My friend had affogato for dessert and I had a glass of Malvasia.Thank you, Locanda, for making my first day as an American truly memorable! We will definitely be back:-)

I came here for cinco de mayo. Showed up 15 minutes before my friends and politely waited outside not putting my name on the list only for my friends to show up and ask if our name was on the list yet. Huge mistake.The wait was considerable, but made ever more pleasant by the atmosphere of San Francisco denizens loudly talking over eachother and over pitchers of margaritas and every once in a while cheering when the Maitre' D would read out a name several times loudly, get no response, and cross another name off the list of those waiting for tables.The marg pitchers here are a reasonable $33 for the house marg (I don't know what the other ones are but the house marg is good). The food here is good as well. Highly recommend coming here with a group and getting good and sloshed then scarfing down some quality mexican food. Sounds like a good time.

Yummy margaritas. Since I never drink, it doesn't take much, and since these tasted like they had tequila in them, I had several and got pretty drunk :). Decent Mexican food, their chips were my favorite, though I've had better salsas at my neighborhood joint. The food is cheap, but the pitcher of maragaritas topped our bill off to over 50 bucks. Great ambiance and service too. Expect a wait; we got there and there were several groups waiting, but I overheard one of the servers saying that the manager didn't realize that there were people waiting, and then we all got seated at the same time.

Back in the day, I used to hit this area of SoMa fairly often. •_Azie, the former occupant of this space, and Lulu, still there, were the popular and new eateries to frequent. •_Azie has long since been replaced by Zero Zero and now coming up to this area is about as easy for me as juggling, in other words not very easy.I was glad to finally be able to eat in the area, but being a holiday weekend and having some restrictions in terms of my dining guests meant that my options were limited. •_Although Zero Zero has nice continuous hours, their full dinner menu isn't available until 5:30 pm. •_Until then, they only serve their excellent pizzas and salads. •_Moreover, reservations are usually recommended and even the early hours were booked for the entire weekend. •_Luckily, we decided to stop by early and see whether we could sneak in before the main crowds. •_I wanted to try the pizzas but also wanted to try a few dinner items. •_The hostess was more than friendly and while she said she was going to put us on a waitlist (never sounds like a good thing), she also gave us a very realistic and reasonable estimate and before we knew it we were seated in a nice four top nearby the bar. •_The space looks completely different than the Azie I remember and the dark wood tones are hip and inviting. •_There's a second floor and the drinks are as good as the food. •_ Our order:Arancini - $9.50. •_Risotto filled deep fried balls filled with cheese and garlic. •_Five small round balls that are nicely fried and plated with some arugula. •_Tasty, but really bite sized.Hamachi Crudo - $15.95. •_Three slices of hamachi were plated with a combination of avocado, herbs, and oils. •_Fresh and tasty, but pretty pricey given the number of pieces.Squid Ink Bucatini - $23.95. •_The dark pasta was mixed with fresh tomatoes and mixed with uni butter. •_It actually was topped with two pieces of uni and the pasta was both al dente and flavorful. •_Some haven't liked this dish that much, but I thought it was done well.Castro - $19.95. •_The pizzas here are famous and Michael Bauer supposedly compares the pizza to French Laundry as the menu is proud to share. •_I like a meaty pizza so ordered the Castro with the sopressato. •_It's nicely thin crust and not too burnt and the cheese is bubbling and melted when it arrived. •_I thought it was very tasty and I enjoyed it immensely.Pimm's Ale - $11. •_I don't even really know what Pimm's is but I always like drinks mixed with it. •_More research has taught me that it's a popular English beverage and drunk at some events like polo tournaments and Wimbledon. •_I guess I was classy and didn't even know it. Overall, I was super happy that Zero Zero was able to squeeze us in. •_Our other option for the area was What's Up Dog and while I love mango lassi and hot dogs, I was hoping for something more. •_Zero Zero fit the bill. •_This is a great SoMa addition. •_The price point quickly adds up but both the ambiance, service, and quality of food makes up for it and makes for a great night out. (not an every day dinner though I saw many orders of pizzas to go ringing up at prices like $80-100)Zero Zero accepts credit cards, including American Express.

went here for my friend's birthday celebration last night.we had a whole mess of people.. and so they placed us in our own private room - which was AWESOME ! wished they had karaoke tho!so the service was quite good! they gave us unlimited refills on Coke and Sprite... ( : the weekend Buffet Style dinner is $24.95 + our 18% tax n tip came out to be close to $32. Quite pricey.. but hey.. free soda + a private room = happy camper.on the weekdays its only $16.95. The only beers they have are Bud lite, Corona, and Heineken. side note : I LOVEEEEEEE eating mussels with heineken. they give you a 2 hour limit, but they're pretty lenient. they're conveniently located next to Crepe Temptation. which is awesome!the only con is that the room was steaming hot like a suana, and there was no ventilation except the open door!! they have this tiny dinky fan but my friend's butt was hogging it up. we were pretty uncomfortably hot in there.. w/ all the steam from the hot pots and the body heat and trapped air =[

Looks like I have a new favorite burrito spot in town. I eat a fair share of burritos and have no plans to stop, and this place rocks it. Super burrito with carne asada: fresh quac and salsa, mexican rice, refried beans, solid steak under $10 in San Francisco? Yes please. Not much to add here, stop reading reviews and go to this place.

Wish I had discovered this place when I still lived in San Francisco proper! In short: West of Pecos is a low-key but nice Latin American restaurant with flavorful, beautifully plated food.My favorites:-Fish tacos: a plate comes with 3 tacos. You can also ask for smaller portions as well--we got 1 extra so we could split evenly. The batter is crispy and light but well-defined, and the fillings are a crunchy slaw and tangy sauce, which complement the fish very well. (Pro tip: eat them fast or the corn tortillas will start to lose structural integrity from the slaw)-Maple brussel sprouts: I could eat these all day. I don't know what they put in this dish, but it is so comforting to eat. It is sweet yet rounded out nicely with a slightly salty/buttery flavor. Texture-wise, the sprouts are soft and minimally crispy.-Churros: this dish comes with 3 churros and 2 sauces. All I need is that caramel/dulce de leche sauce, though. Churros were crispy outside and soft inside, but a couple of time started imploding in my fingers. No worries though, because that caramel sauce is amazing.Worth checking out if you're looking for good food with a clean, rustic environment. Or if you just want a sangria and/or margarita. ;)

BF knew I was a big fan for truffle so he brought me to this place for my birthday dinner. What a surprise! As soon as I walked in this place, Ooh la la! A snooty place! (just by what customers were wearing) However the bookcase at the entrance, the arches, the wood-beamed vaulted ceiling, even the decorated little corner at the end, softened the atmosphere at the same time. Of course, the warm and soft lighting was one of the big reasons as well. Being too stressful isn't a good way to enjoy my food. We both had ordered a 4-course menu so we could try the most famous flan-like Parmesan budino, the foie gras pasta scented with black truffles, Lobster panzerotti, Pancetta wrapped scallops and the duck entrê©e. All of them were so fantastic and I especially loved the duck entree. It melted in my mouth within seconds! I loved duck but there were not many places making a good dish. If they keep the duck on their menu, it will become my designated place for a duck dish. For dessert, we both have the Semifreddo. Wonderful! For this night, I had truffles, foie gras and the duck. It sounded more like a French menu. But I usually don't have a good luck with most French restaurants. I had better luck and better duck with Acquerello!

Classic seafood in Fisherman's Wharf!Was spending the afternoon in the area and needed to find a place with some seafood. Found Cioppino (chi-peen-o) and were not disappointed. The service was great with our server, Ian, and the portions were good. We had to have the signature dish and the broth was so good, making all the seafood so tender and full of flavor. Also had two cups of chowder, courtesy of a Yelp Check-In, and were surprised at how filling it was. Super delicious, but you may want to reconsider your entree if you're having more than a cup of chowder.Definitely a great spot along the west side of Fisherman's Wharf and would definitely go back again.

We finally get a reservation for 9:30 pm and in my opinion they should not take a reservation if they cannot serve items on their menu! •_They were out of bread (luckily we have already tried Tartine's bread) and then another pasta which someone in our group ordered had to be rushed to their kitchen lest they ran out:(Well, either reduce the menu prices by 1/2 or don't take reservations if you can't offer items on your menu that late!Ambiance: •_Not that great, a bit crowded! •_If you are charging that much for your menu items, seat your clientele so they are not within ear shot of each other!!!

This was a major disappointment on several levels. First off, the margaritas aren't made with tequila (they only have a beer/wine license); so you know this didn't bode well. The sangria is cheap, but there's a reason for that. It's like kool aid with a few tiny pieces of orange in it. This continued the run of shitty sangria I've had in this town. Get a beer.The service was strange - the hostess/waitress was socially awkward, which is fine, but then maybe this isn't the best job for you.Onto the food. I will not heat here again. Why? They have raised their prices from what's listed on menupages - and for no good reason. The food was average or below. The prices were above. I'm no mathematician, but that doesn't add up. My chille relleno was drowning in a really watery sauce - which makes no sense bc you fry something so it will be crispy (ideally) - but then you dump it in a watery sauce so it becomes a mushy mess? And, it still had no flavor. Beware - the "quesadillas" are actually empanadas and they rest on a bed of very spicy sauce. It was the only item I enjoyed (all 2 bites worth), but it almost took my man down. He's delicate.The guac was just ok - lacking flavor punch, and served with the now infamous 3 fried tortillas. Luckily a nice busboy stopped and offered us a couple more so we could polish off our average guac.Someone in the kitchen must be on a low sodium diet bc everything seemed to lack salt - and they don't even have salt shakers on the tables. I didn't bother asking for one for fear of getting charged.The thing is, I would have paid the money and put up with the service if the food had been great - I would love to support a new local place trying to make it happen in the Mission. But this wasn't that.

A solid 3.5Now if I was giving out my Yelp rating based solely on the pizza alone my rating would easily surpass the 4 mark. This pizza is magical folks ( and I don't mean magical tasting when consumed drunk). No, this is thin crust piled high with toppings and fixins eager to be consumed. I had passed by this place for years, occasionally ducking in for a slice or two to go before heading out to the location of my next bout of drunken shenanigans. The slices to go only clause never bothered me as I find pizza a highly transportable food. But one evening not too long ago I broke down and actually found myself dining inside. A friend of mine and I have been having some boy problems and were up for a pity party table for two. Seriously, a bitchery-pitchery session* can only be capped off with something hot and gooey. We went for a half veggie, half meaty large or extra large and a pitcher of beer for optimum comforting purposes. Yeah we'd take a slice of each and fold them over like some ridiculous over stuffed sandwich. Yeah holy yum yums, we stopped complaining and started shoveling in uber fresh toppings. The veggies were crisp, the meat was thick, flavorful and spicy and somehow the crust was not soggy to the point of flopping all over the place. My main pet peeve was the ambiance and decor. Honestly, the tables and chairs reminded me of a parish hall ready for a spaghetti dinner and yeah, it was distracting to look at the huge vacuum located right behind my friend's head. The waiter, though polite enough, seemed really indifferent to being a server. Really if my friend and I are going to drop close to $50 on pizza and beer for two is wrong to expect a wee bit more? I'd definitely return but I think I'll stick with the to go route. *bitchery-pitchery session: where two or more females get together to complain, whine and commiserate on what's been going on and going wrong over a few beers

In San Francisco recently on business. After my first meal at Perbacco I returned every night because I had to try as many dishes as possible...its that good. Highlights were the pappardelle with rabbit ragu, roasted octopus (OMG), dark chocolate-basil bonet for dessert. The food is SUPERB, and if you're lucky to have a waitress as good as Amber, your meal is elevated to a truly wonderful experience. She REALLY knows her stuff, knows her wine pairings, made great recommendations and is an absolute delight!! A memorable meal with memorable service. Can't wait to return!!

I'll start with the end first. When people, including me, speak about San Francisco being the best restaurant town in America, I use Seven Hills as the singular example of why that is true. It's a neighborhood restaurant, the food is pick-anything-on-the-menu and be blown-away good, the food and wines prices are extremely reasonable for the quality, and Alex at the front of the house could give Danny Meyers a lesson or two on how to treat customers right. It's truly perfect in my book. I've lived in SF for 13 years, and I've been coming to dinner here for many years prior. My wife is in the wine industry, and we are both foodies. Seven Hills to me is the quintessential SF restaurant. I've eaten there 40 times.. The Ravioli Uovo is the best dish in all of SF in my opinion. But I've never tried many items, and there was never one that I wasn't thrilled with.The food and wine menu are both perfect. The have the perfect balance of enough choices, but not too many so as to have any dish or wine be less than spectacular. And it the world of empire-building and corporate formula restaurant greed, it's refreshing to see prices that are so reasonable, and amazing given the quality.
