And last but not least, you cannot underestimate the impact of the front of the house person on a restaurant. Alex is fond of saying "I don't like 'no', it's such a negative word". He'll bend over backwards to accommodate a reservation request. He'll send you across the street to a wine bar when it's overflowing, and then come over and personally tell you your table is ready. And he makes every guest feel like a regular. Seven Hills. Best restaurant in San Francisco. It's my go-to can't-miss. I bring every single guest in town there. I never get tired of it, and my guests are always blown away.

Not sure why there's so many low ratings but this place is the place to go when you want some good chinese food! Their beef fried rice, sweet and sour fish, and string beans with chicken are BOMB!! My dad is obsessed with ordering food from this place they know us now!! They have a coupon on their pamphlet menus for a free fried rice when you order over a certain amount! Also other coupons but that's the one my dad uses the most!! Fast and decent prices! Very nice workers as well(:

We came here for a Bachelorette on 9/19, we had 10 people and when we called they said they don't take reservations...no problem we got here around 840 (the close at 10) and they couldn't seat us for half an hour, no problem the awesome host pointed us in the direction of a great dive bar and we has a blast waiting.We did not know, however, that they were going to be mad and complaining the whole time about us getting sat late (it was about 930 by the time we finally got sat). We were really turned off by the attitude. We didn't get our drinks until after we ordered dinner.We are all in the industry so we completely understand getting sat late, but the constant, in your face reminder, of "well our kitchen closes at 10" •_gets to be an insult especially when we got here before 9. By the time our food came out mine was so cold (I got Carne asada) I couldn't eat it and sent it back, asked them to warm it up, they said they don't have a microwave but they would "see what they could do" no apology or anything. Then we found out, after no last call, that the bar closed at the same time as the kitchen.We could see and hear the staff complaining and talking crap about our table, it was so off putting we almost walked out. The manager never once came over to say hi or apologize about our 2 mistaken plates (another girl never received her food and finally had it comped). All on all we all left with a little bit of a spur taste in our mouth, if it weren't for the food we wouldn't have stayed. Ps the girl with the sexy hot pink hair was the only one to not rush us, and go so far as to offer us desert and coffee, when out own server didn't do so. Thank you hot pink hair!

I came here with high expectations but left feeling mediocre. I got the stuffed quail and it was really salty! I almost couldn't finish it. For the price tag, I feel like the food definitely could have been better. Dessert saved the day though, can't remember the name but it had pear in it! While the main course was too salty, the dessert had the perfect level of sweetness! Probably won't be coming here again.
Inexpensive, good food! Try their new Shar Char Chicken Noodle Soup. It is heavenly.Hole in a wall place but you can't go wrong with the prices or the quality of food. I highly recommend it.
Very good food. The Dry Braised Chicken Wings (4 out of 5 as San Tung gets a 5 out of 5) are amazing and the Egg Roll is good too.

We just had the best little dinner on the last night of our trip to San Fransisco. This place was perfect. The owner is a little old(ish) Italian guy who greets you at the door. His charming wife came over to the table to talk to us. His daughters served us. We had great apps - wonderful dinners - everyone cleaned their plates. Looked like a great wine list if you want a bottle. We ordered by the glass and enjoyed our wine completely. We were giving hugs by the time we left because we felt like family. We'll definitely remember this night and be back next time we're i town.

This place is so cool. It's my boyfriends fav or close second fav spot in the city. In the mission, close to Bart. Unassuming. Hole in the wall with Chinese New Year style dragon hanging all over the ceiling and deep red lights. We call in the inferno sometimes. Spicy food! Not everything is spicy but if you think it might be spicy, it's spicier than that. Soooo Good. Thrice cooked bacon, wings, pastrami, and salted cod fried rice are the only items you need. And sake and beer to cool the burn. You're welcome.

Yah this restaurant has it going on. The dim sum dishes were all really excellent and very fresh. Great flavor and the right amount of spice - but be careful spicy means spicy. i always ask for mild. The best thing us the flavor and the freshness. Yum - but also take care the place is often packed.

We •_decided to eat here after attending the Uncorked Wine Festival. •_There were a lot of tourists around, but it was a beautiful day by the water and they have great outdoor seating.I ordered their mixed salad, and my husband had the shrimp and crab cocktail. •_Both were excellent.We had great service. •_I found the prices to be very reasonable.

GET THE CALI BURRITO!! Thursday night + packed dinner hour. Place is small but i managed to get a seat when our food was ready. Staff were polite, quick to respond, + help with whatever was needed. i got the california burrito w/ bulgogi. SO GOOD!The sweet + chewy bulgogi, hint of spicy salsa, cream guac

Great spot for brunch - relaxing space with sunlight filling the dining area. Reservations a must so you don't have to take your chances and wait. We had the Raviolo with Farm Egg, Brokaw Farm Avocado Salad, and Sea Scallops - all were tremendous!
I loved this place! I was there with my pup

I came on a Saturday afternoon, and was seated immediately. Customer service was great, and very attentive to our requests. The food and drinks were good quality, but the menu's were very limited. Also a little pricey for the amount Ex: ordered a burger and fries, but there were only 4 French fries Definitely Recommend, but not the place for big esters or if you're expecting a good portionAlso, The $40 margarita isn't worth the price, small quantity (came in basically a beer mug with small glasses that were supposed to allow for 5 drinks) and average taste

Little Star steps out from other San Francisco pizzerias to offer deep dish as well as thin crust. •_This isn't Chicago Deep Dish, though; it's California Deep Dish, ala Zachary's of Berkeley. •_Garlicky, cheesy and full of spinach and other good things. •_The white pie is also good.Little Star is probably second to places like 211, Ragazza and Delfina for pizza quality -- for one thing, their menu selection doesn't really vary seasonally at all -- but they're also more affordable, both in the pizzas and in the wine/beer menu. •_This is the pizza place you go to when you're too tired to cook, but don't want to spend a bunch.

I hated everything about this place. •_There was no atmosphere and the fucking door was left wide open allowing the lovely frigid bay breeze to sweep its brusque arms around the restuarant, knocking over napkins, chips and the occasional todddler. •_I paid a full $8 for a taco the size of a wafer cracker and a glass of what was supposed to be sandia but was actually meth mixed with sugar and maybe a piece of watermelon. •_We were given 3 numbers for our food, when indeed we only had one order, but the cashier insisted we needed 3. •_When the server brought the food he asked us over and over why we had 3 and then rolled his eyes in that 'oh my god you stupid customers have 3 numbers' sort of way. •_Ya'll know that look.

I've spent a lot of time in San Diego where Mexican restaurants are like McDonalds. Their cheap and everywhere. You can get a burrito for $5 and its stuffed with cheap greasy beef. Many of the Mexican restaurants in San Francisco are more true Mexican food. But Orale Orale sort of reminds of the good old fast food Mexican. Its a little more expensive (about $8) but its quick and easy. The meat they use is actually pretty good. Its juicy and flavorful. I got the carne asada supremo, which came with guac/sour cream which is essential to any burrito. The tortilla they use is a little flimsy and tends to fall apart as it gets soggy from soaking up the grease and juice. The service was great. Caters to a lot of lunch time office workers so it gets backed. Theres are separate lines for take out and seating. They workers are fast and friendly which was a big plus to this place. They seem to have only one type of salsa and some store bought tapatio as their hot sauce menu so that was a little disappointing. Other than that the food pretty fresh but it could be cheaper.
izzeria|
izzeria|

This place was awesome. Had dinner here on Saturday night. Food was excellent (we shared a pozole and a mixed fajita plate). The chips and salsa were free and were kept topped up all night.The pitchers of margaritas went down even better, delicious!Friendly efficient service and a live mariachi band really completed the night. Reasonable prices too. We had to wait 25 mins for a table on a Saturday evening, so best to reserve if possible.

I was visiting San Francisco back in March 2016 and my friend took me here. •_It was highly enjoyable due to the sleek and trendy atmosphere, as well as the drink and food selection. The portions were pretty small but besides that everything else was amazing. I ate here for dinner at around 5:00 PM and I was tremendously impressed with the hip-hop background music. Definitely an enjoyable place to go to and I look forward to going back next time I am in the Bay.

Not a bad taco. I like that they have an intermediate "special" level between regular and super, that just adds cheese and guacamole, which is how I like my tacos. The grilled chicken quality is good. Spicy salsa could be spicier, though.

This place is a must try! From the food made with pure love to the customer service, you will be taken care of and will leave happy, wishing you could eat there every day. If I had to recommend one thing and just one thing (there are so many) I'd recommend the gnocchi. Like little buttery Italian pillows, they melt in your mouth. I think I died and went to heaven - a happy, delicious, soft, pillowy heaven. I love that it's a family run business. And all of the staff I encountered spoke Italian. It's like I stepped into Little Italy and was apart of the family. I immediately felt welcomed and at home at the same time. I will be back tomorrow and will recommend this place to any friend in town. Buon cibo, buon vino, buoni amici.

I realize OJ's doesn't need my recommendation. It's packed nightly. But my husband and I love to go into the bar area, sit on the plush green banquette by the fireplace, order something to drink and/or eat, and relax. It's so cozy and comfy and luxurious at the same time. The staff is professional and friendly. The food is pricey but excellent. The decor and soundtrack make me feel like I've gone back to the 70s, but in a good way, which may be why mostly older white people go here. It's not super hip. But we love this place.

Pizza - 8/10. You can taste the freshness in the ingredients. The sauce is unique and tastes spectacular.The crust is NY style..almost close to what you get with wood burning ovens. Delivery - 10/10 . It's just great when you get a pizza delivered piping hot just like it is in the restaurant. I would give it 5 stars but 30$(including tip) for a large Victor's special delivered is a little on the expensive side. They do not have any coupons or specials. But I guess when the quality and service is this good you can pay a little more.

My family and I ordered a pizza from the Marina Patxi's in great anticipation of tasting their acclaimed offerings. After 2 hours of waiting for delivery to Russian Hill, we called to cancel. We were starving! The delivery guy showed up 10 minutes later while we were walking back from our neighborhood joint with pizza but didn't offer any excuse other than there must have been a "misunderstanding" of how long the delivery would take. Me thinks I'll forgo ordering from Marina Patxi's again.
talian Restaurant|

As stated in other reviews - this is an old style Italian restaurant. •_You will not be getting olive oil and balsamic vinegar to dip your bread in. It's just plain french bread and butter. The place is still the same as it was it was opened in 72. It's basic old school •_Italian and you're likely to find all the old familiar standards. My wife got ravioli in a pesto sauce. I ordered am Italian sausage sandwich. My wife liked her ravioli - it was good but not grate. I was disappointed by •_Italian sausage sandwich as it was cut into 2 one side had the sausage with sauce and no cheese - the other side had sausage and sauce but no cheese and the roll the sandwich was in •_- meh. The wait staff was nice but slow - they seemed more busy talking to each other than giving service. I'd say the pizza is the food to order here. The prices were reasonable - but on my part I would have given it another star if the cooks were more attentive to the food and wait staff would socialize on their time off. Do one to leave with one complement - their homemade italian dressing was very tasty and the high point. However next time I'm on Clement - think I'll stick to some of the awesome Asian restaurants there and if I want Italian go to other places in The City.

Stopped in here based on the positive reviews and I'm so glad I did. I sat in the bar watching the harbor and enjoyed the lobster bisque and a sole entree. And a phenomenal gin cocktail. My server was incredibly helpful and very friendly. This is a hidden gene in the very touristy Fisherman's Wharf area. •_All organic and locally sourced. And delicious too!

We reached there are 4pm. They were still serving lunch items. I ordered ceviche ( too much lemon), fish burrito was the best,my husband ordered chicken tamales and he loved it. Overall the food was great. I loved their margarita. I wish they had less ice. I'll definitely recommend this place in city for Mexican food.
Amazing. A hole in the wall with one table, but the dim sum is mouth watering.

Everyone has their favorite taqueria, and this one is mine. What takes it over the top for me is not just their burritos -- which are spectacular -- but the rest of the menu. The tamales are great, the taco plate comes with guacamole and sour cream standard, they have tons of drinks to choose from, and their chips are freshly made in-house. And the salsa? Red and green; both are hot, and both are very flavorful. Nothing watery here. The only thing I find myself wanting are radishes and pickled carrots on the table, but that just gives me a reason to try something else and not come here every single time I want a burrito.
Fusion sandwiches are amazing! The pork belly and spicy chicken are both really good and super popular.Try to avoid the lunchtime rush, because there is always a line out the door

Was really looking forward to this place due to all of the mostly positive reviews.Their dim sum is on the larger side as far as portion sizes go.The Har Gow, Shui My, and Char Sui Bao were on the better side.The chicken feet, sticky rice in lotus leaf, potstickers, and shrimp and chive dumplings were on the bad to less than average.The main drawback was that all of the food was cold, some to the point where they were downright frozen. •_An Eskimo would have been very happy living inside of the potsticker given is frozen temperature, thick skin and large size. •_Probably better than most igloos out there, LOL.

Wow, was totally surprised by this place.Decor is modern and clean and the food was delicious.Dim Sum sampler - delicious, great for 2 people, 8 pieces. •_ •_Sea bass - flakely and delicious.Jasmin tea smoked chicken - crispy chicken, just didn't like the sauce. •_It's one of their signature dishes.Tofu dish - I forgot which one but it was fried tofu in a light sauce.Great place for a company dinner or a date. •_Highly recommend.
The cheese pizza is awesome!
Lounge|

I think my mistake was stuffing myself with the guacamole dip and downing that with tecate. •_Speaking of the tecate, they serve it with a fancy glass cup which makes me think I'm drinking a really expensive beer even though it's the ordinary tecate.If you have room in your stomachs, there's more than a handful of entrees that are good. Chile releno, flauntas, empanadas, and the Churros are the items I loved and wouldn't mind eating again.*** Note: Beer goes well with the food so order 1 or more. •_I'm not a margarita person but my friends liked it so I'll trust their word and say order that too.

It rained and Tb wants soup...and brought me here. we ordered the rice porridge i got the one with pork and preserved eggs and asked for additional liver. he ordered the chinese broccoli, rice porridge and squid...like always he knows i will ask for lemons, so he went to a produce a couple of blocks before.its a chinese restaurant you all know how service is.if we are in the area we might... drop by again.

I tend to think that places where waits are incredibly long (especially in touristy areas) are likely to be overrated. Also -- perhaps because I'm often a skeptic -- when places are built up so much by people I usually walk in with doubt from the start. Now, Mama's was pretty good. Was it worth the value and worth the wait? No. This is solidly a 3-star joint: not bad, not fantastic. It's alright. I went it on Tuesday afternoon around 1. My boyfriend and I stood in line for about 20-ish minutes which is apparently awesome given that Mama's is known for hours-long waits particularly on weekends. Once you're let inside, you pay for your food up front. There is a large menu of brunch/lunch items and beverages. Pay attention to the area near the register because there are specials and cocktails taped to the glass wall that aren't on the paper menus. While in line you'll see their various pound cakes, crumb cakes, and other goodies to entice you while you wait. The space itself is rather small which is another reason why the waits are long. It's a charming and cozy corner spot -- very old school San Francisco. Mama's is adorned with kitsch and newspaper clippings and photos from the distant past. In terms of service: rather efficient and friendly.We ordered the Monte Cristo. Oh, yes. It *is* delicious and probably one of the better Monte Cristos I've had. Portion-wise: it's a disappointingly small for the price tag ($12.95). The bread is beautifully eggy and rich and the homemade jam to dip the sandwich in is lovely. We also had the Pan Dore ($10.95): a sourdough baguette French toast that is also eggy and is lightly covered with a wonderfully not-too-sweet lemon butter sauce. I also had a basic iced tea with my meal. In all, from the point we stood in line to our first bite, we waited about 45 minutes which wasn't too bad. In the end, Mama's is worth trying once. It's a San Francisco institution. We decided that we probably won't go back any time soon since we walked away with a reaction of "meh." Long lines (again we went on a Tuesday afternoon which seems to be the way to go!) coupled with a higher price point for middle-of-the-road food... eh, we'll pass.

tip: siu long bao not really the soupy dumplings you'd come to expect. Rather, it's just a thicker skin version of it with no soup inside. •_The stir fried kidneys dish was very tasty. •_scallion pancake was bland at times. •_skewers are just okay. •_pot stickers were good but not greatoverall a good restaurant but nothing sticks out that really warrants another visit in this part of town.

This place gets 1 star because chipotle has better tacos for cheaper. There's no reason to go somewhere with such uninspired and bland food. Also, when I checked my credit card statement about a week after going to this place I noticed that I was overcharged by $30. This is either a careless mistake or an intentional overcharge to my account. Either way. I would never go to this place again.

Hits:-The grilled octopus was life-changing!-You can't dine here and not try the giant Raviolo Uovo.-Pappardelle is one of my favorite pastas and lamb is my favorite type of meat. Needless to say, I loved the pappardelle dish with braised lamb ragu.Misses:-We and the couple next to us were accidentally served fried codfish balls instead of Arancini Fritti. The fish was extremely salty.-When we finally received the arancini, I felt like it was missing a sauce to tie the dish together. Without it, the deep-fried balls had a rough and dry mouthfeel.-Similar to the arancini, the quail was also lacking sauce. The seasoning was very bland. It was interesting to find one quail in a spread-eagle position and the other with a third leg...-While our server was nice, we weren't told of the arancini special (found out when the table next to us ordered it) and didn't receive a birthday candle with our dessert as we had requested.Conclusion:I wanted to love this restaurant really badly and tried some good dishes during my visit. Unfortunately, they weren't enough to outweigh the cons, which means Cotogna is still my favorite rustic Italian restaurant in the city.
Great seafood Italian style. •_Family owned local restaurant. •_They treat you like family here.

I ordered the 4 stagioni pizza. Very very very good. I was beyond impressed. I LOVED the pizza. It was a bit expensive, yet I thought it was worth every penny. I thought the pizza was much better here than the pizza I had in Italy.My friend ordered a dish. I don't remember what it was called but it was very small and the same price as my dish. She said it was really good, but a bit on the pricey end.I really did enjoy my food, but the service was lacking. I went when it first opened at noon time. There was my friends and I and then two others. It wasn't busy. •_The food makes up for the service. I would go there again. The pizza brought me so much joy.
Love love love...tried the fresh spring roll, imperial roll

What an awesome place for some drinks and small bites. With its plush couches for relaxing and wildly colorful decor to bring about a fun ambiance, Azucar Lounge almost guarantees a great time.------------------FOOD: (From best to worst)Churro =- Weird how these churros were the hit of the night. Warm, crispy churros with a cinnamon cream dipping sauce -- we kept ordering these babies.Guacamole w/ Chips = - Delicious. I love the warm tortilla chips here and the guac was nicely seasoned without being too overpowering with any one ingredient.Carnitas Taco = - My first carnitas taco was delicious. My second one had dry carnitas, so it was meh. Pretty inconsistent, but when it's good, it's damn good.Zucchini Quesadilla =- Standard quesadilla, but came with a spicy cream sauce that just made it delicious. Great for sharing.Mac

This margarita haven, lighting up the corner with its neon "Tia" sign, is home to those who are looking for a little "Cheers" action; imagine Sam yelling "[insert name here]," as you nudge open the door. Sidle up to a bar stool, throw a welcoming grin to the locals seated on each side and gain eye contact with bartender Jennie for one of her "heavy on the top shelf tequila" margaritas. It's all love in the glass as she pushes a concoction of fresh lime juice and tequila your way. Simple and tart, this potion will throw any other margarita this side of the Mississippi under the bus. Order up the Jennie's Special, chow down on the infamous salsa and watch this Clement hideaway come alive. If you're looking for a little "me time," this isn't the place for you--regulars love to start up conversation and you'll be obliged to at least •_give a few short answers. Jennie's margaritas may be strong, so if you're looking for a little hand holding, I suggest the kiddie slide at Chucky Cheese. It's a family affair so patience is always appreciated.
My mommy loves this place. Bought to go stuff home such as the roasted duck. Today we had lunch there. Sis got the duck with lai fun noodles soup. Mom ordered half chicken
exican Kitchen|

Went to SF for a family vacation and was thrilled to find Franchino's. •_After falling in love with this family owned nook, my daughter begged to return the next night. •_The food is amazing and homemade by the "mama" of the family. •_We all had something different and no one wanted to share. We did share dessert, however and the cannoli is to die for. We can't wait for our next trip to SF so we can come to Franchino's again!!

Great fun last night after Spamalot show at Azucar. •_John (the owner) made us feel at home and spent some time getting to know us and telling us all about his jalapeno infusion process. •_Very good and tasty cocktails.
I got a burrito and was underwhelmed. It was pretty soggy overall, but the meat was dry. There are better taquerias in the mission!

We enjoyed a great Christmas Eve feast of the seven fishes in the intimate setting at Locanda. Customers and staff all seemed to enjoy the event. House made •_panettone (dessert) was so good we bought one to take home for Christmas morning.

A cozy but lively little place on Fillmore in lower Pac Heights that serves delicious Italian food. I sadly had to give it three stars because the both items that I had chosen to get were sold out that night. I suppose that's not really their fault at all, but I ended up being underwhelmed by the dish that I had.The chicken liver mousse was particularly good and the highlight of the night. The flavors were perfectly balanced with the fruit and the toast that was served with it was flavorful and delicious. I thought the other antipasti that we had (the pig ear with pork belly, potato, goat cheese, and garlic) was rather disappointing though. The goat cheese seemed to not complement the other flavors well and somewhat muffled the flavor of the rest of the dish. The meyer lemon fettuccine was particularly good though. The pasta was perfectly prepared with well balanced flavors to round out the whole dish.Overall the experience was okay, the service was good, but the food left something to be desired. I will definitely try it again one day since I feel like there is definitely great potential here.
Terrible food. Looks good. But taste not there. Service was lousy. Charge to the game

I stopped in at the end of a long day trip in San Francisco. This food was DELICIOUS. I think this may be the best Italian food I've ever had in my life. I love how you can customize your dinner by choosing which pasta you want and pairing it with one of their amazing sauces. Everything is made right in front of you by some super cool, you guessed it, Italian guys. I highly recommend this quaint little joint and will definitely be returning next time I make it out to SF!

I really enjoyed my meal at Quince before they closed for their relocation. We had late reservations at 9:00pm (okay, late for me!) but that did not deter us from an exquisite meal. •_The ambiance was warm, cozy and intimate with elegant, cream walls and beautiful chandeliers. I could actually have a decent conversation here. •_We ordered the tasting menu and instead of racking my brain for the exact dishes all I can say is....sigh. I liked every single dish and they did an excellent job with the execution and the pacing of the dishes. •_I was really impressed with the level of service that they had and was not disappointed at all.I would love to try Quince again when they open up at their new location which will be at Pacific and Montgomery.
Lounge|
I go for the Enchilada Suiza and margaritas. Best I've ever had on both accounts!

Good dim sum, reasonable price, this was always my second go to, but my first place is gone so this is it. Food was good, help is friendly. Parking is a bitch Worth a stop. I will definitely stop again when I'm in the city on Clement Street a lot easier than Chinatown !
Great food, great service, reasonably priced. Very small place though, so I'd recommend visiting off peak hours.

This place has the best and bombing burritos! I've been here several times and ordered the steak and chicken super burrito, veggie burrito, and quesadilla. The ladies taking your order are often very nice and attentive of what ingredients you want to opt out for your burritos. I often order the super burrito instead of a regular burrito just to get the most out of my money. I'm not too sure about the exact price but I think the super burrito was only a dollar more than a regular one with a few inches more of goodness. I would definitely recommend this place for burritos if you're starving because they have great portions at an affordable price, around $7.50+ for a super burrito that fills you for two meals, possibly three meals,what's there not to love?

Pollo asado - •_among the best in town •_- their chicken chile verde items are also excellent.Solid al pastor and fish tacos - barbacoa wrap's pretty good too!Burrito's not so great, quesadillas could be better....I would agree that the ingredients that they claim are local and fresh are at least truly fresh-tasting!All the really really really hot sauce you want!You actually wanna sit down on a friday and catch up on Mexican futbol while sippin ur •_$2 corona (I would pass on the so-called margaritas.)Clean, quick, and feels like Mexico.....can't get enough!

Azucar! I remember my pops screaming that out when he was excited or happy pretty much as far back as I can remember. Popularized by Cuban singer Celia Cruz •_the joyful exclamation translates to sugar, but it means so much more. •_Don't let my skin tone fool you - I am Cuban!Now, this place isn't a Cuban spot. It's actually Mexican. And they have a mean Taco Tuesday. All you can eat tacos for $10. With a deal like that it's easy to see why this place was SLAMMED on a Tuesday night. Are the tacos the best ever? No, not really. Are they decent? Yea! For the price is it worth it? Absolutely!We had a couple of bites including the mac

Second time going to Tacko for lunch. Really wanted to love this place but the disappointment of today's food will probably keep me from coming back. Got the Mexican tacos and elote. All the meat was pretty average. Chicken was the best. That doesn't say much though because the carnitas and carne asada were dry and flavorless. I didn't eat the carne asada since I didn't see the point. I filled up on chips and salsa, which were the best part of the meal. Red and green salsa are tasty. I don't like to much spice so they are my kind of salsa. Elote was fine. Probably better to eat in the restaurant though. Kinda feels like I flushed $15 down the drain. The decor of the place is lovely. I wish the food was too.

This restaurant was recommended as a place I couldn't miss while in San Francisco. I was exhausted from traveling all day and decided to order delivery to my hotel. I ordered an appetizer, chicken entree, and rice dish. The food arrived in a reasonable amount of time but I was missing my appetizer. I found it so disappointing. When I called about the missing food the person who took the call made it seem a little unreasonable to have the appetizer delivered at this point. The rice is good but •_a little bland and the chicken entree has good flavor but the portion size is not appropriate for the price. Overall the cost was not worth the food or "service". Maybe the dine-in experience would have been better.

The food here is incredible and very reasonably priced. The only draw back is the space is small and waiting for a table for lunch can take a while but thats what take-out was created for! Dont forget to try the chicken wings...AMAZING!!!

This place is by far the best Chinese restaurant I have ever eaten at! We were in San Francisco for Labor Day week and we found Clay Pot via a search through Yelp. The reviews are spot on! So amazing and the price, you just can't beat it. My friend decided to order a highly reviewed item, the Honey Walnut Prawns....OH MY GOD!!!!!!!!! The best dish ever!!!!! My husband really wanted some salt and pepper squid, it wasn't on the lunch menu but our waiter said they'd make it anyway. The best salt and pepper squid in the world!!! Sadly I can't remember the other two dishes ordered because it's been a while, but I know they were good. Clearly the Honey Walnut Prawns and the Salt and Pepper squid were the stars. I highly highly highly recommend going here on your next visit to Chinatown in San Francisco! You will not be disappointed!
Had the New Yorker. Had to flip a coin to decide on a pie. •_ It was great. •_Sat outside. •_ Incredible weather. •_ Awesome pizza.
Beef pancake , green onion pancakes, porridge , string beans . My goto place for takeout .

Delarosa is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. I have been here at least 20 times and keep going back for the food. There is always a wait, but you can put your name on the list and walk around the cute stores on Chestnut Street. Now, they do allow you to call in and put your name on the list as long as you check-in within the hour which is definitely a nice plus to the dining experience overall. Food: We always order the same thing and I am never disappointed. We start with the Burrata Bruschetta with hazelnut

Love this place.Great carnitas tacos (not sure how widely known it is that they serve tacos -- most people seem to order burritos) if you're not hungry enough for a burrito.Been to all three Gordos; interesting to note that the flavor of the food differs somewhat by location. •_Irving
Yummy. For me this is the place for a nice and strong margarita lunch! I am a fan of the chile verde burrito. It's packed early so prepare to stand in line for lunch. •_Nice
Yummy. For me this is the place for a nice and strong margarita lunch! I am a fan of the chile verde burrito. It's packed early so prepare to stand in line for lunch. •_Nice

This week I fell in love with a duck. The diner next to me was served a platter of crispy pork and duck on a bed of rice with cabbage. When it came time for my order, I wiped my chin and pointed to my neighbor's dish that I was adoring with saucer eyes. It was love at first sight.When the meal was served, I quietly moaned at every bite of the flavorful fat, tender breast and crispy skin of the roasted bird. When the check arrived, I nearly fell over. Six bucks are you kidding?! The hostess introduced me to chicken feet and other delicacies on my way out. "You try these next time. You'll like them." She said. Walking away in a cloud of ecstasy, I agreed. I would have believed anything she told me.

I finally came here for their infamous roasted chicken and shoe string fries. •_The menu says chicken for 2 but BOY! •_More like chicken for 3 or 4. •_I know I have a big stomach but seriously though, this was way too much for just two people. •_The chicken was very moist, tender, juicy, and importantly, flavorful. •_The bread was the perfect texture and absorbed all the juices from the chicken. •_Perfecto. •_The fries, plentiful. •_It was so thin that after consuming the whole plate, it didn't make you feel full at all. •_Overall, it was worth the 45 minutes for the chicken but I don't think it was worth the $48.
I got the gnocchi in bolognese sauce. It was amazing, the chef is awesome. This is a great hole in the wall place to eat.

I was wondering if it was truly the "Thinnest Pizza". It sure was! Read more below..Review by a vegetarian--Interiors are quite nice and airy. The wait staff is pretty good, although serious at times :)We started off with the Stefania's Salad. Never before has Cheese + Olive Oil + Walnuts + Apples tasted so good! We pretty much cleaned the plate. It is served with a nice little helping of bread, which is sufficient for the salad, but not enough to fill you up. This is good, as the best is reserved for the PIzzaWe ordered the Ricciola, which has thinly shaved Zucchini. When we got it, it truly was thinly shaved, and looked awesome. Pizza was extremely thin, nice helping of salt, good tomato sauce with cheese and zucchini. The ingredients might sound a bit weird together, but it was perfectly balanced, and extremely tasty!Check out the photo I've uploaded, to get an idea on how really thin the zucchini is. (Haven't done so yet)For Dessert, we were too full to try any of the true desserts, so we tried their Biscotti and cookies. These were pretty good too. We got a few home as wellAmazing place, good priced wines, and just delicious food.
ar|

I never heard of this place until my friend's brother mentioned carne asada fries. I guess it's because I'm not usually in the mission unless it's for coffee and cookies. But I'm glad I found this place. Their carne asada fries is probably the best I've ever tasted in a while alongside with their mango salsa! The joint is not busy at 12 am but when 1am hits then the place gets packed with drunk people leaving the clubs. I will be returning here shortly!

Strictly reviewing on the SoCal burrito cause thats all i really really atethe Socal burrito is meat, rice, pico de gallo, and lastly...FRIES! o baby!i got it with the chicken and it was a little dried which is how i like it. •_Not overly saucy but just enough juice to make the dry chicken better. •_I do love the taste of fries (the potato-ness) with my burrito...the mushiness of the missing bean texture. •_They have this sauce, which im assuming is the habanero sauce....its SOOOO good with the burrito and the heat builds and burns but its so good!i miss the sauce already =(

Strictly reviewing on the SoCal burrito cause thats all i really really atethe Socal burrito is meat, rice, pico de gallo, and lastly...FRIES! o baby!i got it with the chicken and it was a little dried which is how i like it. •_Not overly saucy but just enough juice to make the dry chicken better. •_I do love the taste of fries (the potato-ness) with my burrito...the mushiness of the missing bean texture. •_They have this sauce, which im assuming is the habanero sauce....its SOOOO good with the burrito and the heat builds and burns but its so good!i miss the sauce already =(

I'd first like to point out the service was fantastic. Friendly and accommodating service. I hate to say it (and it seems like a lot of people would disagree), but the food just wasn't that great. Bland menu and mediocre food. Interior left a lot to be desired.

I usually pass this place because of the wait but luckily i had friends already seated. •_Loved the Jewish-style Artichoke and the ginger ale (fresh). REALLY loved the drinks though. •_I'm curious to come by and check out more of the menu...

LOL I CAN'T BELIEVE IT TOOK ME SO LONG TO WRITE A REVIEW ABOUT THIS PLACE.I'm so done.Here's my story: Back in December, I was getting dinner with a friend here. I got here before my friend did. They seated me in this awkward-ass nook like right behind the check-in counter/host stand or whatever when there is plenty of seating in the center of the restaurant. I'm like lmao ok, that's cool. It's just a seat. (I honestly was just like 'lol', because my friend couldn't find me after she came in, even after I was calling her name. The nook is *that* awkward.) I got the Crispy Egg Noodles with Chicken because a lot of the things on the menu were overpriced for me, but this is also San Francisco, so okay whatever it's fine. The food came. It was ok, nothing special. Chinese food re-styled for mainstream American tastes. Same old, same old. (I honestly enjoyed it still, I'm Panda Express Fan #1 lmao)But here's the kicker. I didn't finish my food. There was just a bit left; not enough for a whole meal, but idk, I paid money for this, so I wanted to take it home. And so the manager or whoever in charge comes over and gives my friend a box, because she had a significantly larger portion left than I did, and didn't give me one. At this point, it's okay I mean - fair assumption that I wouldn't want it.But I wanted it, so I ask for a box. And this lady hella gives me this hella judgmental look and seems super reluctant to give me a box but I insist I want one and she brings one over.And so I'm honestly like WHAT. Are ur boxes made of freaking Tang Dynasty gold? Idgaf if I had one freaking noodle left, I paid for this and if I wanna take it home, I don't deserve dirty looks from you of ANY SORT. Unless your boxes are made of Tang Dynasty gold, which ok. BUT THEY'RE NOT THEY'RE JUST YOUR REGULAR FREAKING CHINESE TAKE OUT BOXES. Bye. Tired of people that judge others for wanting to eat everything they pay for. Tired of people that judge others for not wanting to let good food go to the dumpster over the cost of a freaking Chinese takeout box, or over the effort and labor needed to walk over and pick up a freaking LIGHT AS AIR empty box.Jesus. Get off your high horse plz thank u.

CASH ONLY. •_Yamo is a tiny restaurant in the Mission where you can get Burmese food pretty quick. •_They only have a counter for maybe 8-10 people. •_I got the stool by the door, but kept hitting my knee on something on the bottom of the counter.I got the House Noodle $6. •_It's just a big bowl of noodles with choice of meat

I was recently put in charge of coordinating my office's holiday party, and I'm so happy I picked Original Joe's as our venue!I contacted about 30 restaurants in the financial district / North Beach areas of town asking how our budget would work in their space. •_Original Joe's was one of only three venues that would work within our budget. •_I ultimately picked them based on a feeling that it would be a fun atmosphere with yummy Italian food that pretty much anyone would enjoy.I got a lot of compliments from my coworkers, saying that I picked the perfect spot! •_The place was all dressed up for the season, very classy and festive. •_We got a separate space in the front of the restaurant that they set up with space for a standing happy hour, and then served us a three course family-style dinner.The staff was lovely. •_From the start, the events manager Mark Lehman was fantastic, always responsive and helpful on the phone or via email, booking us, helping me understand the menu choices, and making personal contact when we showed up the night-of. •_The son of the family that owns the restaurant also made a point to come over and thank us for choosing their restaurant, which was a great personal touch.Roberto, the lead waiter in charge of our group, was great about communicating with me all night regarding the timing of the food and whether or not he could bring a few more carafes of wine (the answer was yes!)The food was also great!! •_We had caesar salad, broiled chicken and potatoes, mixed veggies, vegetarian risotto (which I personally had seconds AND thirds of), and a decadent dessert selection.Overall, great! •_Fun, classic Italian joint with lovely staff that made me feel very wanted as a client and comfortable as a guest.

It's pretty tough to find decent, non-touristy food in Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf, so I always dread it when an out-of-town visitor makes the request to eat near either of these areas. I ended up coming to Scala's this past week with my girlfriend and her uncle and it wasn't bad at all. We ordered bruschetta to start and they happily complied to our request to put the duck prosciutto on the side. The bruschetta was pretty tasty, but the bread was a bit too thin for the amount of topping. My girlfriend ordered the ravioli with lemon cream sauce and I order the gnocchi. Again, both of them were pretty good, but nothing outstanding. The service was friendly and accommodating, but the food was just average.

Nice hip ambience with good thin crust pizza and appetizers like the cauliflower. We came here for lunch and was fairly busy. Pizza I would say was good but not awesome hence the 4 star. Want to try the PA location next...
exican Kitchen|
im Sum Restaurant|

Sure it's cheap. •_actually quite cheap. •_but i wouldn't necessarily say the beef stew in soup noodles (ngow lam mein) was all that wonderful nor worth driving from northbeach to eat here. •_Frankly, if i was hungering for some wonton mein, I'd venture further down the street to Ming Tai.However, they have rice noodle rolls in plum and soy sauce (jyu cheung fun).overall it was "just OK".
The sangria
It's not often that the service at a restaurant is so bad it's worth a reveuw, but Fang is it. Rude, slow, surly.
ar|
Ordered 3 pizzas for take out •_and all of them very good. •_Our favorites in order:1) Heirloom Tomatoes w/ bacon, arugula, basil

The food was overall amazing except for the fact that my dad left his backpack there with valuables in it, they were nice enough to hold it for a day until we were able to pick it up but when my dad's friend went to go get it, they took $400 dollars out of the backpack but left everything else in it. Just for that I don't think that I will be coming back here.

We tried the pasta tasting, and it was a lot of pasta - woo! •_6-7 dishes that were pretty good sized, not huge, but good-sized for our table of two. •_Flour + Water really knows their pasta as it was done well, cooked well and just tender and slightly chewy enough. •_I really liked the first dish with halibut and vegetables as it was light and healthy and the dish with lightly fried kale as it was tasty and just salty enough. •_Many of the pasta dishes was with a brown butter sauce so they started to taste alike a little and it was sort of blur after awhile as I was becoming more and more full. •_I thought they would have different sauces, some red, some creamy, some pesto, I don't know what I was expecting, but I thought there would be a little more variety. •_I didn't like the one with giblets as it was a little too gamey for me, plus I was really full at this point. •_That many pasta dishes was a lot for my tummy.I really liked the panna cotta dessert though - that was a hit! •_There is always room for dessert somehow, hah?The service was great, attentive and friendly. •_We had plenty of time to catch up and were not rushed at all. •_Definitely make a reservation (we made ours 2 months in advance because we wanted a decent time) because the crowd waiting for the communal table and bar seating took over the whole front of the restaurant. •_Craziness! •_I don't know how they deal with that night after night. •_Seriously though, there has to be a more efficient way. •_Yes, you want to create a "demand" for your restaurant and food, but it was sort of ridiculous seeing that there were a number of empty tables around us when we left.It was good, but I don't know if I'd be rushing back.

We had my sister's birthday here last Sunday, April 24th at 5:30pm as my other sister wanted an early dinner.The experience from when I called to make a reservation about 1 week out, was awesome. Even though I called during dinner time, Silvio answered and he could not have been nicer. You could hear how busy it was in the background but I never felt rushed.When we arrived at the restaurant there were only a few people there - granted they open at 5pm and we were there at 5:30, so we had a little extra attention which was awesome. The whole family works there and the interaction among them is exhilarating and entertaining.We sat on the 1st floor (i did not realize there was a 2nd floor probably because we were focused on getting to our table with the balloons and gifts.There were 6 of us and we each ordered something different. Silvio was our waiter and he was so wonderful at talking through each one and even gave a little history about the dishes which the restaurant is known for.All I know is that i am glad we did not fill up on the bread (which was great) because the food was absolutely delicious. I had the Paccheri Ripieni which was incredible. The sauce was amazing.Someone else had the Mezzi Rigatoni alla Norcina - again, awesome.Others had the pork dish which they raved about.The dinners were excellent.For dessert we had a few different items and each one was wonderful from the Cannolos to the Tartufo al Cioccolato and then to top it off, they brought a dessert with a candle and sang happy birthday - the night was amazing - the staff - amazing and the whole experience was absolutely worth it. Even one of the couples who live in North Beach had not been and they said, as did the rest of us, we will be back - absolutely.I highly recommend it and I hope your experience is as perfect as ours was. ENJOY!!!

Very solid dumplings, on din tai fung's level. Short, easy menu. Good pricing. Come here 30 minutes before you plan to actually eat, given the wait time. Try to ignore the waiters, who seem to try and rush you out the door. Will be back!

I was suggested this place solely for happy hour and it turned out to be a pretty cool place. Went on a Friday afternoon and this place is packed. If you want to grab a table I would suggest getting there before 5 pm. Me and my friends found a table not too long after. Since it was busy servers are pretty busy. You really want a table if you are gonna order food. If not there is a jar you can grab a drink and sit at the patio. Food: 4/5 I can't say it's amazing but it does have a pretty good happy hour menu. I got the eight spice fried eggplant and the calamari. •_the seasoning is on point. Drinks: happy hour ranges from 5/beer-12/8 cocktail-wine. So pricing isn't bad all. I really like this place for the view. If you have visitors in town and want to go to happy I would go here! •_You see the Ferry Building!! It makes the atmosphere even better.

I went on dollar margarita night, asked for a straw for my dollar margarita and was given one. Then an employee came up behind my friend and I and grabbed our straws out of our glasses and said no straws with $1 margs. •_Completely inappropriate for an employee to grab a straw out of a drink, not to mention he was rude as hell. Will not be coming back.

What is it with the inconsistency of Chinese food delivery in this town? •_I've had decent food from JTH before, but have been experimenting with others in search of the divine. •_The high ratings of fellow yelpers enticed me to call them again. •_Ugh. •_The kung pao shrimp was bland, no spice, veggies too soft. •_The potstickers were doughy devoid of flavor. •_Veggie fried rice? •_Yeah, it was fine for being free... •_and don't get me started on the spareribs, I threw them away. •_I'm a sad, sad yelper today.
talian Restaurant|

Yay for cheap Mexican food in the Richmond! I like the gordo plates and the quesadillas (fully loaded!). It definitely falls into the category of White People Mexican food but it's convenient, open late, and they never disappoint. If you like it muy caliente make sure you get EXTRA hot sauce as theirs is really mild.

Recently came here again, and I was sad to find that the oxtail entree was no longer there. We ordered the Linguine with Clams and the Whole Fish Acqua Pazza.The Linguine with Clams was not what I thought it'd be. I was hoping for more garlic and white wine, but their sauce was a little too sour. It also had this bitter pepper flavor that I didn't like. I normally love Linguine and Clams, but this one was not my favorite.The Whole Fish that night was cod, and it was cooked pretty well. The fish was soft and tender, but it could've used some more seasoning. There was a light tomato based broth that had an herby highlight from oregano. Although the broth was pretty tasty, it would've been better if the fish had more salt or something. With some more seasoning, the fish would've paired better with the broth.
Simply the best. Home to the first papusas I ever tried and still the standard by which all other papuserias are judged.
1. Large portions2. Great salsa bar

These are without question the best baos we've ever had. We're in town visiting and saw The Chairman listed on Yelp, and we're so glad we tried it. We had the coca-cola braised pork and braised beef, and we also tried the spicy chicken and pork belly. All delicious. The braised pork was our favorite. We will definitely be back here!

I was so excited to try this place! It was alright. I had been told to get he cactus enchiladas. Meh. No flavor and no cheese! I guess j am just used to a cheesier enchilada. Good option for a veggie, but just not my thing. Was missing something. The queso was pretty gross, we sent it back. Everyone else's meals were really good. The shrimp enchiladas pretty good. Just would prefer more cheese next time! :)THe service was amazing though!
inetti|

This is one of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to! When it comes to Italian cooking, it's not about haute cuisine and tiny portions; it's about a family atmosphere and homemade goodness, and this place has it all. This is the first time in a long time that I've gone to a restaurant that is truly family owned and operated, and what a lovely family they are! They were very kind and hospitable. I had the linguini pescatore and it was phenomenal! The seafood was fresh, the pasta was homemade, and the sauce was so flavourful that I wanted to lick the plate! My partner had the meat lasagna and it was layer after layer of homemade pasta and thick, meaty tomato sauce. Definitely visit this place when you're in San Francisco!
New spot for dim sum really fresh yummy •_.wow surf clams •_so fresh
New spot for dim sum really fresh yummy •_.wow surf clams •_so fresh

Omgg. Ok. This was my first experience and all I have to say is WOW. I ordered one Pescado taco and one Grilled Fish Taco. My hunt for the perfect fish taco is complete! Flavors were great! I asked for the salsa on the side and was glad I did! I had to walk back to work so it would've left my tacos soggy lol and I must say for being Mexican I'm not a salsa girl BUT this red salsa was YUMMM! Can't wait to try these Nick's Way next!^_^ •_The interior was immaculate! Tho I didn't get to sit and eat it looked very clean! The decor was FABULOUS! Red and chandeliers?? Yess please! Tacos in a FABULOUS setting? CHECK!:)

ate here tonight and was happy with the great prices and decent food. •_you definitely have to try the onion pancakes. •_i can make this a taiwanese girl's regular outing from now on. •_and i got great, fast, efficient service.
exican Kitchen|

I've never had Burmese food before even though I am an Asian. It's a great, cheap way of enjoying Asian food. The sauce is just right and the way how the scallions and the meat are cooked and mixed is just perfect.

One of the BEST restaurants I've ever been to. •_The ambiance is incredible, the food is to die for (authentic New Mexico with an SF twist), and the staff are all super sweet and accommodating. There is a tiny wait, but it's well worth it!You have to try the sopaipilla and cajeta ice cream!!!!!!!

***Review strictly for the margaritas and the bartender***We had just come from Tommy's after a round. •_Promptly seated at the bar. •_Fresh chips and spicy salsa glided in front of us.A single blended and a double on the rocks was ordered. •_And they were delicious and refreshing, and definitely gives you a good buzz.The bartender is THE nicest guy. •_But I think he concocted a back story of me and my friend in his head (that we were married and left the kids at home to sneak out for a drink). •_So we played along.
im Sum Restaurant|

Two reviews in a day is little too much but here I go..To start our experience was phenomenal. •_My friend is from out of town and stayed at the Scarlet Huntington not far walk from the restaurant. •_He called to see if he can get a reservation last minute and was able to talk to Alex the owner. •_Alex was so sweet, he made it work. •_Needless to say, where service is concerned, it is definitely a 5. •_Our waitress was very knowledgeable of the her menu and knew exactly what all the items tasted like. •_Bravo to the training crew!Seven Hills is influenced primarily by Alex's Italian grand mother with a primary item of homemade pasta. •_We started off with couple of prosecos followed by a bottle of Nebbiolo. •_We decided to do family style and chose several items off the menu to share. •_Started of with a seared foie gras with grilled strawberries. •_Mmm. •_The foie gras was about 3 ounces and very beautifully seared sitting on a toasted bread. •_Only complain on this is the bread was slightly too thick. •_We then moved to a salad with fried prosciutto. •_Salad I would say is sub par. •_Color of the sugar snaps, radish, and prosciutto was so beautiful in itself, the heavy buttermilk base dressing was overwhelming and not attractive. •_We would've like it a little more light dressing to show case the beautiful color and the natural taste of the veggies. •_Our next dish was a grilled octopus tentacle. •_Nicely grilled and very tender. •_Nothing special but very tasty. •_The last dish we had was my favorite. •_It was ink squid pasta with shrimp. •_The pasta was perfectly al dente and shrimp was not over cooked. •_And we all know no matter how good the shrimp is, over cooking will kill it. •_We finished our dinner with a nice dessert wine.The ambience was ok. •_Casual vibe and casual. •_Slightly noisier than I anticipated but was ok. •_Parking, not sure because we use uber where you can. •_Lol.Overall, the food is good 4. •_Service was great at 5. •_Alex was around walking but did not make his way to all the tables. •_It would've been nice to chat briefly with him. •_Perhaps next time. •_Definitely worth your time and I can not wait to try other items on the menu.Until next time Bon appetite and ciao!

You will be like.. why there are still so many people at 10pm! Just pick any pasta and pizza... and you won't regret ..The wines choices are decent and some of them are from Italy too... with DOC or DOCG ~
Best pizza ever!!!!!!! We got the deep dish and also wings and it was incredible. You MUST try!
One of my favorite meals on vacation in SF, great burritos and margaritas. Reasonable and friendly waiters.

My girlfriend and I got pizza togo from here a couple of weeks ago and it wasn't as good as I was expecting.We ordered a medium pepperoni, and they told us about 15min. When we arrived there was a big line which is always a good sign, so we payed for our pizza and took it back home. By the time that we began eating the pizza the dough had become tough and chewy. The sauce and the toppings were delicious, but the crust was very unenjoyable.I think that if we would have sat down and eaten the pizza there it would have been a lot better, so I am going to give it a second chance but getting it togo wasn't the way to go.
Hands down the best pizza I've ever had. The service is great too. You might have to wait a little bit to get seated but that's okay, totally worth it in the end. Best Chicago deep dish.

I was taking a nice stroll outside on a sunny Friday afternoon prior to Labor Day weekend when I noticed that there was barely a line at HRD, so of course I just had to try it though I wasn't planning on grabbing lunch! Every time I pass by HRD during a workday lunch hour, there is a fairly long line going out the door. It's quite a popular spot with its interesting Mexican Asian fusion dishes.I decided to try out their bulgogi beef kimchi burrito which caught my attention due to kiwi being one of its ingredients. The kiwi surprisingly went very well with the burrito. It added some sweetness to it whereas the daikon and kimchi gave it a sour taste. The result was a wonderful sweet and sour flavor that blended well with the marinated beef. After a while, I did feel that the burrito started falling into the diminishing returns factor, but I did enjoy it overall.

A few friends and I decided to have a chili cook-off on Super Bowl Sunday this year. •_While my friends were buying Safeway Select ground turkey for their comical attempts at chili, I dropped by La Palma to pick up some fresh chorizo and some dried ancho chiles for my famous Spicy Lamb

Great place for a late night burrito after a night out in the mission, no frills. •_You go in, tell them what you want, get a receipt, and then pay at the register. •_I had the carne asada burrito. •_It was the perfect fix after a night out, seasoned and not soggy. The guacamole seemed diluted and had tomatoes in it.The salsa bar looked less than desirable, so I skipped that. The bathroom was a hot mess, but with the volume and crazy people coming in on a Saturday night, it's par for the course.

Excellent gem that is extremely easy to miss, but a great place to get some quick eats after happy hour. Mabo tofu noodles, diced chicken, and the WINGS were definitely highlights. Our server was extremely nice and attentive, even though we came in right before last call, and she even made an accurate assessment that we'd be needing more food when we each ordered four dishes for four hungry guys. Once we had our orders in, she was quick to keep us topped off with water and tea.The food itself was delicious, with well-balanced flavors and an excellent variety of tastes and textures. I am coming back here soon for the diced chicken and wings though - small wonder that they were the absolute favorites in our group.
One of the cute tiny shops on the Dog Patch area of SF. Good strong coffee. I'll def come back when I am in the area.

Wild Pepper aka GOD'S ANSWER TO CHINESE TAKEOUT If you gave this place a rating of anything less than 5 stars I suggest you see a doctor for your malfunctioning taste buds. •_I've ordered from this place via Seamless countless times and have nearly fallen to my death all those times scurrying down the stairs to get the damn order. •_Their Avocado Egg Rolls, damn........at first thought I had some nerve to smack a fool who would put avocados in egg rolls, cuz that shit just did not fly in my book. •_But adventure lead to gold cuz those things are FUCKING MAGICAL. •_The creamy texture of the avocado with the crispy rice paper just melded the lightly salted vegetables into a medley of FUCK YEA. •_Order their Chow Mein with egg noodles and you'll be smacking your lips at the flavor so hard you'll put Blistex outta business. •_Their Orange Chicken though.......you mean FUCKTACULAR on a plate! •_No over breading like some other shitty places (*cough* Andy's Chinese Cuisine) but it's as if each hearty piece of chicken meat is pillowed around crispy batter and covered in a sweet/spicy/savory orange sauce -of which should not be bottled and sold on the shelves as to not cause riots at grocery stores.Wild Pepper...I give you 5 stars and the highest of fives *HIGH FIVE*

Solid Chinese hole in the wall place at the outer edge of Chinatown. Had the Kung Pao Chicken, and my companion had the chicken with cashews. Both dishes were great, but I would give the edge to chicken and cashews. The fried dumplings were also delicious. I would definitely come here again.

Seven Hills is a quality neighborhood trattoria that remains popular and continues to deliver even after a change in ownership several years ago. While nothing about this intimate venue is ostentatious, that's because it's all about substance as opposed to style, whether in the cozy, rustic interior that lends itself to intimate meals, or in the relatively understated cooking that intentionally highlights the quality and freshness of the underlying ingredients. Indeed, quality and freshness pops up throughout the menu. For example, this restaurant is one of only about a dozen in the Bay Area that serves delicious, super-fresh buffalo mozzarella from Ramini Farms in Tomales, a small, family-run operation that's worth visiting on its own. The tomato braised polpette (fontina-stuffed beef and pork meatballs) was satisfyingly delicious, and helped prime the appetite for equally satisfying entrees like the pappardelle, maccheroncelli, and the day's fresh fish catch. Of course, I had to go for the chocolate budino to finish things off, and it didn't disappoint.Service is warm and engaging, and Alex, the manager, was also super patient and obliging with multiple changes of plans that I had. While Seven Hills might not draw a whole lot of buzz in the Bay Area dining scene, the throngs of loyal customers that pack this place on most nights testify to the fact that an intimate, personalized, no-nonsense dining experience can be just as satisfying as, say, a dozen-course molecular tasting menu at some place that's ridiculously ostentatious. Totally worth the 5 stars here on Yelp.

I have been a fan since the opening of cotogna and often have brought friends and family to eat here over the years, but I am sad to say the food has really gone downhill....really tasteless watery pasta, overdone pizzas, and fishy octopus (used to be my favorite dish here)....It is no longer worth my time and money. •_I went back 3 times just to make sure and it was confirmed....no longer good : (

*Note: This place is cash only.*This is a great hole in the wall spot that is worth going out of your way to try. As many others have said, the Tea Leaf Salad is incredible. Fermented tea leaves, cabbage, fried beans, nuts and other ingredients give an incredible flavor for this $6 dish you could easily pay 2-3 times for in a fine dining establishment and be happy with. The garlic noodles were great and every other dish I saw looked amazing as well. I don't think anything is more than $6. What a deal!Please note you're coming here for the food, not the ambiance or the service (although both should meet the functional needs for most). Personally I'm all about the food and value so if you share those focuses, this place is for you.

Whenever I'm in SF or San Mateo, I hit up La Cumbre for the best burritos ever. •_I grew up on these burros and there's nothing better. I've had a ton of other burros from all over and nothing compares to the original. •_I don't understand the poor reviews. •_Perhaps people were too drunk (based on their descriptions of drinking, late at night, etc) to taste the goodness that is the La Cumbre experience. •_Viva La Cumbre!
Cafe|

Amazing schezuan food. The owners are always present with a big smile to make you feel welcome. Great beer selection which you never find at these places. It gets packed so go early. They do an amazing job getting large groups seated. Just go.

one of my favorite restaurants of all time!!! the food is great, beer is great, decor is cool, love this place! i really enjoy their pulled pork, fried chicken, french fries, zapatos, and fish tacos. cash only!! sometimes the lines are crazy, but wait it out your belly will be so happy.
I came here a long time ago, and I never went back. The service was fast without hardly a word spoken, and the food was ok, nothing unique about it.

This place deserves an "Emmy" ! My god this was one of the most DELICIOUS Chinese restaurants that Ive had in recent memory. For 50 bucks you get can 4 items with a large free bowl of soup. Everything was so tasty, the combination fried rice, the Kung Pao chicken , pot stickers and the brisket clay pot. What made the Kung Pao chicken so great was it was 90% chicken and not a bunch a veggies with a few minuscule pieces of chicken, this was LOADED with meat, in fact the portions for everything were huge and right up my alley. Great friendly service and people. This was a great find ! I cant speak for their delivery service but eating inside their place, the food was fresh hot and my stomach was singing happy songs !! Highly recommended !

Best cheap dim sum I've encountered! Order with paper menu and hand to a lady behind the counter. Large portions. Could be hotter and fresher but then it wouldn't be so fast and affordable. Rice porridge with Chinese donut recommended!

Order the fish in chili sauce then take the leftover sauce home and use it for two meals at home. It's WONDERFUL. Try to go when it's half empty or it's too noisy to talk. Decibels when full: 80. Love the fact that I can get both delicious Chinese food and good coffee at the same place.

We chose this place because I wanted vegetarian options and the Mr. wanted brussel spouts. We both had scrumptious cocktails. I started with an endive strawberry salad and a delicious cheese something. Both were seasoned well and were pretty much perfect. The Mr. Started with an asparagus lemon ravioli. Ummm.. Fantastic! The Mr. thought it was too buttery - but how can that be a complaint? He are every bite. As mains, the Mr. had scallops (which he thought were cooked well) and I had a very rich blu cheese pasta. Yumyum! Well worth the $160 overall.

This has got to be one of the cleanest and delicious burrito spots in the mission.I stumbled upon this place.It's an open kitchen so you get to see how they prep the food.People who works there actually wears a proper apron and seem to care how the food is presented. (Even though it's a 9 dollar burrito)The steak snd shrimp burrito was amazing! I loveeeed it.Will definitely come back again!

This was pretty darn good for being a burrito place that I stummbled upon while running an errand in the richmond. •_I had a chicken burrito which they made right in front of me, the flavor was great but I wish they would have made it with a little more care so it didn't fall apart when I ate it but besides that I can't complain.

My favorite place to bring visitors in from out of town. •_Gracias Madre offers fresh delicious food guaranteed to make you consider joining the vegan train. •_Always leave with a full belly and smile on my face.

OH MANNNNN! My fiance and I are obsessed with this place. Do yourself a solid and get the Mongolian Beef, or anything slathered in their awesome black bean sauce. The lady that works here (Nancy) is an absolute darling. She's 100% of the time stressed out as she's usually the only one waiting all the tables and answering the phone (which goes off every 2 minutes), but the wait is always worth it. This place is a staple for us. We get it at least once a week and every time Nancy makes us so happy. :) Thanks so much Wok Shop Cafe!

Great looking place. Amazing atmosphere, amazing food.HOWEVER, horrible attitude from a man name Eldon.A couple friends and I had the back room prepped for us. It was our friend's birthday and it wasn't his first time; he assured to us that the food at nopalito was amazing since it was everyone else's first time... and he was right, the food was great! However, we also all agreed that the server was just rude RIGHT off the bat. Eldon did not ask how we were doing as he approached us. He also sounded just plain ANNOYED when he asked us if we were having drinks, although we were a bit indecisive, it does not mean to RUSH us. We all just chose water instead of us ordering drinks right there and then. When we asked Eldon about the types of food, or if Nopalito has empanadas, or how the food ordering works at Nopalito (because obviously it was our first time) he responded a sharp "uh yeah, it's right there ON the menu", Repeatedly "yeah, it's ON the menu", as if we're not looking at the menu, we're just curious! He also cut my friend off while he was asking a question about substituting meat, but the server cut him off saying "NO, you can't do custom foods, not going to happen."He also made a disturbing comment towards the end of the night. It started with him stating how we should download venmo in order to make our lives easier upon splitting the check. Our table let him know a fact about venmo, saying that it usually takes three days to process (because really, we just want to pay right there to make everyone's life easier). He answered "you guys can't wait three days?", and our response, "no we can't, we just want to pay it now". Then he had the NERVE TO SAY TO US, "sounds like you guys need another job". Excuse me? Just because we rather not use a phone app? We all received our degrees, we work 9-5 jobs, Monday to Friday, working hard, and just want to have a good time celebrating our friend's birthday ON A SATURDAY NIGHT. But we felt so uncomfortable when the waiter had the nerve to tell us we need another job just because we're figuring out payment. Plain rude. You don't know what our occupation is, so who are you to comment about our jobs?Hence why I'm providing four stars. Just for his specific service. Good place, but don't want to see the server's face. We wished the ladies came around more- just smiling at us and asking if everything was okay. But Eldon REALLY pissed us off last night. Yeah, we're young, want to have fun- but does not mean that you can talk down to us. Oh, and he didn't tell us his name- it's on our receipt.Don't think we'll come back. Good place. But don't think we will.
Woah. Greasy huge California burritos done right: with French fries! Get your best bite for low bucks. Andele!

I went there for the first time on Sunday and only had the salame, peppers and artichoke pizza and then some ice cream. •_The pizza was very tasty, and the ice cream was good, but I'm spoiled by bi-rite, so I wasn't impressed. •_The service was just ok. •_It's nice that they have a decent amount of outdoor seating, so that was pleasant. •_I'd go again, but there's other places I'd rather go.
I've only ordered delivery. •_The fact that I can even get Chinese food of this caliber delivered to my door is a great thing in of itself. •_Between the chef

really hope this place keeps doing what they're doing because so far i love it!ate here last night and was really impressed by the friendly staff and delicious food... the kind of chinese food they make here is my favorite (that and dim sum)!ordered:- hand pulled noodles with lamb -better- pork dumpling -good- sesame pancake with beef -best... pancakes are almost like phyllo dough filled with beef and scallionsi believe the restaurant is cash only, and seating is VERY limited. there were lots of chinese people enjoying the food (always a good sign), and you could watch the cooks hand pull the noodles in the back.
This place is very small, the the service is quick and good. The food is tasty and fresh. Not to mention the cost of the entire meal for a party of 6 was purr of this world. Very inexpensive.
Food was great! Service was quick and servers were very friendly. I recommend the green tea snow ice for dessert!

We did not like the food here and my whole family thought they are pricey. The vegetable were not prepared very well and I felt sick after. I had cramps and felt like I had stomach flu. ( not kidding nor exaggerating at all ) None of my family finished the rice bowl, the kids didn't like the taste either. The chips were stale, and the burrito my brother had was very cold. I would never return. It was a huge dissapointment after a long walk from Union Square. It was a waste of money in my opinion. Go try them for yourself.

I had the Mexican food shakes the other week. What are the Mexican food shakes? Well, similar to a drug addict detoxing, when I don't get enough Mexican food in my system, I start to feel off, weak, and out of sorts. Usually this need can be satisfied by basic taqueria food, but every once in a while, my body cries out for something more substantial -- namely a sit down Mexican restaurant. Now I'll admit it... I'm a Mexican food snob and I have not been very impressed by the sit down offerings available to me in San Francisco. So when everyone raved about Tommy's I got my hopes up. Unfortunately, this place did not live up to the hype.Okay, to first focus on the good. The margaritas are good. Strong, not sweet, and delicious. I also enjoyed my chips and salsa. The not so good -- the food was just okay, not bad or anything, but nothing unusual for a sit down place in San Francisco. Also, our service was pretty bad on our first visit. It took them 15 minutes to bring us menus, and another 15 to take our order. •_30 minutes of just sitting there without chips, water, or drinks was a little frustrating (and it wasn't even that busy... the place was maybe 1/3 full). Since then, service has been about average -- not all that attentive, but not nearly as bad.Basically, this is a decent enough place to go when I get the Mexican food shakes, but it definitely makes me miss the food down in Southern California.

I am an out of town visitor and wanted a great plate of pasta while in SFO. •_ this place definitely delivered. •_we ordered two plates of handmade fresh pasta - one was manicotti and the other fettuccine - and they were happy to take special orders and divert from the menu. the husband and wife owners were a total delight and they even refilled our wine at no charge! •_pistachio gelato was fantastic too. if I lived here I would be a regular at this place. they have been at this location 25 years - that's saying something. •_if you are looking for a small authentic pasta joint, look no further.

Came here on a Tuesday night for a date :)Make sure to make reservations even if it's a weekday!Server we had was so friendly and personable. She really added a nice touch to my dining experience. •_Answered questions, gave personal opinion and was quick.We ordered:-cauliflower : a cold salad. very very yummy. appetizing for sure - lemony, capers, the perfect bite. not overly cooked/mushy. huge portion!-mushroom pizza : my favorite for the night!! a great amount of mushrooms on pizza. chili flakes / chili oil complimented this pizza wonderfully. yum yum-stuffed pasta shell with ricotta : ricotta was divine. pasta shell was cooked perfectly. tomato sauce was very flavorful. 4 huge shells. don't be fooled - it's filling!!!wine: Riesling - they had a great one here and the pour is GENEROUS at Uva Enoteca. I definitely walked out smiley and rosey cheeked ;) •_Will come back! Can't wait to try other things on this menu. A nice spot in this neighborhood/Lower Haight!!
Great food, nice service

Came in today craving a baked pasta dish. Ordered the baked tortellini with mozzarella and parm. Super happy with the bread for the table but the side salad was mediocre. The kidney beans, olives and garbanzos tasted old.. Like their can had been opened last week and not well refrigerated. Meanwhile, I made the mistake of not asking if the tortellini was vegetarian. I assumed that since every other dish in the Al Forno section distinguished between vegetarian and meat..and this didn't say meat, that I was safe. Anyways, tortellini came and I ate a few, thought the filling was a little strange but wrote it off as a bread crumb and cheese filler like some cheaper brands of tortellini. Then I noticed the TEENY chunks of ground beef in the sauce. When I brought this to the servers attention she acted like I should have known it had meat. I pointed out that the menu didn't specify meat sauce (unlike every other item) and she dismissed it.Now I'm super sick. Won't go back anytime soon :(
just as good as the infamous taquerias in the mission. •_a tasty place to get your mexican fix in the richmond.

Great experience here. I sat at the bar, got great food recommendations from the bartenders and enjoyed a great glass of wine. The meal pacing was really great and the food very solid. I started with the warm house-made ricotta (a dish certainly designed for sharing that I no doubt demolished on my own) and had a fresh pasta dish for my main. I was worried the ricotta + pasta would be a heavy combo, but the pasta was delectably light and fresh. If there was a low-light of the meal, it was dessert (chocolate mousse) - which was still good, just not knock-your-socks-off. A great option worth the investment. Good atmosphere. Nice vibe. Very approachable. Solid food. Definitely worth a visit.
