I'd say it's comparable to Chipotle. Then again, some people love Chipotle. But if you want a real good burrito, go to the Mission. You won't be disappointed, that's forsure.

I had the carne asada (steak) burrito and my friend had the pollo (chicken) burrito. They were both fantastic. The rice is extremely flavorful, the meat juicy and delicious, and the beans and sauces combine to create what is probably the best burrito I've ever had (and yes, I've been to La Taqueria). This is now definitely my go to burrito place in SF. The burritos are better than those at La Taqueria, and there is almost no line. All in all you'll have your food in 5 or so minutes. Fantastic place.

Came here on Valentines day and was not disappointed at all. When I think Mexican food, I think heavy and fattening, but this place challenged that stereotype, because we left feeling satisfied enough to where we were full but not in a negative "want to sleep" way. For our starter we had Corn that was DELICIOUS! I don't know how they seemed to make eating corn on the cob fancy but they nailed it. For dinner i had the chicken burrito and a bit of my friends shrimp taco, both which were mouth watering. The mango sauce with my burrito paired very well and it was decent sized and filling. I defiantly will be coming back when I am in the area to try there other items. It's really hard to find a place where the service is good, the food is clean, not heavy but filling and this place is one of them!
Love this place, the best pizza in SF. The Four Cheese pizza with marinara was Delicious, The The Yukon Gold Potato was OK it was a bit too salty.

I'm not really big on sandwiches in general, but this place is quite delicious. •_I'm not sure what's in Lou's secret sauce, but it's sooo good! •_Ordered the Pesto Chicken Sandwich sans pickles and brought it on a hike with me. •_It was still good an hour later. •_It was the perfect amount of bread, meat, veggies and sauce. •_I want to come back to try the other things on their menu!Came at 2pm and waited in line for a good 40 minutes to order and get our food, but it was worth it! •_Next time, I'll just place my order in advance!

Yes... I may be just one of the 1000+ reviews here for Little Star Pizza, but I do hope that my review will have some sort of weigh to it as I purposely seeked out "The Best" pizza joint in SF and I live down here in the nice

This place is really cool, it has the prettiest Christmas lights set up hanging from the ceiling. We got the Lunch special Giorgio Special pizza by the slice and the chicken sundried tomato pasta and shared. They have about 7 beers on draft, we got Peronis which were $6. Overall everything was really good, my favorite was the pizza!!

As a consumer of Victor's Pizza for years (I used to live a five minute walk away), I can confidently say that their cheese pizza is the shizzle!Simple, sprinkled with fresh italian parsley and hot upon delivery.I love that they will still deliver to me out by USF in 20 minutes (25 max)!

My aunt and I used to order lunch to-go here at least once a week! At one point, the lady taking the orders recognized my voice and knew to give me extra hot sauce automatically! We love their duck leg noodle(with the twisty egg noodle) and beef noodles(with the flat rice noodles)! The duck leg is always meaty and flavorful and the beef from the beef noodles is always tender and the broth is delicious! I would recommend taking it to-go since it is always packed during lunch time!!
If you really like Mexican food, don't go here. •_Food isn't flavorful and you pay too much for it. Everything Mexican food shouldn't be- bland and expensive.
exican Kitchen|

Since we had all ready parked our car, we didn't want to drive or Uber to Chinatown, I remember Yang Sing from 20 years ago, the original one located at 101 Spear. This one was the closest that we could walk to. We had a 20 minute wait during lunch hour, which isn't too bad. •_The price of dim sum is quite expensive, i.e. 2 crab claws was $14 a plate. Hey, we are on vacation. The food was filling and tasty, but if you were in Chinatown, you'd probably would get away with half the cost.When you order tea for yourself, they bring a big pot and charge everyone at the table. So, if you're the only one drinking tea, make sure you let the server know and then check the bill after.Since I'm a native San Franciscan, I'd probably go somewhere else for dim sum. But my wife and daughter hadn't been so I gave them a treat.

Had the basics: •_Sausage pizza (w/ fresh garlic - made the difference!) and spaghetti and meatballs. •_The pizza was divine and the spaghetti good, but not spectacular. •_(Went back a second time just for pizza!) •_Decent, but small, beer selection (wine also). •_Saw someone with a salad that looked very good as well. •_Service is adequate; albeit not super friendly. •_(They seem to be going more for "efficiency" than anything else.) •_The eating area is small, but I didn't feel it was as cramped as some other reviewers indicated. •_(Kind of a typical, smaller Italian venue...) •_Highly recommended for dinner OR lunch. •_(And they do a brisk takeout business, which tells me the locals love it too!)
Gross. Don't believe the yelp reviews. They must be fake because this is the worst Chinese I've had. Try MY China in the mall

One of my friends sang the praises of Garaje, so we made plans to meet up one day for lunch during the work week. There was a pretty long line at the counter, but we were able to snag a table pretty easily after ordering.The Cali Steak Zapato looked the most interesting to me - a pressed/grilled burrito filled with skirt steak asada, cheese, avocado, salsa, and fries. Unfortunately, the zapato was bland. •_Fortunately, it was really small, so I didn't get filled up on blandness! •_The highlight for me was the Pepsi in glass bottles, so at least there's that.

Okay, maybe I am becoming kinder with age but I do feel compelled to update my review.Yes, it's still dated inside.Yes, it's still located on the edge of Chinatown rather than the heart of North Beach.But damn, those pillowy gnocchi are divine! How do they get them so light and pillowy at the same time?! And the pesto - yummmmm!Ravioli were good and prawns in garlic butter were tasty too.Oh and I'm not supposed to be eating bread but...the two pieces I did have were well worth the cheat. So soft yet crusty!

The first time I ate here, I thought it was pretty great. The next two times: not so much.Stale chips in paper wrapper. Practically empty salsa station. Grungy tables and chairs outside. Bland ingredients. The sour cream in my carnitas burrito was maybe a teaspoon's worth and it was all in one spot on one end. Wack.

SPQR was on our list for some time and I thought I'd love it. I did really enjoy the chicken liver mousse and jam- would 100% eat that every day if I could get away with it. The tuna tartare was covered in sauce, I couldn't taste the light flavor of the fish in a dish I generally enjoy. I ate the corn ravioli and it's probably my fault for ordering incorrectly, but I didn't finish and drank a lot of water because it wasn't moist enough without it. I generally like the sweetness of corn but if that's what you're looking for, this was far more umami than sweet. The dessert was a passionfruit panna cotta that was way too sweet (ironic I know), it overpowered the delicate coconut cream and the caramel sauce on top. I did like my marshmallow at the end :) •_TL:DR •_If I go back, I'm ordering the mousse and getting different pasta.

Pros- HUGE burritos- Great fillings- Tortilla was nice and crispy- A lot of carne asadaCons - Cash only - Wasn't a fan of the communal seatingGreat burritos a couple blocks away from 16th+Mission Bart. They're cash only and the line wasn't that long around 6pm on Friday. Friend and I went here after checking out the Nate Silver Burrito Bracket, when Taqueria Cancun ousted El Farolito. But, imo, the carne asada burrito is not as good as El Farolito's. It comes down to the meat and this meat was less flavorful than El Farolito's.

Oh, El Farolito! Such a Bay Area staple! Who can resist coming here in the wee hours of the morning for some of them street tacos?! Well, I sure in the hell can't! Buuut I'm sorry to say... this location just ain't all that it's cracked up to be. Well, at least not anymore?! Maybe I came on a bad night but the last time that I was here, the tacos were just alright. Last time I was here, I was craving for some steak tacos. I got four of those bad boys because I was being greedy, but I literally could only finish two. One thing that isn't lacking here is portion size! They stuff their tacos to the max with meat and one taco is really more like two. The salsa here is BOMBSY! Their green salsa and pico de gallo are heaven! Chips and salsa are complimentary with your order and they have salsa bar where you can load up on that bomb ass salsa! Despite all of this, my experience was just meh. The workers looked exhausted and didn't seem like they wanted to really be there. The inside was pretty dirty with several tables that were cluttered with all kinds of trash and half eaten food. The chips were stale and the steak on my tacos this time around had minimal flavor. Even after dousing them in that good ol' salsa, something was still lacking for me. And don't let me even get started on that bathroom... yikes. With the kind of business that they get here, you would at least think that they would try to upkeep the cleanliness. Overall, it's a dependable source for late night eats, but I would probably just go to their main location next time if it's not a hassle to get there.

This was beyond my expectations. Burrata: Creamier than ones we've had elsewhere and fantastic!Focaccinis (mini focaccia buns)- So soft and delicious with a good amount of spice as a topping. For some reason, they reminded me of gougeres and I just wish they had filled the focaccinis with some cheese :)Artichoke salad: I'm not an artichoke fan, but it was seasoned just right and so tender. Entrees:Agnoletti: What flavor! Normally, I am used to pasta getting drenched with sauce that I can barely taste the filling. OMG, the filling was full of deliciously seasoned meat and I savored every bite. I had originally thought of it as an indulgent comfort food, but it became a mini party-in-my-mouth with every bite of agnoletti. The individual agnoletti were tiny, but packed a bunch of flavor! Fish: My hubby had this because he's on a low-carb diet and he said it was fantastic. It was cooked really nicely all in all, given that my hubby was on a low-carb diet, we thought that our limited options would decrease our/his enjoyment. Boy, were we wrong. This was a fantastic restaurant and I can't wait to go again!

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on our last night in San Francisco. I knew we were going to have a good time once we came in and 90's music was blasting in the background. Perfect for a fun date night! I would definitely recommend getting a reservation if you can because they seem to get very busy on weekends. We had the sashimi for an appetizer and it did not disappoint! Super fresh! My al pastor tacos were delicious as well, and the service was good. The only thing I'd suggest is that they try and get a bigger kitchen staff.. the wait for our tacos was longer than expected.

Amazingly a happening bar scene, quite a mix of people, locals, bar service is very friendly and professional, drinks are good and reasonable. •_I did checkout the food, had a wonderful friday evening dinner with my friends. •_The food was really good; I loved my sardine salad appetizer, served on a sort of toast. •_we also tried the artichoke dip, crab salad and the house soup. •_It was nevertheless a wonderful dining experience, the waitress was a very sweet and accommodating woman; attentive and super pleasant.

Good local joint that crushes the nearby competition (Ocean Taqueria). I usually go with the Carnitas Super Burrito and I haven't been disappointed. The staff isn't incredibly friendly, but good enough for me. This place is pretty authentic; just the right amount of dirty bomb without sentencing you to the toilet tomorrow. Open til 9pm!
Excellent food and great service. •_ The Beijing Duck and Pork dumplings are just amazing!

We found this place on yelp on our last day in San Francisco. We were looking for a quick bite to eat that would be closer in the direction of SFO. I found this place to be highly rated on yelp and went based on their recommendations. Getting there was pretty easy, and there was plenty of parking available on their back residential area lot.We ordered 2 of the Korean Bulgogi Beef burritos which were pretty good! I loved that their fries were cooked PERFECTLY and came with an amazing kimchi aoli. I seriously could drink that if i wanted!! The price is on the higher side. I spent about 35$ for 2 burritos, 1 fry, 2 drinks. Overall, the meal was pretty good and was exactly what we were looking for! Great customer service as well!

Good food, bad service. Which is strange, because the guy was polite enough to other tables. That said, good service is not what we come here for.The walnut prawns are always good. Don't expect authentic Chinese food here. It's American Chinese food, and it's pretty good.

Had no idea this place was so popular! Was looking for sandwiches on the way to the beach and this was the first joint that popped up. There was a long line outside when we pulled up and was thankful that I called ahead of time to order. (It only took 20min to make if you order ahead of time and you can walk straight up to the register to pickup and pay) The Ami-Cado is what I had - pastrami, salami and avocado with everything. That Lou's special sauce thoit gave a slight hint of spiciness that made the sandwich ê_ber delicious. The LLB Special was, in my opinion, just ok. Had a few bites to try it, but Dutch crunch just ain't my thing and I didn't enjoy one of the meats in there.

Not bad for the glen park neighborhood. Close too Bart and Muni. During the afternoon's this place is at its peak (IMO). Evenly placed pepperonis and at a reasonable price like the pizza shops in the mission.

This place is so good. The food is great and the staff is friendly. They have amazing pastas and risottos, and great chicken and veal dishes. They were very helpful, and even made a substitution for us.  •_The risotto I had was delicious, and the Osso Bucco special was incredible. When we had to wait for our table even after our reservation, they even gave us 2 free desserts. The Spumoni cake was great and their ice creams and sorbets are delicious.  •_Overall, a great restaurant!

This location used to be the very popular VIDEO CAFE. •_It was a 24 cafe and 30 years ago was the only 24 hour eatery which showed movies all day long. •_It's sad that it's no longer in business. Since this review is about DB, I'm Not impressed. I Ate here 2 times before writing this review. First of all the music thy were blaring was rap music with explicit content, which I did not appreciate. Secondly, they are over priced for what you get in quality of food. Quantity was on the small side, which I don't mind so much, so long as the quality and tastiness is there. I'm not sure why there's a line every weekend to get in. Both times I've come here with my family on a weekday, and we were one of a few other tables in the entire place. And this place is huge. They expanded it much bigger than VC used to be.Over all, I'm not sure if they use MSG because I didn't feel a flush

Great little, family owned Italian restaurant filled with Italian speaking waiters. Great atmosphere, wine list, apps, and entrees. They are known for their gnocchi and rabbit sauce dishes. Unfortunately, I'm gluten free and couldn't try either of those. But the waiter was knowledgable about what was and was not gluten free. I ended up having the veal! It was amazing!

Delicious dumplings spot with lots of choices! I came here with a friend and expected a little hole in the wall but this was a nice restaurant! It's not pricy but it's also not cheap I would say it's a good on between. I really loved the soup dumplings and would easily come back for more !The fried rice was on the dry side, I may pass on that next time a tastier dish. I found the items on the menu looked better than those being passed around.
izzeria|
